      • getClosingId

        public TField getClosingId()
        Returns the ClosingId

        Field description: Contains the IDs of FX.CLOSING.GROUP record, under which the current FOREX transaction is grouped. Validation Rules: Should be of 14 characters in length and alphanumeric System generated and a noinput field

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ClosingId

      • getClsDeal

        public TField getClsDeal()
        Returns the ClsDeal

        Field description: This field is an indicator to show if the transaction should be sent to CLS (Continiously linked settlements). The transaction will be sent to CLS if the Counterparty of the deal and both buy and sell currencies are members of the CLS initiative. A cross check is made to FX.CLS.CPARTY file. An override will be given if a transaction is entered where the value dates do not respect the cut-off time. If Counter-party, currency bought and currency sold are CLS enabled, then default CLS.DEAL = 'YES' Validation Rules: Valid inputs are YES or NO NO CHANGE field Defaulting to NO

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ClsDeal

      • getCoCode

        public String getCoCode()
        Returns the CoCode
        Parameters:
        Returns:
        String - The CoCode

      • getCollatPortCode

        public TField getCollatPortCode()
        Returns the CollatPortCode

        Field description: Part of Regulatory Reporting information to a Trade Repository An unique code given by the reporting counterparty to identify the portfolio, if collateralization is reported on a portfolio basis Input to this field is allowed only when OC module is installed and for FW or SW type contracts or when SUB.DEAL.TYPE is not 'IN' Validation Rules: This is a conditionally mandatory field Mandatory if the COLLAT.PORT.IND is set to 'Y' Numeric field up to 10 digits

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CollatPortCode

      • getCollatPortInd

        public TField getCollatPortInd()
        Returns the CollatPortInd

        Field description: Part of Regulatory Reporting information to a Trade Repository. Specifies if the collateralisation was performed on a portfolio basis Input to this field is allowed only when OC module is installed and for FW or SW type FX contracts or when SUB.DEAL.TYPE is not 'IN' Validation Rules: This is an OPTIONAL field Input not allowed when COLLATERALISATION is NULL Allowed optional values are Y , N or NULL Y indicates that the collateralisation was performed on a portfolio basis N indicates that the collateralisation was not performed on a portfolio basis

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CollatPortInd

      • getCollateralisation

        public TField getCollateralisation()
        Returns the Collateralisation

        Field description: Part of Regulatory Reporting information to a Trade Repository. specifies whether collateralisation was performed Input to this field is allowed only when OC module is installed and for FW or SW type FX contracts or when SUB.DEAL.TYPE is not 'IN' Validation Rules: This is an OPTIONAL field Allowed optional values are U(Uncollateralised),PC(Partially Collateralised),OC(One way collateralised),FC(Fully Collateralised) and NULL

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The Collateralisation

      • getCommissionTaken

        public TField getCommissionTaken()
        Returns the CommissionTaken

        Field description: Identifies the total amount of charges and commission taken in the currency of the account bearing the charges, i.e. in the currency of the account specified in the field ACCOUNT.TO.CHARGE. Any Tax defined on the charges and/or commission will not be included in this field. The amount indicated in this field will be the total of the charge amount detailed in the multivalue Field CHARGE.AMOUNT. It must be noted that once the commissions and charges amounts have been calculated, they will not be recalculated when the user changes the amount or any other field in the contract. If recalculation is positively requested, the user must clear the content of CHARGE.CODE and re-enter the appropriate charge codes. Validation Rules: System generated. Standard amount format.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CommissionTaken

      • getConfByCparty

        public TField getConfByCparty()
        Returns the ConfByCparty

        Field description: This field will be used by the confirmation facility (function code 'V') to store automatically the user identification, the date and time on which the CPARTY's confirmation was received and reconciled with the foreign exchange transaction. The Foreign Exchange application has a separate function code 'V' which allows the operator to record CPARTY confirmations on the screen. This process automatically passes a user identification date and time stamp into this field. The system also provides a list of all unconfirmed deals on a daily basis. Input in this field is normally not allowed. However, an 'O' (for Onesided) may be input to indicate that a confirmation is not expected from the CPARTY. In this case, the deal will not be shown on the unconfirmed deal input. Validation Rules: System generated or 'O' (Onesided) meaning no CPARTY confirmation is to be expected. Only 'O' accepted from operator.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ConfByCparty

      • getConfirmdByBroker

        public TField getConfirmdByBroker()
        Returns the ConfirmdByBroker

        Field description: This field will be used by the confirmation facility (function code 'V') to store automatically the user identification, date and time the brokers note was received and reconciled with the foreign exchange transaction. When a deal is handled through a Broker, the Broker confirms the details of the deal by issuing a 'Broker Note'. This note is checked by the bank to ensure that it agrees with the contract details. Any discrepancy must be resolved quickly as money may be lost as a result. The Foreign Exchange application has a separate function code 'V' which allows the operator to confirm broker notes on the screen. This process automatically passes a user identification, time and date stamp into this field. The system also provides a list of all unconfirmed deals on a daily basis. Input in this field is normally not allowed. However, an 'N' may be input to indicate that a Broker's Note is not expected. In this case, the deal will not be shown on the unconfirmed deal report. Validation Rules: System generated or 'N' meaning no broker confirmation is to be expected. Input may only be an 'N' to identify that no broker's note is expected. Input in this field will only be accepted when brokers details have been entered.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ConfirmdByBroker

      • getConsolInd

        public List<TField> getConsolInd()
        Returns the collection of ConsolInd

        Field description: Indicates the consolidation keys which have been generated for this contract. One key will be generated for each currency (bought and sold) of the contract. Validation Rules: System generated. The first four parameters will always contain the Application ID (i.e. FX), the Currency Market, the Position Type and the Currency Code. The other parameters will default on the conditions defined in the file CONSOLIDATE.COND.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getConsolInd

        public TField getConsolInd(int idx)
        Returns the ConsolInd at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: Indicates the consolidation keys which have been generated for this contract. One key will be generated for each currency (bought and sold) of the contract. Validation Rules: System generated. The first four parameters will always contain the Application ID (i.e. FX), the Currency Market, the Position Type and the Currency Code. The other parameters will default on the conditions defined in the file CONSOLIDATE.COND.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getContractGrp

        public TField getContractGrp()
        Returns the ContractGrp

        Field description: 1.Allows particular groups of contracts to be identified. 2.The conditions which determine a particular CONTRACT.GRP code are defined in the FOREX record of the APPL.GEN.CONDITION application 3.Each time the contract is changed the conditions will be re-evaluated which can result in a new CONTRACT.GRP code. If the CONTRACT.GRP value changes then this can result in a new FTT.TAX.TYPE.KEY being allocated depending on the set up of the relevant TAX.TYPE.CONDITION record.However, the conditions will not re-evaluated after authorization. Validation Rules : 5 character alphanumeric

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ContractGrp

      • getCorrAmendMkr

        public TField getCorrAmendMkr()
        Returns the CorrAmendMkr

        Field description: Indicates, in SWIFT terminology, if this is a correction or an amendment. It is used to indicate the code word to be used on a SWIFT confirmation. Validation Rules: Up to 7 SWIFT type characters: A for AMEND, C for CORRECT. Mandatory input when REPLACING.DEAL.NO present. Default = None.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CorrAmendMkr

      • getCounterparty

        public TField getCounterparty()
        Returns the Counterparty

        Field description: Contains the counterparty with whom the dealer has arranged the Foreign Exchange transaction. This field contains the counterparty with whom the deal was made. Its content will depend upon the value of the entry made in DEAL.SUB.TYPE. For each value of the field DEAL.SUB.TYPE, the following rules will apply for the counterparty: The counterparty is external and known to the dealer. Any counterparty existing on the Customer file will be accepted. The customer can be entered as a number or mnemonic. The liability number assigned to this counterparty in the customer file will be used for the limit checking. BR Input in this field is not allowed for BRoker deals as it is assumed that initially the counterparty would not be known. When the counterparty is known, remove the BR from the DEAL.SUB.TYPE field and enter the customer details. IN For internal deals (DEAL.SUB.TYPE = 'IN'), input is restricted to a valid dealer as defined in the Dealer Desk table. In other words, the dealer must enter the number of the other dealer. When OC module is installed and Forex contracts are required to be reported to a trade repository, the Customer ID of the Counterparty must be a valid record in OC.CUSTOMER table. This check is performed only for FW or SW type contracts and when the SUB.DEAL.TYPE is not IN Validation Rules: 1-6 Numeric character Customer Number or 3-10 character customer mnemonic (uppercase alphanumeric or '.') - Type MNE or 1-2 numeric character dealer desk number or up to 10 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Input in this field is mandatory except when DEAL.SUB.TYPE = 'BR', in which case input is not allowed.) Input not allowed on broker deals (sub-type 'BR') Input must be a valid Dealer Desk for internal deals (sub-type 'IN'). For all other deals, the field must be entered and refer to a valid customer.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The Counterparty

      • getCpTradePurpose

        public TField getCpTradePurpose()
        Returns the CpTradePurpose

        Field description: Part of Regulatory Reporting information to a Trade Repository. Denotes if the contract is objectively measurable as directly linked to the other counterpartys commercial or treasury financial activity Input to this field is allowed only when OC module is installed and for FW or SW type FX contracts or when SUB.DEAL.TYPE is not 'IN' Validation Rules: This is an OPTIONAL field and value is User inputted Allowed optional values are YES, NO or NULL YES denotes that the contract is directly linked to the other counterpartys commercial or treasury financial activity NO denotes that the contract is not directly linked to the other counterpartys commercial or treasury financial activity Input allowed only when the Other counterparty is a NON FINANCIAL COUNTERPARTY This is a no change field

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CpTradePurpose

      • getCpyCorrCity

        public TField getCpyCorrCity()
        Returns the CpyCorrCity

        Field description: Represents the city of the counterparty correspondent when the counterparty correspondence bank is not known. The values specified will be mapped with SWIFT Option J code "/CITY/". For Example: : If user entered NEWYORK, system will populate it as /CITY/NEWYORK Validation Rules: Input is not allowed when a correspondent number has been entered. Input is allowed to maximum of 34 character If the user enters more than 34 characters, the system would truncate the text

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CpyCorrCity

      • getCpyCorrName

        public TField getCpyCorrName()
        Returns the CpyCorrName

        Field description: Represents the name of the counterparty correspondent when the counterparty correspondence bank is not known. The values specified will be mapped with SWIFT Option J code "/NAME/". For Example: If user entered BANK OF NEWYORK, system will populate it as /NAME/BANK OF NEWYORK Validation Rules: Input is not allowed when a correspondent number has been entered. Input is allowed to maximum of 34 character If the user enters more than 34 characters, the system would truncate the text

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CpyCorrName

      • getCurrNo

        public String getCurrNo()
        Returns the CurrNo
        Parameters:
        Returns:
        String - The CurrNo

      • getCurrencyBought

        public TField getCurrencyBought()
        Returns the CurrencyBought

        Field description: Details of the currency purchased are entered in this field. The input may be one of the following: - the user-defined alpha currency code - the user-defined numeric currency code For multi-leg deals, the currency details are automatically brought forward from the previous leg. This field is mandatory and contains the currency code of the currency which is purchased. The code can be entered in one of two formats: 1) Alpha format - This code will then comprise three alpha characters as defined in the currency table. It is recommended to use the standard SWIFT currency code which is the internationally recognised convention for currency codes. The following are examples of ISO/SWIFT codes: - USD = US Dollars - GBP = Pounds Sterling - DEM = Deutsche Marks - FRF = French Francs 2) Numeric format - In most Treasury operations, certain currencies are traded more often that others. To continually enter a three alpha character code would be unnecessarily time consuming. Currencies may therefore be given a numeric ranking between 1 and 999 on the Currency table. If USD is the most frequently traded currency it should have a numeric code of 1. Entering 1 will then access the details of US dollars from the Currency table. After the initial leg of a Swap deal has been entered, all further legs default to the currencies involved. For example, if dollars are purchased against Deutche Marks in the first leg, the default currency bought in subsequent legs will be Marks and no access to the field will be allowed. Validation Rules: 3 characters (uppercase alpha) - type SSS or 1-3 numeric characters Currency Code (Mandatory input) The currency code entered must appear on the Currency table. Currency bought and Currency sold may not have the same country identification (2 first letters of currency code). Dealing between LU'X' and BE'X' currency codes is prohibited. Both currency bought and currency sold may not be precious metals.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CurrencyBought

      • getCurrencyMarket

        public TField getCurrencyMarket()
        Returns the CurrencyMarket

        Field description: The system recognizes the need for a number of different markets within one currency. For this reason this field identifies which Exchange Rate Currency Market is accessed for this transaction. The system caters for the need to have more than one market within a given currency. The use of this field will only be applicable for those countries where the exchange market defines different rates for the same foreign Currency according to rules determined by the local authorities or local central bank. A typical example would be Belgium where foreign currencies are quoted on the Regular Market and also on the Free Market. Different sets of exchange rates will exist for these two markets. If the default FX movement on MU.TXN.GRP.CCY.MKT is specified as 'FX' this field will not allow input and the value 1 will be defaulted. If default movement is not specified as 'FX', then if DEAL movement type has been specified on MU.TXN.GRP.CCY.MKT the market specified will be defaulted ito this field and the field will be made no input. If neither 'FX' is set or DEAL movement is specified, then input is mandatory in this field and may not be changed after authorisation. It is possible to specify separate markets to be used for COMM.CHRG and BROKERAGE. Any commission or change entries generated will use the specified market for COMM.CHRG if set up and similary BROKERAGE entries will use the BROKERAGE market if set up. If not set up the DEFAULT MOVEMENT currency market will be taken. The system allows the user to view the Foreign Exchange position by currency market when more than one market is applicable. Validation Rules: 1 numeric The market entered must appear on the Currency Market table. This field cannot be changed after authorisation. The market must exist on the local CURRENCY record. The market must exist on the CURRENCY record for both BUY and SELLCCY.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CurrencyMarket

      • getCurrencySold

        public TField getCurrencySold()
        Returns the CurrencySold

        Field description: Details of the currency sold will be entered in this field. The input may be one of the following: - the user-defined alpha currency code - the user-defined numeric currency code For multi-leg deals, the currency details are automatically brought forward from the previous leg. This field is mandatory and contains the currency code of the currency which is sold. The code can be entered in one of two formats: 1) Alpha format - This code will then comprise three alpha characters as defined in the currency table. It is recommended to use the standard SWIFT currency code. The following are examples of ISO/SWIFT codes: - USD = US Dollars - GBP = Pounds Sterling - DEM = Deutsche Marks - FRF = French Francs 2) Numeric format - In most Treasury operations, certain currencies are traded more often that others. To continually enter a three alpha character code would be unnecessarily time consuming. Currencies may therefore be given a numeric ranking between 1 and 999 on the Currency table. If USD is the most frequently traded currency it should have a numeric code of 1. Entering 1 will then access the details of US dollars from the Currency table. After the initial leg of a Swap deal has been entered, all further legs default to the currencies involved. For example, if dollars are purchased against Deutche Marks in the first leg, the default currency sold in subsequent legs will be dollars and no access to the field will be allowed. Validation Rules: 3 characters (uppercase alpha) - type SSS or 1-3 numeric characters Currency Code (Mandatory input) The currency code entered must appear on the Currency table. Currency bought and Currency sold may not have the same country identification (2 first letters of currency code). Dealing between LU'X' and BE'X' currency codes is prohibited. Both currency bought and currency sold may not be precious metals.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CurrencySold

      • getDateTime

        public String getDateTime(int idx)
        Returns the DateTime at the specified position in this collection.
        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        String -

      • getDateTime

        public List<String> getDateTime()
        Returns the collection of DateTime
        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<String> -

      • getDealDate

        public TField getDealDate()
        Returns the DealDate

        Field description: Contains the date on which the deal was made. This field will contain the date on which the deal was made. As this will normally be the same as the system date, entering [new line] will automatically insert this date. The date entered may not be in the future but a date of one day back valued will be allowed. Any date greater than one day in the past will require an override. The system compares the date in this field against the value date fields or the option date (when input) to check if the deal is a spot or forward contract. The system holds the user defined spot and forward classification conditions on the FX.PARAMETERS table. The number of (working) days defined in the field 'SPOT.INTERNAL' on this table will decide the classification of the foreign exchange contract into Spot or Forward. Validation Rules: Any accepted T24 date format. (Optional input; Default = System date) The date must be in an acceptable format (see general rules). The deal date must not be later than the value date. The deal date must not be later than today's date. If the deal date is earlier than one day back-valued an override is required. For a spot deal, the days difference between the deal date and the value date (or option date when entered) must be within that specified on the FX.PARAMETERS table in the field SPOT.INTERNAL. For forward deals, the days difference between deal and value dates (or option date when entered) must be greater than that specified on the FX.PARAMETERS table in the field SPOT.INTERNAL. Once authorised, the deal date cannot be amended.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The DealDate

      • getDealMarket

        public TField getDealMarket()
        Returns the DealMarket

        Field description: Default deal market for deriving and checking the exchange rate. Validation Rules: 2 numeric. The market entered must appear on the Currency Market table. The market must exist on the CURRENCY record for both BUY and SELLCCY.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The DealMarket

      • getDealSubType

        public TField getDealSubType()
        Returns the DealSubType

        Field description: Defines if a deal is internal or non-standard within a specified DEAL.TYPE. The application handles the following deal sub-types: null = Normal IN or I = Internal deal BR or B = Broker deal (counterparty unknown) This field is used to define deals which are internal or non-standard as they affect future validation/processing. The system is capable of handling the following sub-types: null = Normal If nothing is entered in this field, it is assumed that the deal type specified in field 1 is standard. IN or I = Internal deal Internal deals are handled differently from standard deals due to the fact that their only purpose is to allow transfers between different positions or dealer desks. Obviously, there is no need for accounting entries, payments, advices etc. When an internal spot or forward deal is entered, the system will automatically update the positions of both dealer desks entered into the contract (COUNTERPARTY and DEALER.DESK). BR or B = Broker deal Where trading has been carried out through a broker and the counterparty is not known, 'BR' should be entered as the sub-type. The system will then expect broker and not counterparty details to be entered. To authorise the contract, however, the user will need to erase 'BR' from this field and enter the counterparty details. A special enquiry facility allows the user to search, by broker, those contracts where the counterparty is still missing. Validation Rules: 1 or 2 type AAA (alpha) characters deal sub-type (Optional input; default = Null). Input in this field (IN or BR ) is not allowed for contract type 'SW' (Swap contracts). BR deals cannot be authorised

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The DealSubType

      • getDealType

        public TField getDealType()
        Returns the DealType

        Field description: Identifies the nature of the Foreign Exchange deal being processed. The application handles three different types: - SP or S = Spot - FW or F = Forward (Outright) - SW = Swap The following deal types are processed by the Foreign Exchange application: SP or S = Spot deals. Spot deals involve the immediate exchange of one currency for another and, because these are usually the most common in the market, this deal type has been selected as the system default. To allow sufficient time for the bank to check details and transfer funds, the accepted standard for spot deals is two business days following the date of the transaction. The system allows this, or any other market standard, to be defined on the FX.PARAMETERS table. The validation process will verify that the value date of the contract does not exceed the number of working days defined in the field SPOT.INTERNAL on the FX.PARAMETERS table. FW or F = Forward deals Forward contracts refer to the buying and selling of foreign currency at future exchange rates for delivery in the future, i.e. at a date greater than the locally defined spot date. The period varies but usually would be for one, two, three, six, and twelve months hence. When the value date of the contract exceeds the number of working days defined on the FX.PARAMETERS table in the field SPOT.INTERNAL, the contract will be considered as forward. SW = Swap deals. Swap deals involve the exchange of currencies at the spot rate with an agreement to reverse the transaction with an identical amount of currency at a later date at a specified rate. Contract types such as Overnight (ON), Tom-Next (TN) or Spot-Next (SN) are by-products of this deal type. To assist in entering the swap, details of the first leg - the spot leg - are carried forward to the subsequent -forward- leg. A contract cannot be established on a forward/forward basis. Validation Rules: 1 or 2 alpha characters deal type (Optional input; default = SP) Only the above mentioned deal types will be accepted. The field cannot be changed after authorisation of the contract.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The DealType

      • getDealerDesk

        public TField getDealerDesk()
        Returns the DealerDesk

        Field description: Identifies the dealer desk position which needs to be updated by the deal being created. The dealer desk code is held on the position record so that the exchange position can be displayed at dealer desk level. Each deal on the system will be allocated a two-digit dealer desk code. This code will be used to maintain position at the dealer desk level. Validation Rules: 2 alphanumeric character dealer code in the range A-Z, a-z, plus 0-9. Optional input; Default = dealer desk defined on the user profile. The code entered must appear on the DEALER.DESK table. When entering an internal deal, the dealer must be different from the one entered in the counterparty field. The field cannot be changed once the deal has been authorised.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The DealerDesk

      • getDealerNotes

        public List<TField> getDealerNotes()
        Returns the collection of DealerNotes

        Field description: This element allows the Dealer to record any special information or free form narrative on first level input which is referred to by the back office. These details are for the benefit of the back office user. Validation Rules: 1-6 lines with up to 35 characters in each line.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getDealerNotes

        public TField getDealerNotes(int idx)
        Returns the DealerNotes at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: This element allows the Dealer to record any special information or free form narrative on first level input which is referred to by the back office. These details are for the benefit of the back office user. Validation Rules: 1-6 lines with up to 35 characters in each line.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getDeliveryDetails

        public TField getDeliveryDetails()
        Returns the DeliveryDetails

        Field description: This is an optional field if one or more of the currencies is a user defined precious metal.Should contain one of the valuesprovided in the dropdown list.If OTHER is selected ,User will have to give additional information in the field 'Terms.And.Conds which will be captured in Tag 77D in MT600 Validation rules : Mandatory Field 3 characters (uppercase alpha)

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The DeliveryDetails

      • getDeptCode

        public String getDeptCode()
        Returns the DeptCode
        Parameters:
        Returns:
        String - The DeptCode

      • getEquivIntBought

        public TField getEquivIntBought()
        Returns the EquivIntBought

        Field description: The local equivalent of the notional interest amount belonging to the contract amount bought. Revaluation methods 'IN' and 'IH' only. OR The amount of the apparant exchange profit generated by the premium/ discount on the currencies traded. Revaluation methods 'SL' and 'SF' only. This field is only used when the interest or interest/hedged revaluation method has been selected for a forward contract (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'IN' or 'IH') or when the currency bought is traded at a premium against the currency sold under straight-line or straight line funding method (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'SL' or 'SF'). It represents a discount under the 'SF' method if the amount is less than zero. The value which the system places in this field represents either the local equivalent of the interest element which will be accrued to profit & loss over the lifetime of the deal or the profit element which is to be amortised on a straight-line basis. In the case of interest method revaluation (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'IN'), this is the local currency equivalent of the amount which would be yielded by the contract amount (AMOUNT.BOUGHT), at the given interest rate (INT.RATE.BUY) over the lifetime of the deal. In the case of interest/hedged method revaluation (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'IH'), it is local currency equivalent of the amount which would be yielded by the notional principal amount (NOTIONAL.BUY.AMT), at the given interest rate (INT.RATE.BUY) over the lifetime of the deal. In the case of straight-line method revaluation (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'SL' or 'SF'), it is the local equivalent difference yielded by the difference between the SPOT.RATE and the exchange rate of the deal. In the case of interest and straight-line methods revaluation, the accruals which are represented by fields BUY.DAILY.ACC.L & BUY.ACC.TDATE.L will, when the deal reaches maturity, add up to the figure shown in this field. In the case of interest/hedged method revaluation, the interest accruals are accounted for in the currency of the deal (CURRENCY.BOUGHT) and booked across the exchange reserve account (interest received) at the prevailing spot rate of the day. The figure in this field is, however, used at maturity to balance the accrual amounts against the revaluation effect over the life of the contract. Validation Rules: Standard amount format. System generated field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The EquivIntBought

      • getEquivIntSold

        public TField getEquivIntSold()
        Returns the EquivIntSold

        Field description: The local equivalent of the notional interest amount belonging to the contract amount sold. Revaluation methods 'IN' and 'IH' only. OR The amount of the apparant exchange loss generated by the premium/discount on the currencies traded. Revaluation methods 'SL' and 'SF' only. This field is only used when the interest or interest/hedged revaluation method has been selected for a forward contract (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'IN' or 'IH') or when the currency bought is traded at a discount against the currency sold under straight-line or straight line funding method (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'SL' or 'SF'). It represents a premium under the 'SF' method if the amount is less than zero. The value which the system places in this field represents either the local equivalent of the interest element which will be accrued to profit & loss over the lifetime of the deal or the element of loss which is to be amortised on a straight-line basis. In the case of interest method revaluation (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'IN'), this is the local currency equivalent of the amount which would be yielded by the contract amount (AMOUNT.SOLD), at the given interest rate (INT.RATE.SELL) over the lifetime of the deal. In the case of interest/hedged method revaluation (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'IH'), it is local currency equivalent of the amount which would be yielded by the notional principal amount (NOTIONAL.SELL.AMT), at the given interest rate (INT.RATE.SELL) over the lifetime of the deal. In the case of straight-line method revaluation (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'SL' or 'SF'), it is the local equivalent difference yielded by the difference between the SPOT.RATE and the exchange rate of the deal. In the case of interest and straight-line methods revaluation, the accruals which are represented by fields SEL.DAILY.ACC.L & SEL.ACC.TDATE.L will, when the deal reaches maturity, add up to the figure shown in this field. In the case of interest/hedged method revaluation, the interest accruals are accounted for in the currency of the deal (CURRENCY.SOLD) and booked across the exchange reserve account (interest paid) at the prevailing spot rate of the day. The figure in this field is, however, used at maturity to balance the accrual amounts against the revaluation effect over the life of the contract. Validation Rules: Standard amount format. System generated field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The EquivIntSold

      • getEqvCode

        public List<EqvCodeClass> getEqvCode()
        Returns the unmodifiable collection of EqvCode
        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<EqvCodeClass> -

      • getEqvCode

        public EqvCodeClass getEqvCode(int idx)
        Returns the EqvCode at the specified position in this collection.
        Parameters:
        idx - index of the element to return
        Returns:
        EqvCodeClass -

      • getExecTimeStamp

        public TField getExecTimeStamp()
        Returns the ExecTimeStamp

        Field description: Part of Regulatory Reporting information to a Trade Repository. Denotes the date and time of execution of the transaction and is User inputtable field. Input to this field is allowed only when OC module is installed and for FW or SW types FX contracts or when SUB.DEAL.TYPE is not 'IN' Validation Rules: This is an OPTIONAL field The format should be "YYYYMMDDTHH:MM:SS+/-(UTC.TIME.ZONE)" or "YYYYMMDDTHH:MM:SSZ" Example 20150101T10:10:10+05:30 Example 20150101T10:10:10-05:30 Example 20150101T10:10:10Z

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ExecTimeStamp

      • getExecVenue

        public TField getExecVenue()
        Returns the ExecVenue

        Field description: Part of Regulatory Reporting information to a Trade Repository. Specifies the unique code that identifies the venue of execution Provides a drop down list of the OC.EXCHANGE.FACILITY records Input to this field is allowed only when OC module is installed and for FW or SW type FX contracts or when SUB.DEAL.TYPE is not 'IN' or BR Validation Rules: This is an OPTIONAL field Can contain up to 10 alphanumeric characters

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ExecVenue

      • getFedFunds

        public TField getFedFunds()
        Returns the FedFunds

        Field description: The field identifies whether the amounts are Clearing House funds ('C') or Federal Reserve funds ('F'). This field is not used at present and input to it will not be allowed. After validation 'C' will be displayed in the field when the currency bought or sold involves USD. This field is not used at present. The interpretation of the values is: F U.S. Dollar payment is to be in "FED" i.e. Federal Funds. C U.S. Dollar payment is not to be in Federal Funds but in ordinary US clearing house funds. Notes: i) Details ('F') or ('C') will only be displayed if one of the currencies involved is USD. ii) Details can only be 'C' in the present condition. Validation Rules: 1 character i.e. 'F' or 'C'. System Generated.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The FedFunds

      • getFixPlRealised

        public TField getFixPlRealised()
        Returns the FixPlRealised

        Field description: The date on which P&L from Revaluation, and any accruals were realised. The deal must be between 2 fixed currencies, the realistion date will generally be the night before the rates are fixed between the 2 currencies. Validation Rules: This is a NOINPUT, System Date field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The FixPlRealised

      • getForwardRate

        public TField getForwardRate()
        Returns the ForwardRate

        Field description: Identifies the exchange rate applicable to forward deals. The rate may be entered in full or as a 'premium-discount' over the spot rate. A '+' should be entered to signify a premium and a '-' for discount. The rate may also be derived using the FX margin functionality, where Treasury Rate and Margin Percentage are made available. Forward transactions are those with value dates further in the future than spot deals, usually for periods of one, two, three, six, and twelve months. These transactions involve an agreement to exchange currencies at an agreed rate on a specified future date. By entering into such a transaction, exchange risks can be avoided as the rate and settlement date remain the same regardless of what happens to the exchange rate. The actual forward rate, agreed at the time of the contract, is determined by the interest rates in the currencies concerned. For example, if dollar interest rates are 10% per annum and sterling 15%, it would be sensible to invest dollars in sterling and create a forward contract to re-purchase the dollars. However, the sterling forward exchange rate against dollar would be around 5% lower to reflect the interest rate difference between the two currencies. In the example, Sterling is worth less in the future in terms of dollars because it is the currency with the higher interest rate; sterling is said to be at a discount to dollars. As future dollars are worth more because of the interest rates differential, they are said to be at a premium in terms of sterling. The rate can be entered in this field as an actual forward exchange rate or as a premium/discount (identified with a preceeding + or -) which will then be added/subtracted to the spot rate defined in the previous field. If the spot rate is 2.00 and the forward rate 1.90, the forward rate can be entered as the 1.90 or as -.10 (i.e. a discount of .10 from the spot rate). Premium/discount is expressed as 'pips' which are defined on the Currency table for each currency. If, for example, +12 is entered as the premium on dollars and the Currency table shows a pip value of 4, the system will view this as a premium of 0.0012 to be added on the spot rate to derive the forward rate. Validation Rules: 1-12 type R (Standard Rate Format - up to 8 integer and 6 decimal) characters plus a decimal point or 1-15 type R (Up to 8 integer and 9 decimal) characters plus a decimal point when EXTENDED.PREC in SPF is set to Y. Or +/- NNNN where NNNN = Premium/Discount quoted in pips (see explanation in details). (Input is mandatory on forward deals or forward legs. Otherwise not allowed.) The rate must be in an acceptable format. The rate will be checked against the forward rate table and must be within the tolerance specified by the user on the currency table. If not, the operator will have to enter an override. The rate, amount bought, and amount sold must be complimentary.But, In case if the Treasury rate is entered with Margin Perc, only one amount is mandatory. When the Margin functionality isused to derive the contract rate, Forward rate is derived through the Treasury rate and Margin pips.Once the deal has been authorised, this field cannot be amended. When the Margin Percenatge exists in the contract, Forward rate is non-inputtable.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ForwardRate

      • getFttCollCptyTax

        public TField getFttCollCptyTax()
        Returns the FttCollCptyTax

        Field description: Provides the option to T24 bank to collect the Financial Transaction Tax payable by the Counterparty also. If yes, accounting entries are raised to collect counterpartys tax wherein customer Account is debited and Tax suspense Account is credited. The values No or Null means T24 bank does not collect the FTT payable by the counterparty or in other words the counterparty himself remits the FTT. This option is provided on the premise that where the counterparty is a customer of the bank ( not an interbank counterparty) the T24 bank assumes responsibility to collect and pay the FTT payable by the customer Validation Rules: Values allowed are Yes, No or Null. Default value will be from FX.PARAMETERS but can be overridden by the User.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The FttCollCptyTax

      • getFttTaxAmtBase

        public TField getFttTaxAmtBase()
        Returns the FttTaxAmtBase

        Field description: Identifies the Tax Amount calculated in Tax Base Currency.The basis for the calculation would be the value in FTT.TAX.BASE.AMT field and the Tax rate defined in the corresponding FTT tax key. Validation Rules : No input field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The FttTaxAmtBase

      • getFttTaxAmtEur

        public TField getFttTaxAmtEur()
        Returns the FttTaxAmtEur

        Field description: Identifies the Tax Amount calculated in EUR, which is the Tax payable currency under EUFTT. The notional conversion between the FTT.TAX.BASE.CCY and EUR is based on mid-reval rate in currency record. Value populated in FTT.TAX.AMT.BASE is converted to EUR. Validation Rules : No input field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The FttTaxAmtEur

      • getFttTaxAmtLcy

        public TField getFttTaxAmtLcy()
        Returns the FttTaxAmtLcy

        Field description: Local equivalent of Financial Transaction Tax amount. Where the Tax currency and PL currency are different, using Mid-reval rate from the tax currency record, the LCY equivalent is calculated and accounting entries are based on this value. Validation Rules : No input field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The FttTaxAmtLcy

      • getFttTaxBaseAmt

        public TField getFttTaxBaseAmt()
        Returns the FttTaxBaseAmt

        Field description: Identifies the Tax Base Notional amount for Tax calculation. By default, it will be one of the contract notional amounts. The amount defaults corresponding to the currency present in the field FTT.TAX.BASE.CCY. In case, the Tax Base Notional amount requires any adjustment (for example tenor adjustment) to the contract notional, a customized routine can be attached to BASE.AMT.ROUTINE field of TAX application. Validation Rules : No input field. Associated with TAX.BASE.CCY

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The FttTaxBaseAmt

      • getFttTaxBaseCcy

        public TField getFttTaxBaseCcy()
        Returns the FttTaxBaseCcy

        Field description: Identifies the Tax Base Currency in which Tax amount is calculated.The logic to default the value is- if EUR is one of the two currencies then EUR else the Non-base Currency. User can change the value defaulted during input stage or INAU stage. Any change will result in a change in TAX.BASE.AMT field too and the tax calculations done already. Validation Rules : Can be one of the currency pair in the transaction. No Change field after authorization. Associated with TAX.BASE.AMT

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The FttTaxBaseCcy

      • getFttTaxKey

        public TField getFttTaxKey()
        Returns the FttTaxKey

        Field description: Identifies the Key from the Tax Table when the transaction is subjected for a Financial Tax. This field can be defaulted if the TAX.INTEREST.TYPE field is used. Validation Rules : No input field, system defaulted.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The FttTaxKey

      • getFttTaxTypeKey

        public TField getFttTaxTypeKey()
        Returns the FttTaxTypeKey

        Field description: Using this field together with the CONTRACT.GRP field it is possible to determine a particular tax code from conditions based on a. General tax type as defined in the TAX.TYPE.CONDITION application b. Type of customer as defined in the CUSTOMER.CHARGES application c. Type of contract as defined in the CONTRACT.GRP field. The value in this field must equate to a record in the TAX.TYPE.CONDITION application which contains tax codes related to customer tax group and contract group. Whenever tax is to be recalculated the correct tax code will be determined and the Tax related fields gets updated accordingly. Validation Rules : Optional input, must be present as a record on TAX.TYPE.CONDITION. The actual TAX.TYPE.CONDITION key value will be prefixed by the "*" character (asterisk).

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The FttTaxTypeKey

      • getFurtherIndent

        public TField getFurtherIndent()
        Returns the FurtherIndent

        Field description: This is mandatory field if one or more of the currencies is a user defined precious metal. This is a user input field denoting whether the required metal will be delivered (by physical movement) or transferred through book entry. The available options are : DELIVERY - Delivery TRANSFER Transfer Validation rules : Mandatory 8 characters (uppercase alpha)

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The FurtherIndent

      • getFwdFwdSwap

        public TField getFwdFwdSwap()
        Returns the FwdFwdSwap

        Field description: Denotes whether the Swap contract is a Forward to Forward (both the legs having a value date greater than the spot date) or Spot to Forward (First leg having a value date lesser than or equal to spot and second leg having a value date greater than value date of leg1) Input to this field is allowed only when DEAL.TYPE is 'SW' Validation Rules: This is an OPTIONAL field and value is User inputted Allowed optional values are YES, NO or NULL YES denotes that the contract is forward to forward swap contract, i.e the value date of leg1 should be a forward date NO or NULL denotes that the contract is spot to forward contract, i.e the value date of leg1 will be one of Today, Tomorrow, Spot. This is a no change field

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The FwdFwdSwap

      • getFxBulkOrdrId

      • getFxGroupCondId

      • getIdentification

        public TField getIdentification()
        Returns the Identification

        Field description: This field contains details to be mandatorily displayed in the contract confirmation for bullion trades. This field will be a no input field and its value will be created by the concatenation of the next 4 fields viz. DELIVERY.DETAILS(Optional), AVAILABILITY, ALLOCATION and METAL.TYPE. These are user input fields and are mandatory if one or more of the currencies is a user defined precious metal. Validation rules : No input field

      • getIntBasisBought

        public TField getIntBasisBought()
        Returns the IntBasisBought

        Field description: The interest day basis of the currency bought. Revaluation methods 'IN' and 'IH' only. This field is only used when the interest or interest/hedged revaluation method has been selected for a forward contract ( REVALUATION.TYPE , is 'IN' or 'IH'). The value is automatically taken from the currency record belonging to the CURRENCY.BOUGHT at the time the contract is entered. It is subsequently used by the system to perform daily accrual calculations. The possible values are as follows:

        ValueDays/Days in Year
        A 360/360
        B 366/360
        C 366/366
        D 360/366
        E 366/365
        F 360/365
        For illustrations of all supported INTEREST.BASIS types see: INTEREST.BASISValidation Rules: System generated field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The IntBasisBought

      • getIntBasisSold

        public TField getIntBasisSold()
        Returns the IntBasisSold

        Field description: The interest day basis of the currency sold. Revaluation methods 'IN' and 'IH' only. This field is only used when the interest or interest/hedged revaluation method has been selected for a forward contract ( REVALUATION.TYPE , is 'IN' or 'IH'). The value is automatically taken from the currency record belonging to the CURRENCY.SOLD at the time the contract is entered. It is subsequently used by the system to perform daily accrual calculations. The possible values are as follows:

        ValueDays/Days in Year
        A 360/360
        B 366/360
        C 366/366
        D 360/366
        E 366/365
        F 360/365
        For illustrations of all supported INTEREST.BASIS types see: INTEREST.BASISValidation Rules: System generated field.

        Parameters:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        IntFldIdClass -

      • getIntRateBuy

        public TField getIntRateBuy()
        Returns the IntRateBuy

        Field description: Identifies the interest rate applicable to the currency purchased. The forward exchange rates are usually directly related to the interest rates in the currencies being traded. For example, a Sterling loan receiving 10% funded by a USD deposit paying 12% appears unprofitable. However, the difference in interest rates will be reflected by the Forward Exchange rates with, in this case, the dollar becoming stronger against Pounds Sterling. The currency with a higher interest rate is usually dealt forward on a discount basis while the currency with a lower interest rate will normally be dealt forward with a premium. When the straight line, interest or interest/hedged revaluation method is specified, the system needs to know the interest rates for the two currencies being traded. For this reason on Forward contract, using one of these methods, the foreign exchange application will automatically default the interest rate of the contract BASE.CCY from the PERIODIC INTEREST rate table (prefixed by '01'). The OFFER rate applicable to the currency bought of the forward leg will be selected when the currency bought is the base currency. The BID rate applicable to the currency sold of the forward leg will be selected when the currency sold is the base currency. If the exact period is not found in this table the interest rate of the base currency will then be interpolated. The interest rate applicable to the second currency will then automatically be calculated according to the following formulas:

        1) Calculation of Non Base Interest Rate (IO) Old Formula (Used when the OLD.INT.RATE.CALC field is set to 'YES' and Revaluation type is SL or IN) IO = (100*(PO/NO))*(((RF-RS)/RS)+(IB*NB)/(PB*100))

        2) Calculation of Non Base Interest Rate (IO) New Formula (Used when the OLD.INT.RATE.CALC field is set to Null and Revaluation type is SL, IN or IH. Also used when the OLD.INT.RATE.CALC field is set to YES and Revaluation type is IH) IO= (((100+(IB*NB/PB))*RF/RS)-100)*PO/NO

        where, RS Spot Rate RF Forward Rate IB Interest rate of base currency IO Interest rate of other currency PB Interest day basis for base Ccy PO Interest day basis for other Ccy NB No of days for Interest accruals from spot date (Base Ccy) NO No of days for Interest accruals from spot date (Other Ccy)

        Validation Rules: 1-12 type R (Standard Rate Format - up to 8 integer and 6 decimal) characters plus a decimal point or 1-15 type R (Up to 8 integer and 9 decimal) characters plus a decimal point when EXTENDED.PREC in SPF is set to Y. (Input is optional on Forward contract using the straight line, interest or interest/hedged revaluation method; otherwise not allowed. Default: see details below.) The rate must be in an acceptable format. Input in this field will not be allowed for spot contract. Input in this field will not be allowed on Forward contracts using the 'Rebate' revaluation method.

        The below example sheds more light on the calculation of the Non base interest rates when Reval type is Straight Line/ Interest / Interest Hedged and Old Int Rate Calc is set to Null. The below calculation is also applicable when Reval Type is Interest Hedged and Old Int Rate Calc is set to YES.

        Buy Ccy: USD; Sell Ccy: GBP; Base Ccy: GBP Current T24 date: 20th Apr 2017; Spot Date: 24th Apr 2017; Value Date: 22nd May 2017 Revaluation type: IH; Old Int Rate Calc set to Null

        Description Value Variable
        Spot Rate 1.32 RS
        Forward Rate 1.34 RF
        From Periodic Interest Table of Base Ccy 0.25881 IB
        Interest Day Basis for Base Ccy 365 PB
        Interest day basis for Non Base Ccy 360 PO
        Interest Accrual days for Base Ccy from Spot date 28 NB
        Interest Accrual days for Non Base Ccy from Spot date 28 NO

        IB 0.25881 is defaulted from the periodic interest table. Since in the above example, the base currency is being sold the Bid rate for the respective period is being considered in the INT RATE SELL field. The INT RATE BUY, which is the interest rate of the other currency, is calculated using the formula, IO= (((100+(IB*NB/PB))*RF/RS)-100)*PO/NO Substituting the respective values in the corresponding variables, the INT RATE BUY will be 19.739651784.

        The below example sheds more light on the calculation of the Non base interest rates when Reval type is Straight Line/ Interest and Old Int Rate Calc is set to YES. Buy Ccy: USD; Sell Ccy: GBP; Base Ccy: GBP Current T24 date: 20th Apr 2017; Spot Date: 24th Apr 2017; Value Date: 22nd May 2017 Revaluation type: SL; Old Int Rate Calc set to Yes

        Description Value Variable
        Spot Rate 1.32 RS
        Forward Rate 1.34 RF
        From Periodic Interest Table of Base Ccy 0.25881 IB
        Interest Day Basis for Base Ccy 365 PB
        Interest day basis for Non Base Ccy 360 PO
        Interest Accrual days for Base Ccy from Spot date 28 NB
        Interest Accrual days for Non Base Ccy from Spot date 28 NO

        IB 0.25881 is defaulted from the periodic interest table. Since in the above example, the base currency is being sold the Bid rate for the respective period is being considered in the INT RATE SELL field. The INT RATE BUY, which is the interest rate of the other currency, is calculated using the formula, IO = (100*(PO/NO))*(((RF-RS)/RS)+(IB*NB)/(PB*100)) Substituting the respective values in the corresponding variables, the INT RATE BUY will be 19.735784138.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The IntRateBuy

      • getIntRateSell

        public TField getIntRateSell()
        Returns the IntRateSell

        Field description: Identifies the interest rate applicable to the currency sold. The forward exchange rates are usually directly related to the interest rates in the currencies being traded. For example, a Sterling loan receiving 10% funded by a USD deposit paying 12% appears unprofitable. However, the difference in interest rates will be reflected by the Forward Exchange rates with, in this case, the dollar becoming stronger against Pounds Sterling. The currency with a higher interest rate is usually dealt forward on a discount basis while the currency with a lower interest rate will normally be dealt forward with a premium. When the straight line, interest or interest/hedged revaluation method is specified, the system needs to know the interest rates for the two currencies being traded. For this reason on Forward contract, using one of these methods, the foreign exchange application will automatically default the interest rate of the contract BASE.CCY from the PERIODIC INTEREST rate table (prefixed by '01'). The OFFER rate applicable to the currency bought of the forward leg will be selected when the currency bought is the base currency. The BID rate applicable to the currency sold of the forward leg will be selected when the currency sold is the base currency. If the exact period is not found in this table the interest rate of the base currency will then be interpolated. The interest rate applicable to the second currency will then automatically be calculated according to the following formulas:

        1) Calculation of Non Base Interest Rate (IO) Old Formula (Used when the OLD.INT.RATE.CALC field is set to 'YES' and Revaluation type is SL or IN) IO = (100*(PO/NO))*(((RF-RS)/RS)+(IB*NB)/(PB*100))

        2) Calculation of Non Base Interest Rate (IO) New Formula (Used when the OLD.INT.RATE.CALC field is set to Null and Revaluation type is SL, IN or IH. Also used when the OLD.INT.RATE.CALC field is set to YES and Revaluation type is IH) IO= (((100+(IB*NB/PB))*RF/RS)-100)*PO/NO

        where, RS Spot Rate RF Forward Rate IB Interest rate of base currency IO Interest rate of other currency PB Interest day basis for base Ccy PO Interest day basis for other Ccy NB No of days for Interest accruals from spot date (Base Ccy) NO No of days for Interest accruals from spot date (Other Ccy)

        Validation Rules: 1-12 type R (Standard Rate Format - up to 8 integer and 6 decimal) characters plus a decimal point or 1-15 type R (Up to 8 integer and 9 decimal) characters plus a decimal point when EXTENDED.PREC in SPF is set to Y. (Input is optional on Forward contract using the straight line, interest or interest/hedged revaluation method; otherwise not allowed. Default: see details below.) The rate must be in an acceptable format. Input in this field will not be allowed for spot contract. Input in this field will not be allowed on Forward contracts using the 'Rebate' revaluation method.

        The below example sheds more light on the calculation of the Non base interest rates when Reval type is Straight Line/ Interest / Interest Hedged and Old Int Rate Calc is set to Null. The below calculation is also applicable when Reval Type is Interest Hedged and Old Int Rate Calc is set to YES. Buy Ccy: GBP; Sell Ccy: USD; Base Ccy: GBP Current T24 date: 20th Apr 2017; Spot Date: 24th Apr 2017; Value Date: 22nd May 2017 Revaluation type: IH; Old Int Rate Calc set to Null

        Description Value Variable
        Spot Rate 1.32 RS
        Forward Rate 1.34 RF
        From Periodic Interest Table of Base Ccy 0.25962 IB
        Interest Day Basis for Base Ccy 365 PB
        Interest day basis for Non Base Ccy 360 PO
        Interest Accrual days for Base Ccy from Spot date 28 NB
        Interest Accrual days for Non Base Ccy from Spot date 28 NO

        IB 0.25962 is defaulted from the periodic interest table. Since in the above example, the base currency is being bought the offer rate for the respective period is being considered in the INT RATE BUY field. The INT RATE SELL, which is the interest rate of the other currency, is calculated using the formula, IO= (((100+(IB*NB/PB))*RF/RS)-100)*PO/NO Substituting the respective values in the corresponding variables, the INT RATE SELL will be 19.740462793.

        The below example sheds more light on the calculation of the Non base interest rates when Reval type is Straight Line/ Interest and Old Int Rate Calc is set to YES. Buy Ccy: GBP; Sell Ccy: USD; Base Ccy: GBP Current T24 date: 20th Apr 2017; Spot Date: 24th Apr 2017; Value Date: 22nd May 2017 Revaluation type: SL; Old Int Rate Calc set to Yes

        Description Value Variable
        Spot Rate 1.32 RS
        Forward Rate 1.34 RF
        From Periodic Interest Table of Base Ccy 0.25962 IB
        Interest Day Basis for Base Ccy 365 PB
        Interest day basis for Non Base Ccy 360 PO
        Interest Accrual days for Base Ccy from Spot date 28 NB
        Interest Accrual days for Non Base Ccy from Spot date 28 NO
        IB 0.25962 is defaulted from the periodic interest table. Since in the above example, the base currency is being bought the offer rate for the respective period is being considered in the INT RATE BUY field. The INT RATE SELL, which is the interest rate of the other currency, is calculated using the formula, IO = (100*(PO/NO))*(((RF-RS)/RS)+(IB*NB)/(PB*100)) Substituting the respective values in the corresponding variables, the INT RATE SELL will be 19.736583042.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The IntRateSell

      • getIntermedCity

        public TField getIntermedCity()
        Returns the IntermedCity

        Field description: Represents the city of the intermediary when the intermediary bank is not known. The values specified will be mapped with SWIFT Option J code "/CITY/". For Example: : If user entered NEWYORK, system will populate it as /CITY/NEWYORK Validation Rules: Input is not allowed when an intermediary number has been entered. Input is allowed to maximum of 34 character If the user enters more than 34 characters, the system would truncate the text

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The IntermedCity

For Example: If user entered BANK OF NEWYORK, system will populate it as /NAME/BANK OF NEWYORK Validation Rules: Input is not allowed when an intermediary number has been entered.       • getLeg1FwdRate

        public TField getLeg1FwdRate()
        Returns the Leg1FwdRate

        Field description: This field is relevant in leg 2 of a forward to forward swap. It will hold the value of the FORWARD.RATE of leg1. Value in this field is allowed only when DEAL.TYPE is 'SW' and FWD.FWD.SWAP is set as 'YES' Validation Rules: System defaults the value only when the DEAL.TYPE is 'SW' and FWD.FWD.SWAP is set to 'YES' This is a no input field

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The Leg1FwdRate

      • getLimitReferenceNo

        public TField getLimitReferenceNo()
        Returns the LimitReferenceNo

        Field description: Contains the limit reference number for the counterparty. The reference can be entered by the operator or left blank. If left blank the system will provide the default Limit reference number for FOREX deals. The Limit system covers two main types of exposure as far as the FOREX application is concerned. These are: 1. Overall Foreign Exchange Limit Each deal is monitored against the overall foreign exchange limit of the respective counterparty to ensure that the bank is not overly exposed to this specific counterparty. This overall Foreign Exchange Limit can furthermore be sub-divided to allow definition of Time bands. This would allow to define different limits for Spot and Forward dealing. 2. Clean Risk or Delivery Risk Limit The clean risk limit is the maximum allowable value of foreign exchange transactions from the same counterparty to mature on any single day. For example, the bank may be prepared to have an Overall Foreign Exchange limit of GBP 20 Million with a given counterparty, but may want to limit the delivery risk on any one day to GBP 5 Million. The system does allow for netting of the Overall Foreign Exchange Limit for opposing deals with the same counterparty when the two opposing deals involve the same two currencies and mature on the same day. For example, if the bank buys USD 100,000 from a counterparty for GBP 70,000 to be settled on 31st December and then sells USD 50,000 to the same counterparty for GBP 35,000 to be settled on the same day (December 31st), the net effect would be an overall foreign exchange exposure of USD 50,000. Note that within this approach the Clean Risk is never netted. Validation Rules: Up to 7 numeric characters identifying a valid Limit Reference. (Optional input. Default = As defined on LIMIT.PARAMETER file.) Input is not allowed for internal, negotiated, or broker deals. Any input of a specific limit reference must refer to a FOREX limit type. Once the deal has been authorised this field cannot be amended if NET.OUTSTANDING in LIMIT.PARAMETER has been set as Y.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The LimitReferenceNo

      • getLinkReference

        public TField getLinkReference()
        Returns the LinkReference

        Field description: Enables transactions to be linked together for reporting purposes. Validation Rules: 1-12 alpha-numeric characters. (Optional input)

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The LinkReference

      • getLocalRef

        @Deprecated
        public LocalRefClass getLocalRef(java.lang.String name)
        Deprecated. Use getLocalReField or getLocalRefGroups instead
        Returns the LocalRefClass at the position matching the name in the collection of Local references.
        Throws a T24IllegalArgumentException if this fields denote a group of Local References (see getLocalRefGroups())
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the local references. (See LOCAL.REF.TABLE)
        Returns:
        LocalRefClass -
