        Returns the TermsAndConds at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: User can define the terms and conditions of the underlying agreement.

        This field can be used only for Metal Trades. Validation Rules: 1-35 Alpha-numeric characters. Input mandatory for non ISDA type Agreements.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getTotalIntBought

        public TField getTotalIntBought()
        Returns the TotalIntBought

        Field description: The notional interest amount belonging to the contract amount bought. Revaluation methods 'IN', 'IH' and 'SF' only. This field is only used when the interest, interest/hedged or straight line funding revaluation method has been selected for a forward contract (REVALUATION.TYPE is 'IN', 'IH' or 'SF'). The value which the system places in this field represents the interest element which will be accrued to profit & loss over the lifetime of the deal. In the case of the straight line funding method (REVALUATION.TYPE is 'SF'), this amount is the premium or discount of the Swap in the non Swap Base Currency, i.e. the bought currency. It is a premium when the amount is greater than zero; otherwise, it is a discount. In the case of interest method revaluation (REVALUATION.TYPE is 'IN'), this is the amount which would be yielded by the contract amount (AMOUNT.BOUGHT), at the given interest rate (INT.RATE.BUY) over the lifetime of the deal. In the case of interest/hedged method revaluation (REVALUATION.TYPE is 'IH'), it is the amount which would be yielded by the notional principal amount (NOTIONAL.BUY.AMT), at the given interest rate (INT.RATE.BUY) over the lifetime of the deal. In both cases, the interest accruals which are represented by fields BUY.DAILY.ACC.F & BUY.ACC.TDATE.F will, when the deal reaches maturity, add up to the figure shown in this field. In the case of interest method revaluation, this foreign currency figure is for information purposes (the interest accruals being booked in local equivalent). In the case of interest/hedged method revaluation, the interest accruals are accounted for in the currency of the deal (CURRENCY.BOUGHT). The figure in this field therefore represents the foreign currency amount which will be booked across the exchange reserve account (interest received) over the lifetime of the contract. Under the interest method, the value of TOTAL INT BOUGHT is calculated by the following formulae: IA = A * ( IR / 100 ) * ( STV / IDB ) where: IA = interest amount (bought) A = amount (bought) IR = interest rate (currency bought) STV = spot-to-value number of days (currency bought) IDB = interest day basis (currency bought) Under the interest/hedged method, the value of TOTAL.INT.BOUGHT is calculated by subtraction of the notional principal amount (NOTIONAL.BUY.AMT) from the contract amount (AMOUNT.BOUGHT). This calculation is equivalent to applying a similar formula to that shown above to the notional amount. Validation Rules: Standard amount format. System generated field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The TotalIntBought

      • getTotalIntSold

        public TField getTotalIntSold()
        Returns the TotalIntSold

        Field description: The notional interest amount belonging to the contract amount sold. Revaluation methods 'IN', 'IH' and 'SF' only. This field is only used when the interest, interest/hedged or straight line funding revaluation method has been selected for a forward contract (REVALUATION.TYPE is 'IN', 'IH' or 'SF'). The value which the system places in this field represents the interest element which will be accrued to profit & loss over the lifetime of the deal. In the case of the straight line funding method (REVALUATION.TYPE is 'SF'), this amount is the premium or discount of the Swap in the non Swap Base Currency, i.e. the sold currency. It is a discount when the amount is greater than zero; otherwise, it is a premium. In the case of interest method revaluation (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'IN'), this is the amount which would be yielded by the contract amount (AMOUNT.SOLD), at the given interest rate (INT.RATE.SELL) over the lifetime of the deal. In the case of interest/hedged method revaluation (REVALUATION.TYPE is 'IH'), it is the amount which would be yielded by the notional principal amount (NOTIONAL.SELL.AMT), at the given interest rate (INT.RATE.SELL) over the lifetime of the deal. In both cases, the interest accruals which are represented by fields SEL.DAILY.ACC.F & SEL.ACC.TDATE.F will, when the deal reaches maturity, add up to the figure shown in this field. In the case of interest method revaluation, this foreign currency figure is for information purposes (the interest accruals being booked in local equivalent). In the case of interest/hedged method revaluation, the interest accruals are accounted for in the currency of the deal (CURRENCY.SOLD). The figure in this field therefore represents the foreign currency amount which will be booked across the exchange reserve account (interest paid) over the lifetime of the contract. Under the interest method, the value of TOTAL.INT.SOLD is calculated by the following formulae: IA = A * ( IR / 100 ) * ( STV / IDB ) where: IA = interest amount (sold) A = amount (sold) IR = interest rate (currency sold) STV = spot-to-value number of days (currency sold) IDB = interest day basis (currency sold) Under the interest/hedged method, the value of TOTAL.INT.SOLD is calculated by subtraction of the notional principal amount (NOTIONAL.SELL.AMT) from the contract amount (AMOUNT.SOLD). This calculation is equivalent to applying a similar formula to that shown above to the notional amount. Validation Rules: Standard amount format. System generated field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The TotalIntSold

      • getTradeOrdId

        public TField getTradeOrdId()
        Returns the TradeOrdId

        Field description: This field will contain the FX.LIM.ORDER id on execution of which the FX trade had been generated Validation Rules: No input field System defaulted

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The TradeOrdId

      • getTradeRepository

        public TField getTradeRepository()
        Returns the TradeRepository

        Field description: Part of Regulatory Reporting information to a Trade Repository. Denotes the trade repository information Input to this field is allowed only when OC module is installed and for FW or SW type FX contracts or when SUB.DEAL.TYPE is not 'IN' Validation Rules: This is an OPTIONAL field Defaulted with value from OC.PARAMETER record User can override with a valid value in OC.TRADE.REPOSITORY record This is a no change field

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The TradeRepository

      • getTransactionType

        public TField getTransactionType()
        Returns the TransactionType

        Field description: This field contains the FOREX transaction type. Validation Rules: Mandatory input. Must point to a record on the FX.TRANSACTION.TYPE file. The first two characters must be the same as DEAL.TYPE. No change allowed.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The TransactionType

      • getTreasuryCustomer

        public TField getTreasuryCustomer()
        Returns the TreasuryCustomer

        Field description: Identifies if the CPARTY of the transaction is a Treasury Customer or not. When the user indicates that the CPARTY is not a Treasury Customer, he will be requested to enter a Treasury rate. The allocation of exchange earnings is then made automatically between Treasury and Marketing units at the time of the transaction. Any profit relating to the Marketing area (i.e. the difference between the contract rate and the Treasury rate) is immediately credited to the Profit and Loss category code 53006 with the Profit Center code of the CPARTY. The offset will be done in the same Profit and Loss Category code with the Profit center code of the corresponding Dealer desk. All exchange profit or loss on revaluation is therefore accrued to the Treasury area. More information, if needed, can be found in the CURRENCY table. Validation Rules: The following input will be allowed in this field: 'NULL' = which means that the CPARTYof the deal is a Treasury Customer. 'NO' = which means that the CPARTYof the deal is not a Treasury Customer. (Optional input; default value = Null, i.e. the CPARTY is a Treasury Customer.) Input in this field is not allowed when Deal sub type = 'IN' or 'BR'. When the value of 'NO' has been entered in this field, input of a Treasury rate will be mandatory.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The TreasuryCustomer

      • getTreasuryRate

        public TField getTreasuryRate()
        Returns the TreasuryRate

        Field description: Identifies an implied spread contained within the contract rate which represents the exchange profit attributable to the marketing unit (not Treasury) or the Margin applicable for a customer in an FX deal responsible for the customer. This spread is the difference between the Treasury rate input here and the contract rate. When the CPARTY of the Foreign Exchange transaction has not been defined as a Treasury customer, the allocation of exchange earning is made automatically between Treasury and Marketing units at the time of the transaction. Any profit relating to the Marketing area (i.e. Contract rate - Treasury rate) is credited to the Profit and Loss category code 53006 with the Profit Center code of the CPARTY. The offset will be done in the same Profit and Loss Category code with the Profit Center code of the corresponding Dealer desk. All exchange profit on revaluation will therefore accrue to the Treasury area. The value in this field is mandatory when the Margin percentage functionality is enabled (if the field "CUS.MARGIN.DEFAULT" in FX.PARAMETERS is set to "YES") or MARGIN.PERC field is entered in the contract. Validation Rules: 1-12 type R (Standard Rate Format - up to 8 integer and 6 decimal) characters plus a decimal point or 1-15 type R (Up to 8 integer and 9 decimal) characters plus a decimal point when EXTENDED.PREC in SPF is set to Y. Input is allowed when a) Treasury.Customer is NO or b) when Margin Perc field holds a value.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The TreasuryRate

      • getTyCpartyType

        public TField getTyCpartyType()
        Returns the TyCpartyType

        Field description: This field is introduced for the informative purpose to identify the type of counterparty. It has two options namely, IB and MD where, 1. IB stands for Inter-Bank Deal 2. MD stands for Merchant Deal. Though its an informative field, its kept as an open field to default the value from TFO as NOINPUT fields cannot be updated by TFO.

        Validation rules: 1. Non-mandatory field. 2. No change field. 3. Option field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The TyCpartyType

      • getUnevenSwap

        public TField getUnevenSwap()
        Returns the UnevenSwap

        Field description: System updates this field asY when the SWAP Base currency amount of near and far legs are is not identical and the Swap Period is either be standard i.e 1 week, 1 M , 3 M etc., or non-standard i.e. 5 days, 45 days etc. Validation Rules: NOINPUT field. Values are Y and Null

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The UnevenSwap

      • getUniTranId

        public TField getUniTranId()
        Returns the UniTranId

        Field description: Part of Regulatory Reporting information to a Trade Repository All Trades should have a Unique Transaction Identifier (UTI) which is generated, communicated and matched Determination of who generates the UTI should follow the existing industry best practices for that Asset class The UTI.USI.API attached in OC.PARAMETER and invoked during FX deal capture (FW and SW) determines who is the party responsible for UTI generation and does the following. If a value is present during deal capture the API is not invoked, on the assumption that the UTI is generated and supplied by the other Counterparty. If no value is present during the deal capture, the API is invoked to determine the party responsible for generating the UTI. If the Other counterparty is responsible, still an UTI is generated with a suffix as TEMP to show that the UTI from the other counterparty is awaited and in the meantime, the reporting is done with a Temporary ID. If T24 Bank is responsible for UTI generation, then the same is generated without TEMP. Where a reporting has been made with UTI having TEMP as suffix and subsequently the Counterparty supplies the UTI, the following procedure has to be followed to ensure reporting with actual UTI. The field Action Type needs to be changed to E and record to be authorized. Later, the UTI field should be modified with the actual UTI received. Set the Action Type field to N and authorize the record. In this way, the previous reporting gets cancelled and the new reporting goes with correct UTI. Input to this field is allowed only when OC module is installed and for FW or SW types FX contracts or when SUB.DEAL.TYPE is not 'IN' Validation Rules : can contain up to 52 alphanumeric characters

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The UniTranId

      • getUniqueProdId

        public TField getUniqueProdId()
        Returns the UniqueProdId

        Field description: Part of Regulatory Reporting information to a Trade Repository. Denotes the unique product identifier. Where a Unique Product Identifier (UPI)is available the same is mentioned here. Where it UPI is not available there are other alternatives allowed like ISIN, AII, CFI. Hence no validations are created Input to this field is allowed only when OC module is installed and for FW or SW type FX contracts or when SUB.DEAL.TYPE is not 'IN' Validation Rules: This is an OPTIONAL field

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The UniqueProdId

      • getValueDateBuy

        public TField getValueDateBuy()
        Returns the ValueDateBuy

        Field description: Indicates the value date applicable to the currency purchased. The liquidation of the Foreign Exchange contract will take place on the earliest date between the VALUE.DATE.BUY and the VALUE.DATE.SELL but taking into account the respective value dates. The Foreign Exchange application has two separate fields in which to record a value date for the currency bought and the currency sold. In most foreign exchange deals the two dates will be identical as both currencies will be dealt under the same value. However, in foreign exchange deals where one Middle East currency is involved it will often happen that, due to differences in country holidays, the two currencies could be dealt with a one or two days difference in their value date. In this case a specific input will then be done in the two fields VALUE.DATE.BUY and VALUE.DATE.SELL. In order to enter a Forex deal for which the value dates are not the same as each other, one or both currencies of the deal must be defined in the field SPLIT.VALUE.CCY on the FX.PARAMETERS table. If neither currency of the deal is listed on this table, any input to the field VALUE.DATE.BUY will automatically be assigned to the field VALUE.DATE.SELL and vice versa. If no input is done in the field VALUE.DATE.SELL, it will then default automatically to the value of the field VALUE.DATE.BUY. This date will be compared with the deal date to identify if the deal is a spot or forward contract. The classification of the deal as 'Spot' or 'Forward' will depend on the number of days defined in the field SPOT.INTERNAL on the FX.PARAMETERS table. The calculation of default spot date is also controlled by the FX.PARAMETERS fields FX.LCL.REGION and SPOT.BASE.CCY which allow the use of alternative or additional holiday tables. Where an OPTION.DATE is entered, it is this option date and not the VALUE.DATE.BUY entered in this field which is used to identify if the contract is to be classified as Spot or Forward. To ease user input, the following abbreviations will also be allowed: T = Todays date TO = Tomorrow S = Spot date as defined in the field Spot Market on the FX.PARAMETERS table. ON = Refers to a two leg SWAP contract where the value date on the first leg is equal to today's date and the value date on the second leg is equal to the next working day. The abbreviation 'ON' stands for 'OverNight'. TN = Refers to a two leg SWAP contract where the value date on the first leg is equal to the next working day and the value date on the second leg is equal to the following working day. The abbreviation 'TN' stands for 'Tom Next' i.e. 'Tomorrow - Next'. SN = Refers to a two leg SWAP contract where the value date on the first leg is equal to the spot date (see above) and the value date on the second leg is equal to the following working day. The abbreviation 'SN' stands for 'Spot Next'. NNA = Where NN is the number of days or months and A is either 'D' for calendar days, 'W' for working days or 'M' for months. Examples: IOD = 10 calendar days forward (from Spot) 10W = 10 working days forward (from Spot) 6M = 6 months forward (from spot) Validation Rules: The date may be entered in the standard date format or as one of the abbreviations explained in the details. (Input is mandatory for forward deals; otherwise input is optional). The date must be in an acceptable format (see general formats). A date less than today is not allowed except for Spot deals. Where the date entered is more than one day back value or more than one year forward value, an override is required. The date must be reasonable for the type of deal. In other words the validation process will check the deal date with the contract value date and compare the number of days with the value defined in the field SPOT.INTERNAL on the FX.PARAMETERS table. The deal type (FW or SP) must then be in agreement with the value defined in the table. The date must be a working day in the country (region '00') of the currency being traded. The forward leg of Swap deals must have a value date later than the Spot leg. The value date cannot be earlier than the deal date. Where the buy and sell value date are different an override will be required. The value date must not be earlier than the option date. The value date must not be earlier than the permitted maximum back-value period. The values 'ON', 'TN' and 'SN' will only be accepted when the Deal Type is equal to 'SW', i.e. it concerns a swap deal. In Swap deals where ON, TN or SN is specified on the first leg, access to this field will not be allowed on the forward leg. Input of the date is mandatory for forward contracts. With the input of ON, TN and SN, value dates on the first leg must be the same for the currency bought and the currency sold. Once the contract has been authorised the value date cannot be amended.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ValueDateBuy

      • getValueDateSell

        public TField getValueDateSell()
        Returns the ValueDateSell

        Field description: Indicates the value date applicable to the currency sold. The liquidation of the Foreign Exchange contract will take place on the earliest date between the VALUE.DATE.BUY and the VALUE.DATE.SELL but taking into account the respective value dates. The Foreign Exchange application has two separate fields in which to record a value date for the currency bought and for the currency sold. In most foreign exchange deals the two dates will be identical as both currencies will be dealt under the same value. However, in foreign exchange deals where one Middle East currency is involved it will often happen that, due to differences in country holidays, the two currencies could be dealt with a one or two days difference in their value date. In this case a specific input will then be done in the two fields VALUE.DATE.BUY and VALUE.DATE.SELL. in order to enter a Forex deal for which the value dates are not the same as each other, one or both currencies of the deal must be defined in the field SPLIT.VALUE.CCY on the FX.PARAMETERS table. If neither currency of the deal is listed on this table, any input to the field VALUE.DATE.BUY will automatically be assigned to the field VALUE.DATE.SELL and vice versa. If no input is done in the field VALUE.DATE.SELL, it will then default automatically to the VALUE.DATE.BUY. This date will be compared with the deal date to identify if the deal is a spot or forward contract. The classification of the deal as 'Spot' or 'Forward' will depend on the number of days defined in the field SPOT.INTERNAL on the FX.PARAMETERS table. The calculation of default spot date is also controlled by the FX.PARAMETERS fields FX.LCL.REGION and SPOT.BASE.CCY which allow the use of alternative and additional holiday tables. Where an OPTION.DATE is entered, it is this option date and not the VALUE.DATE.SELL entered in this field which is used to identify if the contract is to be classified as Spot or Forward. To ease user input, the following abbreviations will also be allowed: T = Todays date TO = Tomorrow S = Spot date as defined in the field SPOT MARKET on the FX.PARAMETERS table. ON = Refers to a two leg SWAP contract where the value date on the first leg is equal to today's date and the value date on the second leg is equal to the next working day. The abbreviation 'ON' stands for 'OverNight'. TN = Refers to a two leg SWAP contract where the value date on the first leg is equal to the next working day and the value date on the second leg is equal to the following working day. The abbreviation 'TN' stands for 'Tom Next' i.e. 'Tomorrow next'. SN = Refers to a two leg SWAP contract where the value date on the first leg is equal to the spot date (see above) and the value date on the second leg is equal to the following working day. The abbreviation 'SN' stands for 'Spot Next'. NNA = Where NN is the number of days or months and A is either 'D' for calendar days, 'W' for working days or 'M' for months. Examples: IOD = 10 calendar days forward (from Spot) 10W = 10 working days forward (from Spot) 6M = 6 months forward (from Spot) Validation Rules: The date may be entered in the standard date format or as one of the abbreviations explained in the details. (Input is optional; Default value = VALUE.DATE.BUY) The date must be in an acceptable format (see general formats). A date less than today is not allowed except for Spot deals. Where the date entered is more than 1 day back value or more than one year forward value, an override is required. The date must be reasonable for the type of deal. In other words the validation process will check the deal date with the contract value date and compare the number of days with the value defined in the field SPOT.INTERNAL on the FX.PARAMETERS table. The deal type (FW or SP) must then be in agreement with the value defined in the table. The date must be a working day in the country (region '00') of the currency being traded. The forward leg of Swap deals must have a value date later than the Spot leg. The value date cannot be earlier than the deal date. Where the buy and sell value date are different an override will be required. The value date must not be earlier than the option date. The value date must not be earlier than the permitted maximum back-value period. The values 'ON', 'TN' and 'SN' will only be accepted when the Deal Type is equal to 'SW' i.e. it concerns a swap deal. In swap deals where ON, TN or SN is specified on the first leg, access to this field will not be allowed on the forward leg. Once the contract has be authorised the value date cannot be amended.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ValueDateSell

      • insertAddlInfoMetal

        public void insertAddlInfoMetal(TField param, int pos)
        Insert the specified AddlInfoMetal to the specified position in the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to input additional information which corresponds to the Tag 72 on MT600,604,605 swift messages. Validation Rules: Multi-value field. 1-35 Alpha-numeric characters User can enter information in this field only if any of the fields among DELIVERY.DETAILS,METAL.TYPE and QUANTITY contains 'OTH'/'OTHR' Number of multi-values allowed on this field is based on the no of occurrence of 'OTH' value among the fields DELIVERY.DETAILS,METAL.TYPE and QUANTITY.

        Parameters:
        param - the AddlInfoMetal to append
        pos - The position where to insert the value.
        Returns:
        nothing

        public void insertConsolInd(TField param, int pos)
        Insert the specified ConsolInd to the specified position in the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the consolidation keys which have been generated for this contract. One key will be generated for each currency (bought and sold) of the contract. Validation Rules: System generated. The first four parameters will always contain the Application ID (i.e. FX), the Currency Market, the Position Type and the Currency Code. The other parameters will default on the conditions defined in the file CONSOLIDATE.COND.

        Parameters:

Validation Rules: 1-4 lines with up to 35 characters in each line.

      • insertOverride

        public void insertOverride(java.lang.CharSequence param, int pos)
        Insert the specified Override to the specified position in the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains all the Override messages which the user agreed to during Input. During the validation stage of a Foreign Exchange contract, the system may provide the user with a series of screen override messages to indicate an anomaly, for instance, that the exchange rate varies by more than the variation tolerance defined in the CURRENCY table. In the event that the user confirms the Override, the full text of the actual Override Message will be stored, for reference purposes only, in this multivalue field. For example, if the user inserts an 'abnormal' exchange rate the field corresponding to the exchange rate then when the deal is validated a warning bell will sound and a message will appear, at the foot of the screen, which reads: 'VARIANCE OF RATE EXCEEDS PERMITTED TOLERANCE' This will draw the user's attention to the rate entered, which may be a mistake and can then be corrected, or, on the other hand, it may be correct input and so the user confirms that this rate is really intended. A second example might be in respect of a contract done with a client who has a credit line established with the bank but where the maturity date of the intended Foreign Exchange contract goes beyond the credit line expiry date. In this case when the deal is validated a warning bell will sound and a message will appear, at the foot of the screen, which reads: 'LINE EXPIRES BEFORE TXN MATURITY' Once again the user's attention is drawn to the situation and either corrected or confirmed via a positive response to the Override Message. If, subsequently, the contract record is either fully displayed or printed, then all override messages will be present. Validation Rules: Internal field. Multivalue field.

        Parameters:
        param - the Override to append
        pos - The position where to insert the value.
        Returns:
        nothing

      • insertOverride

        public void insertOverride(TField param, int pos)
        Insert the specified Override to the specified position in the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains all the Override messages which the user agreed to during Input. During the validation stage of a Foreign Exchange contract, the system may provide the user with a series of screen override messages to indicate an anomaly, for instance, that the exchange rate varies by more than the variation tolerance defined in the CURRENCY table. In the event that the user confirms the Override, the full text of the actual Override Message will be stored, for reference purposes only, in this multivalue field. For example, if the user inserts an 'abnormal' exchange rate the field corresponding to the exchange rate then when the deal is validated a warning bell will sound and a message will appear, at the foot of the screen, which reads: 'VARIANCE OF RATE EXCEEDS PERMITTED TOLERANCE' This will draw the user's attention to the rate entered, which may be a mistake and can then be corrected, or, on the other hand, it may be correct input and so the user confirms that this rate is really intended. A second example might be in respect of a contract done with a client who has a credit line established with the bank but where the maturity date of the intended Foreign Exchange contract goes beyond the credit line expiry date. In this case when the deal is validated a warning bell will sound and a message will appear, at the foot of the screen, which reads: 'LINE EXPIRES BEFORE TXN MATURITY' Once again the user's attention is drawn to the situation and either corrected or confirmed via a positive response to the Override Message. If, subsequently, the contract record is either fully displayed or printed, then all override messages will be present. Validation Rules: Internal field. Multivalue field.

        Parameters:
        param - the Override to append
        pos - The position where to insert the value.
        Returns:
        nothing

      • insertStmtNo

        public void insertStmtNo(java.lang.CharSequence param, int pos)
        Insert the specified StmtNo to the specified position in the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: A number generated automatically by the system which identifies either a statement entry or a category entry in respect of a contract. The system will automatically insert a number into this field and this number may refer to a statement entry or a category entry depending on the value contained in the corresponding multivalue fields. The following examples will illustrate the use of this field. Example 1: On the value date of a Foreign Exchange contract there will be an entry on the our account pay and the following type of number will be generated at this field: 154.1 STMT.NO ............ 673732684.48 154.2 STMT.NO ............ 1 The number automatically generated in Field 104.1 is unique to the contract in question and is built in the following way: 1. The first four digits '6737' indicate the number of days since the 1st of January 1968. In our example, it corresponds to the 11th of June 1986. 2. The next five digits '32684' indicate the number of seconds since midnight. In our example, it corresponds to an entry generated on line at 09:04:44 AM. 3. The last two digits '48' indicate the number of hundreds of seconds. The value assigned (again automatically) to field 154.2 identifies the number in 154.1 as a statement entry number. If the user wishes to call this statement entry record on to the screen the user will invoke the STMT.ENTRY Application and then type the following at 'AWAITING ID': 673732684.480001 where the suffix '0001' identifies it as the first statement entry (there may be more than one as the next example will illustrate). Example 2: A second example outlined here is similar to example 1 in that there is a statement entry on value date for both the OUR.ACCOUNT.PAY and the OUR.ACCOUNT.RECEIVE. The system handles this case as follows: 154.1 STMT.NO ............ 673732684.48 154.2 STMT.NO ............ 1-2 Once again field 154.1 contains the identification number automatically generated by the system while field 154.2 now contains two separate numbers signifying that there are in fact two separate statement entries, one in respect of the OUR.ACCOUNT.PAY and one in respect of the OUR.ACCOUNT.RECEIVE. If the user wishes to see either of these he must first of all invoke STMT.ENTRY followed by the desired function and then at 'AWAITING ID' type either: 673732684.480001 where the addition of the suffix '0001' identifies the statement entry in respect of the OUR ACCOUNT PAY or 673732684.480002 where the addition of the suffix '0002' identifies the statement entry in respect of the OUR ACCOUNT RECEIVE. Example 3: A third example might be that of a category entry generated at initiation of a contract where commission or charges have been debited to the customer and credited to a profit and loss category code. In this case the following entries are generated on the contract: 154.1 STMT.NO ............ 673732684.48 154.3 STMT.NO ............ 1 Once again the standard type number is generated and inserted at field 154.1 Now, however, field 154.2 is replaced by Field 104.3 which now identifies the number in 154.1 as a category entry and not a statement entry. To call this category entry record onto the screen the user must now type: CATEG.ENTRY at 'AWAITING APPLICATION' followed by: 673732684.480001 at 'AWAITING ID'. Validation Rules: Internal multivalue field.

        Parameters:
        param - the StmtNo to append
        pos - The position where to insert the value.
        Returns:
        nothing

      • insertStmtNo

        public void insertStmtNo(TField param, int pos)
        Insert the specified StmtNo to the specified position in the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: A number generated automatically by the system which identifies either a statement entry or a category entry in respect of a contract. The system will automatically insert a number into this field and this number may refer to a statement entry or a category entry depending on the value contained in the corresponding multivalue fields. The following examples will illustrate the use of this field. Example 1: On the value date of a Foreign Exchange contract there will be an entry on the our account pay and the following type of number will be generated at this field: 154.1 STMT.NO ............ 673732684.48 154.2 STMT.NO ............ 1 The number automatically generated in Field 104.1 is unique to the contract in question and is built in the following way: 1. The first four digits '6737' indicate the number of days since the 1st of January 1968. In our example, it corresponds to the 11th of June 1986. 2. The next five digits '32684' indicate the number of seconds since midnight. In our example, it corresponds to an entry generated on line at 09:04:44 AM. 3. The last two digits '48' indicate the number of hundreds of seconds. The value assigned (again automatically) to field 154.2 identifies the number in 154.1 as a statement entry number. If the user wishes to call this statement entry record on to the screen the user will invoke the STMT.ENTRY Application and then type the following at 'AWAITING ID': 673732684.480001 where the suffix '0001' identifies it as the first statement entry (there may be more than one as the next example will illustrate). Example 2: A second example outlined here is similar to example 1 in that there is a statement entry on value date for both the OUR.ACCOUNT.PAY and the OUR.ACCOUNT.RECEIVE. The system handles this case as follows: 154.1 STMT.NO ............ 673732684.48 154.2 STMT.NO ............ 1-2 Once again field 154.1 contains the identification number automatically generated by the system while field 154.2 now contains two separate numbers signifying that there are in fact two separate statement entries, one in respect of the OUR.ACCOUNT.PAY and one in respect of the OUR.ACCOUNT.RECEIVE. If the user wishes to see either of these he must first of all invoke STMT.ENTRY followed by the desired function and then at 'AWAITING ID' type either: 673732684.480001 where the addition of the suffix '0001' identifies the statement entry in respect of the OUR ACCOUNT PAY or 673732684.480002 where the addition of the suffix '0002' identifies the statement entry in respect of the OUR ACCOUNT RECEIVE. Example 3: A third example might be that of a category entry generated at initiation of a contract where commission or charges have been debited to the customer and credited to a profit and loss category code. In this case the following entries are generated on the contract: 154.1 STMT.NO ............ 673732684.48 154.3 STMT.NO ............ 1 Once again the standard type number is generated and inserted at field 154.1 Now, however, field 154.2 is replaced by Field 104.3 which now identifies the number in 154.1 as a category entry and not a statement entry. To call this category entry record onto the screen the user must now type: CATEG.ENTRY at 'AWAITING APPLICATION' followed by: 673732684.480001 at 'AWAITING ID'. Validation Rules: Internal multivalue field.

        Parameters:
        param - the StmtNo to append
        pos - The position where to insert the value.
        Returns:
        nothing

      • insertSwapRefNo

        public void insertSwapRefNo(TField param, int pos)
        Insert the specified SwapRefNo to the specified position in the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field links together all legs of a swap deal by holding the reference number of each deal. It is generated automatically by the system and no operator input is allowed. On Swap deals, the Foreign Exchange Application will keep on each leg all the reference numbers of the various transactions which are part of the swap deal. This will allow the user to see on any leg of the contract, all other transactions involved in the swap deal. Validation Rules: Standard Foreign Exchange reference number. System generated. Multivalue field.

        Parameters:
        param - the SwapRefNo to append
        pos - The position where to insert the value.
        Returns:
        nothing

      • insertSwapRefNo

        public void insertSwapRefNo(java.lang.CharSequence param, int pos)
        Insert the specified SwapRefNo to the specified position in the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field links together all legs of a swap deal by holding the reference number of each deal. It is generated automatically by the system and no operator input is allowed. On Swap deals, the Foreign Exchange Application will keep on each leg all the reference numbers of the various transactions which are part of the swap deal. This will allow the user to see on any leg of the contract, all other transactions involved in the swap deal. Validation Rules: Standard Foreign Exchange reference number. System generated. Multivalue field.

        Parameters:
        param - the SwapRefNo to append
        pos - The position where to insert the value.
        Returns:
        nothing

      • insertTermsAndConds

        public void insertTermsAndConds(java.lang.CharSequence param, int pos)
        Insert the specified TermsAndConds to the specified position in the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: User can define the terms and conditions of the underlying agreement.

        This field can be used only for Metal Trades. Validation Rules: 1-35 Alpha-numeric characters. Input mandatory for non ISDA type Agreements.

        Parameters:
        param - the TermsAndConds to append
        pos - The position where to insert the value.
        Returns:
        nothing

        public void insertTermsAndConds(TField param, int pos)

        public boolean isLocalRefGroup(java.lang.String name)
        Return true if the field denoted by the param is a group.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the local references. (See LOCAL.REF.TABLE)
        Returns:
        boolean -

      • isModifiable

        public void isModifiable()
        Return if this object is modifiable or not
        Parameters:
        Returns:
        nothing

      • removeAddlInfoMetal

        public void removeAddlInfoMetal(int idx)
        Remove the AddlInfoMetal at the specified position in this collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to input additional information which corresponds to the Tag 72 on MT600,604,605 swift messages. Validation Rules: Multi-value field. 1-35 Alpha-numeric characters User can enter information in this field only if any of the fields among DELIVERY.DETAILS,METAL.TYPE and QUANTITY contains 'OTH'/'OTHR' Number of multi-values allowed on this field is based on the no of occurrence of 'OTH' value among the fields DELIVERY.DETAILS,METAL.TYPE and QUANTITY.

        Parameters:
        idx - index of the element to remove
        Returns:
        nothing

      • removeAddlRepInfo

        public void removeAddlRepInfo(int idx)
        Remove the AddlRepInfo at the specified position in this collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Part of Regulatory Reporting info to a Trade Repository. Denotes the additional report info when the ACTION.TYPE is 'O' Input to this field is allowed only when OC module is installed and for FW or SW type FX contracts or when SUB.DEAL.TYPE is not 'IN' Validation Rules: This is a conditionally mandatory field Value to be entered only when ACTION.TYPE is 'O'

        Parameters:
        idx - index of the element to remove
        Returns:
        nothing

      • removeConsolInd

        public void removeConsolInd(int idx)
        Remove the ConsolInd at the specified position in this collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the consolidation keys which have been generated for this contract. One key will be generated for each currency (bought and sold) of the contract. Validation Rules: System generated. The first four parameters will always contain the Application ID (i.e. FX), the Currency Market, the Position Type and the Currency Code. The other parameters will default on the conditions defined in the file CONSOLIDATE.COND.

        Parameters:
        idx - index of the element to remove
        Returns:
        nothing

      • removeDealerNotes

        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This element allows the Dealer to record any special information or free form narrative on first level input which is referred to by the back office. These details are for the benefit of the back office user. Validation Rules: 1-6 lines with up to 35 characters in each line.

        Parameters:
        idx - index of the element to remove
        Returns:
        nothing

      • removeNotes

        public void removeNotes(int idx)
        Remove the Notes at the specified position in this collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This element allows the user to record any special information or free form narrative. This narrative is for information only and will not be printed on the confirmation sent to the customer. These notes are for the benefit of the back/front office department and as such will not be output on the confirmation sent to the CPARTY. Validation Rules: 1-4 lines with up to 35 characters in each line.

        Returns:

      • removeOverride

        public void removeOverride(int idx)
        Remove the Override at the specified position in this collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains all the Override messages which the user agreed to during Input. During the validation stage of a Foreign Exchange contract, the system may provide the user with a series of screen override messages to indicate an anomaly, for instance, that the exchange rate varies by more than the variation tolerance defined in the CURRENCY table. In the event that the user confirms the Override, the full text of the actual Override Message will be stored, for reference purposes only, in this multivalue field. For example, if the user inserts an 'abnormal' exchange rate the field corresponding to the exchange rate then when the deal is validated a warning bell will sound and a message will appear, at the foot of the screen, which reads: 'VARIANCE OF RATE EXCEEDS PERMITTED TOLERANCE' This will draw the user's attention to the rate entered, which may be a mistake and can then be corrected, or, on the other hand, it may be correct input and so the user confirms that this rate is really intended. A second example might be in respect of a contract done with a client who has a credit line established with the bank but where the maturity date of the intended Foreign Exchange contract goes beyond the credit line expiry date. In this case when the deal is validated a warning bell will sound and a message will appear, at the foot of the screen, which reads: 'LINE EXPIRES BEFORE TXN MATURITY' Once again the user's attention is drawn to the situation and either corrected or confirmed via a positive response to the Override Message. If, subsequently, the contract record is either fully displayed or printed, then all override messages will be present. Validation Rules: Internal field. Multivalue field.

        Parameters:
        idx - index of the element to remove
        Returns:
        nothing

      • removePoBrReference

        public void removePoBrReference(int idx)
        Remove the PoBrReference at the specified position in this collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.
        Parameters:
        idx - index of the element to remove
        Returns:
        nothing

      • removePoReferenceTop

        public void removePoReferenceTop(int idx)

        Parameters:
        idx - index of the element to remove
        Returns:
        nothing

      • removeStmtNo

        public void removeStmtNo(int idx)
        Remove the StmtNo at the specified position in this collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: A number generated automatically by the system which identifies either a statement entry or a category entry in respect of a contract. The system will automatically insert a number into this field and this number may refer to a statement entry or a category entry depending on the value contained in the corresponding multivalue fields. The following examples will illustrate the use of this field. Example 1: On the value date of a Foreign Exchange contract there will be an entry on the our account pay and the following type of number will be generated at this field: 154.1 STMT.NO ............ 673732684.48 154.2 STMT.NO ............ 1 The number automatically generated in Field 104.1 is unique to the contract in question and is built in the following way: 1. The last two digits '48' indicate the number of hundreds of seconds. The value assigned (again automatically) to field 154.2 identifies the number in 154.1 as a statement entry number. Example 2: A second example outlined here is similar to example 1 in that there is a statement entry on value date for both the OUR.ACCOUNT.PAY and the OUR.ACCOUNT.RECEIVE. The system handles this case as follows: 154.1 STMT.NO ............ 673732684.48 154.2 STMT.NO ............ 1-2 Once again field 154.1 contains the identification number automatically generated by the system while field 154.2 now contains two separate numbers signifying that there are in fact two separate statement entries, one in respect of the OUR.ACCOUNT.PAY and one in respect of the OUR.ACCOUNT.RECEIVE. Validation Rules: Internal multivalue field.

      • setAccountOfficer

        public void setAccountOfficer(TField value)
        Set the specified value for AccountOfficer
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the account officer responsible for the relationship with the CPARTY. This information will be used by the Management Information System (MIS) for the determination of the Customer Profitability Analysis. This field has been provided to enable the user to override at transaction level the CPARTY default account officer defined in the CUSTOMER file. Validation Rules: 1-4 digit numeric field. (Optional input; Default value = account officer specified on the CPARTY's customer file.) The Account Officer Code must appear on the DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER table.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAccountOfficer

        public void setAccountOfficer(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for AccountOfficer
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the account officer responsible for the relationship with the CPARTY. This information will be used by the Management Information System (MIS) for the determination of the Customer Profitability Analysis. This field has been provided to enable the user to override at transaction level the CPARTY default account officer defined in the CUSTOMER file. Validation Rules: 1-4 digit numeric field. (Optional input; Default value = account officer specified on the CPARTY's customer file.) The Account Officer Code must appear on the DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER table.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAccountToCharge

        public void setAccountToCharge(TField value)
        Set the specified value for AccountToCharge
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the account that is to be debited for any charges or commission defined in the field CHARGE.CODE. An account number should be entered when charges or commissions are to be applied. Charges will be applied immediately at authorisation whatever the contract type. It is important to note that the currency of the ACCOUNT.TO.CHARGE must exist on the table (FT.CHARGE.TYPE or FT.COMMISSION.TYPE) referred to by the CHARGE.CODE. Whenever one of the amounts (AMOUNT.BOUGHT or AMOUNT.SOLD) is in the currency of the ACCOUNT.TO.CHARGE, this amount will be used to calculate the charge amount. If none of the amounts is in the currency of the ACCOUNT.TO.CHARGE, the AMOUNT.SOLD will be converted at the middle rate in the currency of the ACCOUNT.TO.CHARGE and the charges calculated on this converted amount. Validation Rules: Standard numeric account number or 3-10 type MNE (uppercase alphanumeric, or '.') character Account Mnemonic. (Optional input ; default value = None.) It must be a valid account number in the same company. If the customer of the account is not the same as the CPARTY, an override will be required. Input in this field is only allowed and will also be mandatory when a CHARGE.CODE is defined. The currency of the ACCOUNT.TO.CHARGE must exist on the CHARGE table.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAccountToCharge

        public void setAccountToCharge(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for AccountToCharge
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the account that is to be debited for any charges or commission defined in the field CHARGE.CODE. An account number should be entered when charges or commissions are to be applied. Charges will be applied immediately at authorisation whatever the contract type. It is important to note that the currency of the ACCOUNT.TO.CHARGE must exist on the table (FT.CHARGE.TYPE or FT.COMMISSION.TYPE) referred to by the CHARGE.CODE. Whenever one of the amounts (AMOUNT.BOUGHT or AMOUNT.SOLD) is in the currency of the ACCOUNT.TO.CHARGE, this amount will be used to calculate the charge amount. If none of the amounts is in the currency of the ACCOUNT.TO.CHARGE, the AMOUNT.SOLD will be converted at the middle rate in the currency of the ACCOUNT.TO.CHARGE and the charges calculated on this converted amount. Validation Rules: Standard numeric account number or 3-10 type MNE (uppercase alphanumeric, or '.') character Account Mnemonic. (Optional input ; default value = None.) It must be a valid account number in the same company. If the customer of the account is not the same as the CPARTY, an override will be required. Input in this field is only allowed and will also be mandatory when a CHARGE.CODE is defined. The currency of the ACCOUNT.TO.CHARGE must exist on the CHARGE table.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setActionType

        public void setActionType(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ActionType
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Part of Regulatory Reporting information to a Trade Repository. Under the Regulatory Reporting to a Trade Repository, it is not only the initial trade that is reported but also the life cycle events of the Trade that follow. A change in the action type is indicative of an event on the contract and requires to be reported. Change in Action Types is allowed both manually and automatically. Specifies the ACTION.TYPE that is populated based on the event on trade Input to this field is allowed only when OC module is installed and for FW or SW type FX contracts or when SUB.DEAL.TYPE is not 'IN' Validation Rules: Allowed optional values are N,M,E,C,Z and O N denotes that the ACTION.TYPE is NEW. Value of 'N' is defaulted for a new contract. User is also allowed to change the status to N if the previous status is E. E denotes that the ACTION.TYPE is REVERSE or Correction. In case of wrongly entered UTI values or a Temporary UTI was used previously, the old UTI should be reported with ACTION.TYPE as 'E' for error reporting first and then change the Action Type to NEW after keying in the actual UTI. This way the previous reporting with temporary UTI is replaced by the one with final UTI. Action Type E is also used to undo the reporting of a particular transaction done which should not have been done reported at all in the first instance. M denotes that the ACTION.TYPE is MODIFIED.A modification to any Primary Economic Terms (PET) like a partial settlement made in case of FX trades. C denotes the termination of the contract before its final maturity date. ACTION.TYPE is updated with the value as 'C' when full contractual amount has been delivered before the final maturity date Z denotes Compression update. This means the trade being reported is generated out of a compression activity. O denotes OTHER types. When OTHER is used, additional information as to what OTHER mean should be mentioned separately.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setActionType

        public void setActionType(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ActionType
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Part of Regulatory Reporting information to a Trade Repository. Under the Regulatory Reporting to a Trade Repository, it is not only the initial trade that is reported but also the life cycle events of the Trade that follow. A change in the action type is indicative of an event on the contract and requires to be reported. Change in Action Types is allowed both manually and automatically. Specifies the ACTION.TYPE that is populated based on the event on trade Input to this field is allowed only when OC module is installed and for FW or SW type FX contracts or when SUB.DEAL.TYPE is not 'IN' Validation Rules: Allowed optional values are N,M,E,C,Z and O N denotes that the ACTION.TYPE is NEW. Value of 'N' is defaulted for a new contract. User is also allowed to change the status to N if the previous status is E. E denotes that the ACTION.TYPE is REVERSE or Correction. In case of wrongly entered UTI values or a Temporary UTI was used previously, the old UTI should be reported with ACTION.TYPE as 'E' for error reporting first and then change the Action Type to NEW after keying in the actual UTI. This way the previous reporting with temporary UTI is replaced by the one with final UTI. Action Type E is also used to undo the reporting of a particular transaction done which should not have been done reported at all in the first instance. M denotes that the ACTION.TYPE is MODIFIED.A modification to any Primary Economic Terms (PET) like a partial settlement made in case of FX trades. C denotes the termination of the contract before its final maturity date. ACTION.TYPE is updated with the value as 'C' when full contractual amount has been delivered before the final maturity date Z denotes Compression update. This means the trade being reported is generated out of a compression activity. O denotes OTHER types. When OTHER is used, additional information as to what OTHER mean should be mentioned separately.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAddlInfoMetal

        public void setAddlInfoMetal(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified AddlInfoMetal to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to input additional information which corresponds to the Tag 72 on MT600,604,605 swift messages. Validation Rules: Multi-value field. 1-35 Alpha-numeric characters User can enter information in this field only if any of the fields among DELIVERY.DETAILS,METAL.TYPE and QUANTITY contains 'OTH'/'OTHR' Number of multi-values allowed on this field is based on the no of occurrence of 'OTH' value among the fields DELIVERY.DETAILS,METAL.TYPE and QUANTITY.

        param - the AddlInfoMetal to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAddlInfoMetal

        public void setAddlInfoMetal(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified AddlInfoMetal to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to input additional information which corresponds to the Tag 72 on MT600,604,605 swift messages. Validation Rules: Multi-value field. 1-35 Alpha-numeric characters User can enter information in this field only if any of the fields among DELIVERY.DETAILS,METAL.TYPE and QUANTITY contains 'OTH'/'OTHR' Number of multi-values allowed on this field is based on the no of occurrence of 'OTH' value among the fields DELIVERY.DETAILS,METAL.TYPE and QUANTITY.

        Parameters:
        param - the AddlInfoMetal to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAddlRepInfo

        public void setAddlRepInfo(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified AddlRepInfo to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Part of Regulatory Reporting info to a Trade Repository. Denotes the additional report info when the ACTION.TYPE is 'O' Input to this field is allowed only when OC module is installed and for FW or SW type FX contracts or when SUB.DEAL.TYPE is not 'IN' Validation Rules: This is a conditionally mandatory field Value to be entered only when ACTION.TYPE is 'O'

        Parameters:
        param - the AddlRepInfo to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAddlRepInfo

        public void setAddlRepInfo(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified AddlRepInfo to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Part of Regulatory Reporting info to a Trade Repository. Denotes the additional report info when the ACTION.TYPE is 'O' Input to this field is allowed only when OC module is installed and for FW or SW type FX contracts or when SUB.DEAL.TYPE is not 'IN' Validation Rules: This is a conditionally mandatory field Value to be entered only when ACTION.TYPE is 'O'

        Parameters:
        param - the AddlRepInfo to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAgreementType

        public void setAgreementType(TField value)
        Set the specified value for AgreementType
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description:

        Defines the contract's agreement type. The same should have been defined on the FX.AGREEMENT.TYPE table . Eg ISDA ( ISDA master agreement ) etc .

        This field corresponds to tag 77H on MT600 and MT300 Swift messages.If the Agreement type is OTHER,it is mandatory to furnish additional information in the field Term And Conds in Forex Template which corresponds to tag 77D in MT600 Swift messages

        Validation Rules

        Must be a valid definition on the FX.AGREEMENT.TYPE file.ID of this contain either one of the below format.

        TYPE.

        TYPE/DATE//VERSION.

        User can input values for both metal and non metal trades.

        Input mandatory for metal trade since tag 77H of MT 600 is mandatory.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAgreementType

        public void setAgreementType(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for AgreementType
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description:

        Defines the contract's agreement type. The same should have been defined on the FX.AGREEMENT.TYPE table . Eg ISDA ( ISDA master agreement ) etc .

        This field corresponds to tag 77H on MT600 and MT300 Swift messages.If the Agreement type is OTHER,it is mandatory to furnish additional information in the field Term And Conds in Forex Template which corresponds to tag 77D in MT600 Swift messages

        Validation Rules

        Must be a valid definition on the FX.AGREEMENT.TYPE file.ID of this contain either one of the below format.

        TYPE.

        TYPE/DATE//VERSION.

        User can input values for both metal and non metal trades.

        Input mandatory for metal trade since tag 77H of MT 600 is mandatory.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAllocation

        public void setAllocation(TField value)
        Set the specified value for Allocation
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This is mandatory field if one or more of the currencies is a user defined precious metal. This user input field indicates whether the metal required is allocated or unallocated. Validation rules : Mandatory field 5 characters (uppercase alpha)

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAllocation

        public void setAllocation(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for Allocation
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This is mandatory field if one or more of the currencies is a user defined precious metal. This user input field indicates whether the metal required is allocated or unallocated. Validation rules : Mandatory field 5 characters (uppercase alpha)

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAmortiseCycle

        public void setAmortiseCycle(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for AmortiseCycle
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Frequency at which position amortisation will take place. Validation Rules: 5 character standard T24 frequency field. Defaults to 'DAILY' if AMORTISE.POSITION = 'Y' otherwise defaults to null.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAmortiseCycle

        public void setAmortiseCycle(TField value)
        Set the specified value for AmortiseCycle
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Frequency at which position amortisation will take place. Validation Rules: 5 character standard T24 frequency field. Defaults to 'DAILY' if AMORTISE.POSITION = 'Y' otherwise defaults to null.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
