The USD amount of 333.33 will then be recorded in this field. 2. Interest/hedged revaluation method Let us suppose a Forward transaction whereby: 6MTH FWD we buy IM USD against 2,150,000 DEM. The spot rate is equal to 2.20 The INT.RATE.BUY is equal to 12% The INT.RATE.SELL is equal to 7,1441% The system will then calculate the daily interest amount on the notional principal underlying the amount bought, i.e. 943,835.33 x 12 x 1 ------------------- = 310.30 3600 which, converted at the rate of 1.50, produces a daily accrual in local currency of GBP (local currency) 206.87. The USD amount of 310.30 will then be recorded in this field. Note: ---- 1. Under the Straight Line revaluation Method, this field will not be activated. 2. More information on the Straight Line and Interest revaluation method can be found in the Help Text for REVALUATION.TYPE. 3. The following rules will be followed for the conversion of the foreign currency accrual amount to its local currency equivalent: o When the contract involves local currency, it will be converted at the contract FORWARD.RATE. o When the contract does not involve the local currency, the BASE currency accrual amount will be converted at the CURRENCY table middle rate and the non-base accrual amount at the contract FORWARD.RATE and the CURRENCY table middle rate of the BASE currency. Validation Rules: System generated. Standard amount format.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setBuyDailyAccL

        public void setBuyDailyAccL(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for BuyDailyAccL
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the daily local currency amount which is to be accrued on those 'Swap' or 'Forward' contracts where the revaluation type 'SL', 'IN' or 'IH' has been specified. In the case of Forward or Swap contracts done under the Straight Line revaluation method, the amount, which will be generated automatically by the system in this field, will be calculated based on the apparent exchange PROFIT generated by the forward nature of the transaction. This apparent exchange PROFIT expressed in local currency (i.e. the difference between BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SELL.LCY.EQUIV) will be spread over the period of the contract to provide a per dium accrual amount in local currency. In the case of Forward or Swap contracts done under the Interest revaluation method, the amount, which will be generated automatically by the system in this field, will be calculated based on the INT.RATE.BUY, i.e. the daily interest amount (expressed in local currency) generated by the AMOUNT.BOUGHT at the INT.RATE.BUY. In the case of Forward contracts done under the Interest/hedged revaluation method, the amount, which will be generated automatically by the system in this field, will be calculated based on the INT.RATE.BUY, i.e. the daily interest amount (expressed in local currency) generated by the NOTIONAL.BUY.AMT at the INT.RATE.BUY. Under the straight-line and interest methods of revaluation, this figure will normally be exactly the local equivalent amount at which each day's interest accrual is booked. It is, however, subject to an adjustment (on a rolling basis) to ensure that the entire net interest amount booked over the period of the accruals matches exactly the difference in BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SEL.LCY.EQUIV. Under the interest/hedged method of revaluation, the figure is for information purposes only. The accruals will actually be booked in foreign currency against a local equivalent at the prevailing spot rate. Examples: 1. Straight Line revaluation method Let us suppose a Forward transaction whereby: 6 MTH FWD we buy IM USD against 2,150,000 DEM (the Spot rate being 2.20). The apparent profit, i.e. DEM 50,000.00 will be accrued daily during the 6 month period (185 days in our example) and will generate a daily accrual of DEM 50,000.00 : 185 = DEM 270.27 which, converted at the rate of 3.30, produces a daily accrual in local currency of GBP (local currency) 81.90. This amount will then be recorded in this field. 2. Interest revaluation method Let us suppose a Forward transaction whereby: 6MTH FWD we buy IM USD against 2,150,000 DEM. The spot rate is equal to 2.20 The INT.RATE.BUY is equal to 12% The INT.RATE.SELL is equal to 7,5773% The system will then calculate the daily interest amount on the amount bought, i.e. 1,000,000.00 x 12 x 1 ----------------------- = USD 333.33 3600 which, converted at the rate of 1.50, produces a daily accrual in local currency of GBP (local currency) 222.22. This amount will then be recorded in this field. 3. Interest/hedged revaluation method Let us suppose a Forward transaction whereby: 6MTH FWD we buy IM USD against 2,150,000 DEM. The spot rate is equal to 2.20 The INT.RATE.BUY is equal to 12% The INT.RATE.SELL is equal to 7,1441% The system will then calculate the daily interest amount on the notional principal underlying the amount bought, i.e. 943,835.33 x 12 x 1 ------------------- = 310.30 3600 which, converted at the rate of 1.50, produces a daily accrual in local currency of GBP (local currency) 206.87. This amount will then be recorded in this field. Notes: ----- 1. Under the Straight Line revaluation Method, this field will only be activated when the exchange contract has been done with a profit, i.e. the SELL.LCY.EQUIV is smaller (in absolute value) than the BUY.LCY.EQUIV. 2. Under the Interest revaluation method, the difference between the value generated in this field and the value generated in the field SEL.DAILY.ACC.L will correspond exactly to the daily accrual generated under the Straight Line revaluation method. Validation Rules: System generated. Standard amount format.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setBuyDailyAccL

        public void setBuyDailyAccL(TField value)
        Set the specified value for BuyDailyAccL
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the daily local currency amount which is to be accrued on those 'Swap' or 'Forward' contracts where the revaluation type 'SL', 'IN' or 'IH' has been specified. In the case of Forward or Swap contracts done under the Straight Line revaluation method, the amount, which will be generated automatically by the system in this field, will be calculated based on the apparent exchange PROFIT generated by the forward nature of the transaction. This apparent exchange PROFIT expressed in local currency (i.e. the difference between BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SELL.LCY.EQUIV) will be spread over the period of the contract to provide a per dium accrual amount in local currency. In the case of Forward or Swap contracts done under the Interest revaluation method, the amount, which will be generated automatically by the system in this field, will be calculated based on the INT.RATE.BUY, i.e. the daily interest amount (expressed in local currency) generated by the AMOUNT.BOUGHT at the INT.RATE.BUY. In the case of Forward contracts done under the Interest/hedged revaluation method, the amount, which will be generated automatically by the system in this field, will be calculated based on the INT.RATE.BUY, i.e. the daily interest amount (expressed in local currency) generated by the NOTIONAL.BUY.AMT at the INT.RATE.BUY. Under the straight-line and interest methods of revaluation, this figure will normally be exactly the local equivalent amount at which each day's interest accrual is booked. It is, however, subject to an adjustment (on a rolling basis) to ensure that the entire net interest amount booked over the period of the accruals matches exactly the difference in BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SEL.LCY.EQUIV. Under the interest/hedged method of revaluation, the figure is for information purposes only. The accruals will actually be booked in foreign currency against a local equivalent at the prevailing spot rate. Examples: 1. Straight Line revaluation method Let us suppose a Forward transaction whereby: 6 MTH FWD we buy IM USD against 2,150,000 DEM (the Spot rate being 2.20). The apparent profit, i.e. DEM 50,000.00 will be accrued daily during the 6 month period (185 days in our example) and will generate a daily accrual of DEM 50,000.00 : 185 = DEM 270.27 which, converted at the rate of 3.30, produces a daily accrual in local currency of GBP (local currency) 81.90. This amount will then be recorded in this field. 2. Interest revaluation method Let us suppose a Forward transaction whereby: 6MTH FWD we buy IM USD against 2,150,000 DEM. The spot rate is equal to 2.20 The INT.RATE.BUY is equal to 12% The INT.RATE.SELL is equal to 7,5773% The system will then calculate the daily interest amount on the amount bought, i.e. 1,000,000.00 x 12 x 1 ----------------------- = USD 333.33 3600 which, converted at the rate of 1.50, produces a daily accrual in local currency of GBP (local currency) 222.22. This amount will then be recorded in this field. 3. Interest/hedged revaluation method Let us suppose a Forward transaction whereby: 6MTH FWD we buy IM USD against 2,150,000 DEM. The spot rate is equal to 2.20 The INT.RATE.BUY is equal to 12% The INT.RATE.SELL is equal to 7,1441% The system will then calculate the daily interest amount on the notional principal underlying the amount bought, i.e. 943,835.33 x 12 x 1 ------------------- = 310.30 3600 which, converted at the rate of 1.50, produces a daily accrual in local currency of GBP (local currency) 206.87. This amount will then be recorded in this field. Notes: ----- 1. Under the Straight Line revaluation Method, this field will only be activated when the exchange contract has been done with a profit, i.e. the SELL.LCY.EQUIV is smaller (in absolute value) than the BUY.LCY.EQUIV. 2. Under the Interest revaluation method, the difference between the value generated in this field and the value generated in the field SEL.DAILY.ACC.L will correspond exactly to the daily accrual generated under the Straight Line revaluation method. Validation Rules: System generated. Standard amount format.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setBuyLcyEquiv

        public void setBuyLcyEquiv(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for BuyLcyEquiv
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the local currency equivalent of the currency being purchased. The field will be calculated by the system and no operator input will be allowed. This local currency equivalent will be used when updating the currency position after successful validation. When Foreign Exchange deals are first entered into the foreign currency position, the local currency equivalent for both the BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SEL.LCY.EQUIV depends on the revaluation method specified in the corresponding contract. The following rules will be adhered to for each one of the revaluation methods below: REBATE METHOD The following rules will be followed: a) When the contract involves local currency It is always the local currency amount (AMOUNT.BOUGHT or AMOUNT.SOLD) which will be used to generate the local currency value in BOTH fields BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SEL.LCY.EQUIV. b) When the contract does not involve local currency The BASE amount of the contract will beconverted at contract FORWARD.RATE and the forward rate of the other currency (non base currency) to generate the local currency value in BOTH fields BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SEL.LCY.EQUIV. If for example: SPOT GBP/DEM = 3,30 SPOT GBP/USD = 1,50 FWD 3 MONTH GBP/USD = 1,48 FWD 3 MONTH GBP/DEM = 3,24 the following local currency equivalents will be calculated by the system for the next deals: Deal 1 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 1.48 (Spot Rate) :(1.50) Currency & Amount Sold : GBP 675,675.68 Value Date : 6 Months Dealer Desk : 01 Revaluation Type : RB SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-675,675.68 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 675,675.68 Deal 2 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 2.18 (Spot Rate) :(2.20) Currency & Amount Sold : DEM 2,180,000.00 Value Date : 6 Months Dealer Desk : 02 Revaluation Type : RB SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-672,839.51 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 672,839.51 STRAIGHT LINE METHOD The following rules will be followed: a) When the contract involves local currency - The local currency amount of the contract will be kept to generate the local currency value in its corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV, i.e: if AMOUNT.BOUGHT = Local currency, then AMOUNT.BOUGHT = BUY.LCY.EQUIV if AMOUNT.SOLD = Local currency, then AMOUNT.SOLD = SEL.LCY.EQUIV - The foreign currency amount of the contract will be converted at at the contract SPOT.RATE to generate the local currency value in its corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV. b) When the contract does not involve local currency - The BASE amount of the contract will be converted at the CURRENCY table middle rate of the BASE currency to generate the local currency value in its corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV. - The other foreign currency amount of the contract will be converted at the contract SPOT.RATE and the CURRENCY table middle rate of the BASE currency to generate the local currency value in its corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV. If for example: SPOT GBP/DEM = 3,30 SPOT GBP/USD = 1,50 the following local currency equivalents will be calculated by the system for the next deals: Deal 1 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 1.48 (Spot Rate) :(1.50) Currency & Amount Sold : GBP 675,675.68 Value Date : 6 Months Dealer Desk : 01 Revaluation Type : SL SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-666,666.67 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 675,675.68 Deal 2 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 2.18 (Spot Rate) :(2.20) Currency & Amount Sold : DEM 2,180,000.00 Value Date : 6 Months Dealer Desk : 02 BASE Currency : USD Revaluation Type : SL SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-666,666.67 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 660,606.06 INTEREST & INTEREST/HEDGED METHODS The same rules as the ones defined for the Straight Line method wiill be followed, i.e: a) When the contract involves local currency - The local currency amount of the contract will be kept to generate the lcoal currency value in the corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SELL.LCY.EQUIV, i.e: if AMOUNT.BOUGHT = Local currency, then AMOUNT.BOUGHT = BUY.LCY.EQUIV if AMOUNT.SOLD = Local currency, then AMOUNT.SOLD = SEL.LCY.EQUIV - The foreign currency amount of the contract will be converted at the contract SPOT.RATE to generate the local currency value in its corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV. b) When the contract does not involve local currency - the BASE amount of the contract will be converted at the CURRENCY table middle rate of the BASE currency to generate the local currency value in its corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV. - The other foreign currency amount of the contract will be converted at the contract SPOT.RATE and the CURRENCY table middle rate of the BASE currency to generate the local currency value in its corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV. If for example: SPOT GBP/DEM = 3,30 SPOT GBP/USD = 1,50 the following local currency equivalents will be calculated by the system for the next deals: Deal 1 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 1.48 (Spot Rate) :(1.50) Currency & Amount Sold : GBP 675,675.68 Value Date : 6 Months Dealer Desk : 01 Revaluation Type : IN Interest rate buy : 6.964504654 Interest rate sell : 9.75 SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-666,666.67 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 675,675.68 Deal 2 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 2.18 (Spot Rate) :(2.20) Currency & Amount Sold : DEM 2,180,000.00 Value Date : 6 Months Dealer Desk : 02 BASE Currency : USD Revaluation Type : IN Interest rate buy : 6.00 Interest rate sell : 4.191863385 SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-666,666.67 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 660,606.06 SPOT CONTRACTS The following rules will be followed: a) Where either the actual amount bought or amount sold happens to be in the local currency of the country (Deal 1), this amount will be adopted as the local currency equivalent for the other currency so that the fields BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SEL.LCY.EQUIV on the main Foreign Exchange contract will contain this same value. It is also this local currency value which will be used to update the Foreign Exchange position once the deal has been successfully validated. b) Where the local currency is neither the currency bought nor the currency sold (Deal 2), the system will calculate the local currency equivalent of the BASE currency/amount and apply it to both currencies of the contract so that fields BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SEL.LCY.EQUIV on the main Foreign Exchange contract will also contain the same value. To calculate this local currency equivalent of the BASE amount, the system will take the existing middle rate of the base currency as defined on the CURRENCY table. We have supposed here that on the CURRENCY table the middle rate GBP/USD is equal to 1,50. Like in the previous case it is also this local currency equivalent which will be used to update the Foreign Exchange position once the deal has been successfully validated. If for example: SPOT GBP/DEM = 3,30 SPOT GBP/USD = 1,50 the following local currency equivalents will be calculated by the system for the next deals: Deal 1 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 1.5000 Currency & Amount Sold : GBP 666,666.67 Value Date : SPOT Dealer Desk : 01 SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-666,666.67 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 666,666.67 Deal 2 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 2,2000 Currency & Amount Sold : DEM 2,200,000.00 Value Date : SPOT Dealer Desk : 02 BASE Currency : USD SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-666,666.67 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 666,666.67 Validation Rules: System Generated. Standard Amount Format preceded with the '-' sign.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setBuyLcyEquiv

        public void setBuyLcyEquiv(TField value)
        Set the specified value for BuyLcyEquiv
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the local currency equivalent of the currency being purchased. The field will be calculated by the system and no operator input will be allowed. This local currency equivalent will be used when updating the currency position after successful validation. When Foreign Exchange deals are first entered into the foreign currency position, the local currency equivalent for both the BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SEL.LCY.EQUIV depends on the revaluation method specified in the corresponding contract. The following rules will be adhered to for each one of the revaluation methods below: REBATE METHOD The following rules will be followed: a) When the contract involves local currency It is always the local currency amount (AMOUNT.BOUGHT or AMOUNT.SOLD) which will be used to generate the local currency value in BOTH fields BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SEL.LCY.EQUIV. b) When the contract does not involve local currency The BASE amount of the contract will beconverted at contract FORWARD.RATE and the forward rate of the other currency (non base currency) to generate the local currency value in BOTH fields BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SEL.LCY.EQUIV. If for example: SPOT GBP/DEM = 3,30 SPOT GBP/USD = 1,50 FWD 3 MONTH GBP/USD = 1,48 FWD 3 MONTH GBP/DEM = 3,24 the following local currency equivalents will be calculated by the system for the next deals: Deal 1 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 1.48 (Spot Rate) :(1.50) Currency & Amount Sold : GBP 675,675.68 Value Date : 6 Months Dealer Desk : 01 Revaluation Type : RB SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-675,675.68 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 675,675.68 Deal 2 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 2.18 (Spot Rate) :(2.20) Currency & Amount Sold : DEM 2,180,000.00 Value Date : 6 Months Dealer Desk : 02 Revaluation Type : RB SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-672,839.51 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 672,839.51 STRAIGHT LINE METHOD The following rules will be followed: a) When the contract involves local currency - The local currency amount of the contract will be kept to generate the local currency value in its corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV, i.e: if AMOUNT.BOUGHT = Local currency, then AMOUNT.BOUGHT = BUY.LCY.EQUIV if AMOUNT.SOLD = Local currency, then AMOUNT.SOLD = SEL.LCY.EQUIV - The foreign currency amount of the contract will be converted at at the contract SPOT.RATE to generate the local currency value in its corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV. b) When the contract does not involve local currency - The BASE amount of the contract will be converted at the CURRENCY table middle rate of the BASE currency to generate the local currency value in its corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV. - The other foreign currency amount of the contract will be converted at the contract SPOT.RATE and the CURRENCY table middle rate of the BASE currency to generate the local currency value in its corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV. If for example: SPOT GBP/DEM = 3,30 SPOT GBP/USD = 1,50 the following local currency equivalents will be calculated by the system for the next deals: Deal 1 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 1.48 (Spot Rate) :(1.50) Currency & Amount Sold : GBP 675,675.68 Value Date : 6 Months Dealer Desk : 01 Revaluation Type : SL SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-666,666.67 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 675,675.68 Deal 2 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 2.18 (Spot Rate) :(2.20) Currency & Amount Sold : DEM 2,180,000.00 Value Date : 6 Months Dealer Desk : 02 BASE Currency : USD Revaluation Type : SL SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-666,666.67 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 660,606.06 INTEREST & INTEREST/HEDGED METHODS The same rules as the ones defined for the Straight Line method wiill be followed, i.e: a) When the contract involves local currency - The local currency amount of the contract will be kept to generate the lcoal currency value in the corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SELL.LCY.EQUIV, i.e: if AMOUNT.BOUGHT = Local currency, then AMOUNT.BOUGHT = BUY.LCY.EQUIV if AMOUNT.SOLD = Local currency, then AMOUNT.SOLD = SEL.LCY.EQUIV - The foreign currency amount of the contract will be converted at the contract SPOT.RATE to generate the local currency value in its corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV. b) When the contract does not involve local currency - the BASE amount of the contract will be converted at the CURRENCY table middle rate of the BASE currency to generate the local currency value in its corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV. - The other foreign currency amount of the contract will be converted at the contract SPOT.RATE and the CURRENCY table middle rate of the BASE currency to generate the local currency value in its corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV. If for example: SPOT GBP/DEM = 3,30 SPOT GBP/USD = 1,50 the following local currency equivalents will be calculated by the system for the next deals: Deal 1 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 1.48 (Spot Rate) :(1.50) Currency & Amount Sold : GBP 675,675.68 Value Date : 6 Months Dealer Desk : 01 Revaluation Type : IN Interest rate buy : 6.964504654 Interest rate sell : 9.75 SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-666,666.67 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 675,675.68 Deal 2 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 2.18 (Spot Rate) :(2.20) Currency & Amount Sold : DEM 2,180,000.00 Value Date : 6 Months Dealer Desk : 02 BASE Currency : USD Revaluation Type : IN Interest rate buy : 6.00 Interest rate sell : 4.191863385 SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-666,666.67 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 660,606.06 SPOT CONTRACTS The following rules will be followed: a) Where either the actual amount bought or amount sold happens to be in the local currency of the country (Deal 1), this amount will be adopted as the local currency equivalent for the other currency so that the fields BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SEL.LCY.EQUIV on the main Foreign Exchange contract will contain this same value. It is also this local currency value which will be used to update the Foreign Exchange position once the deal has been successfully validated. b) Where the local currency is neither the currency bought nor the currency sold (Deal 2), the system will calculate the local currency equivalent of the BASE currency/amount and apply it to both currencies of the contract so that fields BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SEL.LCY.EQUIV on the main Foreign Exchange contract will also contain the same value. To calculate this local currency equivalent of the BASE amount, the system will take the existing middle rate of the base currency as defined on the CURRENCY table. We have supposed here that on the CURRENCY table the middle rate GBP/USD is equal to 1,50. Like in the previous case it is also this local currency equivalent which will be used to update the Foreign Exchange position once the deal has been successfully validated. If for example: SPOT GBP/DEM = 3,30 SPOT GBP/USD = 1,50 the following local currency equivalents will be calculated by the system for the next deals: Deal 1 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 1.5000 Currency & Amount Sold : GBP 666,666.67 Value Date : SPOT Dealer Desk : 01 SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-666,666.67 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 666,666.67 Deal 2 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 2,2000 Currency & Amount Sold : DEM 2,200,000.00 Value Date : SPOT Dealer Desk : 02 BASE Currency : USD SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-666,666.67 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 666,666.67 Validation Rules: System Generated. Standard Amount Format preceded with the '-' sign.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCategoryCode

        public void setCategoryCode(TField value)
        Set the specified value for CategoryCode
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the category code to which the deal will be accounted. This information will be used for MIS reporting and will identify the product being processed. Note: 1. A default category code may be specified for each deal type on the FX.TRANSACTION.TYPE file. 2. The product category code range for Foreign Exchange is 20000-20999. Validation Rules: 5 numeric digits in range 20000-20999. (Optional input; default value see note below.) The category code must be defined on the CATEGORY table. The category code must relate to the FX application.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCategoryCode

        public void setCategoryCode(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for CategoryCode
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the category code to which the deal will be accounted. This information will be used for MIS reporting and will identify the product being processed. Note: 1. A default category code may be specified for each deal type on the FX.TRANSACTION.TYPE file. 2. The product category code range for Foreign Exchange is 20000-20999. Validation Rules: 5 numeric digits in range 20000-20999. (Optional input; default value see note below.) The category code must be defined on the CATEGORY table. The category code must relate to the FX application.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setChargeCode

        public void setChargeCode(ChargeCodeClass param, int idx)
        Set the specified ChargeCode to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.
        Parameters:
        param - the ChargeCode to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setClosingId

        public void setClosingId(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ClosingId
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the IDs of FX.CLOSING.GROUP record, under which the current FOREX transaction is grouped. Validation Rules: Should be of 14 characters in length and alphanumeric System generated and a noinput field

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setClosingId

        public void setClosingId(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ClosingId
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the IDs of FX.CLOSING.GROUP record, under which the current FOREX transaction is grouped. Validation Rules: Should be of 14 characters in length and alphanumeric System generated and a noinput field

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setClsDeal

        public void setClsDeal(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ClsDeal
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is an indicator to show if the transaction should be sent to CLS (Continiously linked settlements). The transaction will be sent to CLS if the Counterparty of the deal and both buy and sell currencies are members of the CLS initiative. A cross check is made to FX.CLS.CPARTY file. An override will be given if a transaction is entered where the value dates do not respect the cut-off time. If Counter-party, currency bought and currency sold are CLS enabled, then default CLS.DEAL = 'YES' Validation Rules: Valid inputs are YES or NO NO CHANGE field Defaulting to NO

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setClsDeal

        public void setClsDeal(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ClsDeal
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is an indicator to show if the transaction should be sent to CLS (Continiously linked settlements). The transaction will be sent to CLS if the Counterparty of the deal and both buy and sell currencies are members of the CLS initiative. A cross check is made to FX.CLS.CPARTY file. An override will be given if a transaction is entered where the value dates do not respect the cut-off time. If Counter-party, currency bought and currency sold are CLS enabled, then default CLS.DEAL = 'YES' Validation Rules: Valid inputs are YES or NO NO CHANGE field Defaulting to NO

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCollatPortCode

        public void setCollatPortCode(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for CollatPortCode
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Part of Regulatory Reporting information to a Trade Repository An unique code given by the reporting counterparty to identify the portfolio, if collateralization is reported on a portfolio basis Input to this field is allowed only when OC module is installed and for FW or SW type contracts or when SUB.DEAL.TYPE is not 'IN' Validation Rules: This is a conditionally mandatory field Mandatory if the COLLAT.PORT.IND is set to 'Y' Numeric field up to 10 digits

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCollatPortCode

        public void setCollatPortCode(TField value)
        Set the specified value for CollatPortCode
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Part of Regulatory Reporting information to a Trade Repository An unique code given by the reporting counterparty to identify the portfolio, if collateralization is reported on a portfolio basis Input to this field is allowed only when OC module is installed and for FW or SW type contracts or when SUB.DEAL.TYPE is not 'IN' Validation Rules: This is a conditionally mandatory field Mandatory if the COLLAT.PORT.IND is set to 'Y' Numeric field up to 10 digits

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCollatPortInd

        public void setCollatPortInd(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for CollatPortInd
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Part of Regulatory Reporting information to a Trade Repository. Specifies if the collateralisation was performed on a portfolio basis Input to this field is allowed only when OC module is installed and for FW or SW type FX contracts or when SUB.DEAL.TYPE is not 'IN' Validation Rules: This is an OPTIONAL field Input not allowed when COLLATERALISATION is NULL Allowed optional values are Y , N or NULL Y indicates that the collateralisation was performed on a portfolio basis N indicates that the collateralisation was not performed on a portfolio basis

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCollateralisation

        public void setCollateralisation(TField value)
        Set the specified value for Collateralisation
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Part of Regulatory Reporting information to a Trade Repository. specifies whether collateralisation was performed Input to this field is allowed only when OC module is installed and for FW or SW type FX contracts or when SUB.DEAL.TYPE is not 'IN' Validation Rules: This is an OPTIONAL field Allowed optional values are U(Uncollateralised),PC(Partially Collateralised),OC(One way collateralised),FC(Fully Collateralised) and NULL

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Part of Regulatory Reporting information to a Trade Repository. specifies whether collateralisation was performed Input to this field is allowed only when OC module is installed and for FW or SW type FX contracts or when SUB.DEAL.TYPE is not 'IN' Validation Rules: This is an OPTIONAL field Allowed optional values are U(Uncollateralised),PC(Partially Collateralised),OC(One way collateralised),FC(Fully Collateralised) and NULL

        Returns:

      • setCommissionTaken

        public void setCommissionTaken(TField value)
        Set the specified value for CommissionTaken
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the total amount of charges and commission taken in the currency of the account bearing the charges, i.e. in the currency of the account specified in the field ACCOUNT.TO.CHARGE. Any Tax defined on the charges and/or commission will not be included in this field. The amount indicated in this field will be the total of the charge amount detailed in the multivalue Field CHARGE.AMOUNT. It must be noted that once the commissions and charges amounts have been calculated, they will not be recalculated when the user changes the amount or any other field in the contract. If recalculation is positively requested, the user must clear the content of CHARGE.CODE and re-enter the appropriate charge codes. Validation Rules: System generated. Standard amount format.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCommissionTaken

        public void setCommissionTaken(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for CommissionTaken
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the total amount of charges and commission taken in the currency of the account bearing the charges, i.e. in the currency of the account specified in the field ACCOUNT.TO.CHARGE. Any Tax defined on the charges and/or commission will not be included in this field. The amount indicated in this field will be the total of the charge amount detailed in the multivalue Field CHARGE.AMOUNT. It must be noted that once the commissions and charges amounts have been calculated, they will not be recalculated when the user changes the amount or any other field in the contract. If recalculation is positively requested, the user must clear the content of CHARGE.CODE and re-enter the appropriate charge codes. Validation Rules: System generated. Standard amount format.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setConfByCparty

        public void setConfByCparty(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ConfByCparty
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field will be used by the confirmation facility (function code 'V') to store automatically the user identification, the date and time on which the CPARTY's confirmation was received and reconciled with the foreign exchange transaction. The Foreign Exchange application has a separate function code 'V' which allows the operator to record CPARTY confirmations on the screen. This process automatically passes a user identification date and time stamp into this field. The system also provides a list of all unconfirmed deals on a daily basis. Input in this field is normally not allowed. However, an 'O' (for Onesided) may be input to indicate that a confirmation is not expected from the CPARTY. In this case, the deal will not be shown on the unconfirmed deal input. Validation Rules: System generated or 'O' (Onesided) meaning no CPARTY confirmation is to be expected. Only 'O' accepted from operator.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setConfByCparty

        public void setConfByCparty(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ConfByCparty
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field will be used by the confirmation facility (function code 'V') to store automatically the user identification, the date and time on which the CPARTY's confirmation was received and reconciled with the foreign exchange transaction. The Foreign Exchange application has a separate function code 'V' which allows the operator to record CPARTY confirmations on the screen. This process automatically passes a user identification date and time stamp into this field. The system also provides a list of all unconfirmed deals on a daily basis. Input in this field is normally not allowed. However, an 'O' (for Onesided) may be input to indicate that a confirmation is not expected from the CPARTY. In this case, the deal will not be shown on the unconfirmed deal input. Validation Rules: System generated or 'O' (Onesided) meaning no CPARTY confirmation is to be expected. Only 'O' accepted from operator.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setConfirmdByBroker

        public void setConfirmdByBroker(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ConfirmdByBroker
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field will be used by the confirmation facility (function code 'V') to store automatically the user identification, date and time the brokers note was received and reconciled with the foreign exchange transaction. When a deal is handled through a Broker, the Broker confirms the details of the deal by issuing a 'Broker Note'. This note is checked by the bank to ensure that it agrees with the contract details. Any discrepancy must be resolved quickly as money may be lost as a result. The Foreign Exchange application has a separate function code 'V' which allows the operator to confirm broker notes on the screen. This process automatically passes a user identification, time and date stamp into this field. The system also provides a list of all unconfirmed deals on a daily basis. Input in this field is normally not allowed. However, an 'N' may be input to indicate that a Broker's Note is not expected. In this case, the deal will not be shown on the unconfirmed deal report. Validation Rules: System generated or 'N' meaning no broker confirmation is to be expected. Input may only be an 'N' to identify that no broker's note is expected. Input in this field will only be accepted when brokers details have been entered.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setConfirmdByBroker

        public void setConfirmdByBroker(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ConfirmdByBroker
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field will be used by the confirmation facility (function code 'V') to store automatically the user identification, date and time the brokers note was received and reconciled with the foreign exchange transaction. When a deal is handled through a Broker, the Broker confirms the details of the deal by issuing a 'Broker Note'. This note is checked by the bank to ensure that it agrees with the contract details. Any discrepancy must be resolved quickly as money may be lost as a result. The Foreign Exchange application has a separate function code 'V' which allows the operator to confirm broker notes on the screen. This process automatically passes a user identification, time and date stamp into this field. The system also provides a list of all unconfirmed deals on a daily basis. Input in this field is normally not allowed. However, an 'N' may be input to indicate that a Broker's Note is not expected. In this case, the deal will not be shown on the unconfirmed deal report. Validation Rules: System generated or 'N' meaning no broker confirmation is to be expected. Input may only be an 'N' to identify that no broker's note is expected. Input in this field will only be accepted when brokers details have been entered.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setConsolInd

        public void setConsolInd(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified ConsolInd to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the consolidation keys which have been generated for this contract. One key will be generated for each currency (bought and sold) of the contract. Validation Rules: System generated. The first four parameters will always contain the Application ID (i.e. FX), the Currency Market, the Position Type and the Currency Code. The other parameters will default on the conditions defined in the file CONSOLIDATE.COND.

        Parameters:
        param - the ConsolInd to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setConsolInd

        Set the specified ConsolInd to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the consolidation keys which have been generated for this contract. One key will be generated for each currency (bought and sold) of the contract. Validation Rules: System generated. The first four parameters will always contain the Application ID (i.e. FX), the Currency Market, the Position Type and the Currency Code. The other parameters will default on the conditions defined in the file CONSOLIDATE.COND.

        Parameters:
        param - the ConsolInd to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setContractGrp

        public void setContractGrp(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ContractGrp
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: 1.Allows particular groups of contracts to be identified. 2.The conditions which determine a particular CONTRACT.GRP code are defined in the FOREX record of the APPL.GEN.CONDITION application 3.Each time the contract is changed the conditions will be re-evaluated which can result in a new CONTRACT.GRP code. If the CONTRACT.GRP value changes then this can result in a new FTT.TAX.TYPE.KEY being allocated depending on the set up of the relevant TAX.TYPE.CONDITION record.However, the conditions will not re-evaluated after authorization. Validation Rules : 5 character alphanumeric

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setContractGrp

        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: 1.Allows particular groups of contracts to be identified. 2.The conditions which determine a particular CONTRACT.GRP code are defined in the FOREX record of the APPL.GEN.CONDITION application 3.Each time the contract is changed the conditions will be re-evaluated which can result in a new CONTRACT.GRP code. If the CONTRACT.GRP value changes then this can result in a new FTT.TAX.TYPE.KEY being allocated depending on the set up of the relevant TAX.TYPE.CONDITION record.However, the conditions will not re-evaluated after authorization. Validation Rules : 5 character alphanumeric

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCorrAmendMkr

        public void setCorrAmendMkr(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for CorrAmendMkr
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates, in SWIFT terminology, if this is a correction or an amendment. It is used to indicate the code word to be used on a SWIFT confirmation. Validation Rules: Up to 7 SWIFT type characters: A for AMEND, C for CORRECT. Mandatory input when REPLACING.DEAL.NO present. Default = None.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCorrAmendMkr

        public void setCorrAmendMkr(TField value)
        Set the specified value for CorrAmendMkr
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates, in SWIFT terminology, if this is a correction or an amendment. It is used to indicate the code word to be used on a SWIFT confirmation. Validation Rules: Up to 7 SWIFT type characters: A for AMEND, C for CORRECT. Mandatory input when REPLACING.DEAL.NO present. Default = None.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCounterparty

        public void setCounterparty(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for Counterparty
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the counterparty with whom the dealer has arranged the Foreign Exchange transaction. This field contains the counterparty with whom the deal was made. Its content will depend upon the value of the entry made in DEAL.SUB.TYPE. For each value of the field DEAL.SUB.TYPE, the following rules will apply for the counterparty: The counterparty is external and known to the dealer. Any counterparty existing on the Customer file will be accepted. The customer can be entered as a number or mnemonic. The liability number assigned to this counterparty in the customer file will be used for the limit checking. BR Input in this field is not allowed for BRoker deals as it is assumed that initially the counterparty would not be known. When the counterparty is known, remove the BR from the DEAL.SUB.TYPE field and enter the customer details. IN For internal deals (DEAL.SUB.TYPE = 'IN'), input is restricted to a valid dealer as defined in the Dealer Desk table. In other words, the dealer must enter the number of the other dealer. When OC module is installed and Forex contracts are required to be reported to a trade repository, the Customer ID of the Counterparty must be a valid record in OC.CUSTOMER table. This check is performed only for FW or SW type contracts and when the SUB.DEAL.TYPE is not IN Validation Rules: 1-6 Numeric character Customer Number or 3-10 character customer mnemonic (uppercase alphanumeric or '.') - Type MNE or 1-2 numeric character dealer desk number or up to 10 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Input in this field is mandatory except when DEAL.SUB.TYPE = 'BR', in which case input is not allowed.) Input not allowed on broker deals (sub-type 'BR') Input must be a valid Dealer Desk for internal deals (sub-type 'IN'). For all other deals, the field must be entered and refer to a valid customer.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCounterparty

        public void setCounterparty(TField value)
        Set the specified value for Counterparty
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the counterparty with whom the dealer has arranged the Foreign Exchange transaction. This field contains the counterparty with whom the deal was made. Its content will depend upon the value of the entry made in DEAL.SUB.TYPE. For each value of the field DEAL.SUB.TYPE, the following rules will apply for the counterparty: The counterparty is external and known to the dealer. Any counterparty existing on the Customer file will be accepted. The customer can be entered as a number or mnemonic. The liability number assigned to this counterparty in the customer file will be used for the limit checking. BR Input in this field is not allowed for BRoker deals as it is assumed that initially the counterparty would not be known. When the counterparty is known, remove the BR from the DEAL.SUB.TYPE field and enter the customer details. IN For internal deals (DEAL.SUB.TYPE = 'IN'), input is restricted to a valid dealer as defined in the Dealer Desk table. In other words, the dealer must enter the number of the other dealer. When OC module is installed and Forex contracts are required to be reported to a trade repository, the Customer ID of the Counterparty must be a valid record in OC.CUSTOMER table. This check is performed only for FW or SW type contracts and when the SUB.DEAL.TYPE is not IN Validation Rules: 1-6 Numeric character Customer Number or 3-10 character customer mnemonic (uppercase alphanumeric or '.') - Type MNE or 1-2 numeric character dealer desk number or up to 10 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Input in this field is mandatory except when DEAL.SUB.TYPE = 'BR', in which case input is not allowed.) Input not allowed on broker deals (sub-type 'BR') Input must be a valid Dealer Desk for internal deals (sub-type 'IN'). For all other deals, the field must be entered and refer to a valid customer.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCpTradePurpose

        public void setCpTradePurpose(TField value)
        Set the specified value for CpTradePurpose
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Part of Regulatory Reporting information to a Trade Repository. Denotes if the contract is objectively measurable as directly linked to the other counterpartys commercial or treasury financial activity Input to this field is allowed only when OC module is installed and for FW or SW type FX contracts or when SUB.DEAL.TYPE is not 'IN' Validation Rules: This is an OPTIONAL field and value is User inputted Allowed optional values are YES, NO or NULL YES denotes that the contract is directly linked to the other counterpartys commercial or treasury financial activity NO denotes that the contract is not directly linked to the other counterpartys commercial or treasury financial activity Input allowed only when the Other counterparty is a NON FINANCIAL COUNTERPARTY This is a no change field

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Part of Regulatory Reporting information to a Trade Repository. Denotes if the contract is objectively measurable as directly linked to the other counterpartys commercial or treasury financial activity Input to this field is allowed only when OC module is installed and for FW or SW type FX contracts or when SUB.DEAL.TYPE is not 'IN' Validation Rules: This is an OPTIONAL field and value is User inputted Allowed optional values are YES, NO or NULL YES denotes that the contract is directly linked to the other counterpartys commercial or treasury financial activity NO denotes that the contract is not directly linked to the other counterpartys commercial or treasury financial activity Input allowed only when the Other counterparty is a NON FINANCIAL COUNTERPARTY This is a no change field

      • setCpyCorrCity

        public void setCpyCorrCity(TField value)
        Set the specified value for CpyCorrCity
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Represents the city of the counterparty correspondent when the counterparty correspondence bank is not known. The values specified will be mapped with SWIFT Option J code "/CITY/". For Example: : If user entered NEWYORK, system will populate it as /CITY/NEWYORK Validation Rules: Input is not allowed when a correspondent number has been entered. Input is allowed to maximum of 34 character If the user enters more than 34 characters, the system would truncate the text

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCpyCorrCity

        Set the specified value for CpyCorrCity
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Represents the city of the counterparty correspondent when the counterparty correspondence bank is not known. For Example: : If user entered NEWYORK, system will populate it as /CITY/NEWYORK Validation Rules: Input is not allowed when a correspondent number has been entered.       • setCpyCorrName

        public void setCpyCorrName(TField value)
        Set the specified value for CpyCorrName
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Represents the name of the counterparty correspondent when the counterparty correspondence bank is not known. The values specified will be mapped with SWIFT Option J code "/NAME/". For Example: If user entered BANK OF NEWYORK, system will populate it as /NAME/BANK OF NEWYORK Validation Rules: Input is not allowed when a correspondent number has been entered. Input is allowed to maximum of 34 character If the user enters more than 34 characters, the system would truncate the text

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCpyCorrName

        public void setCpyCorrName(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for CpyCorrName
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Represents the name of the counterparty correspondent when the counterparty correspondence bank is not known. The values specified will be mapped with SWIFT Option J code "/NAME/". For Example: If user entered BANK OF NEWYORK, system will populate it as /NAME/BANK OF NEWYORK Validation Rules: Input is not allowed when a correspondent number has been entered. Input is allowed to maximum of 34 character If the user enters more than 34 characters, the system would truncate the text

        Parameters:
