      • setCurrencyBought

        public void setCurrencyBought(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for CurrencyBought
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Details of the currency purchased are entered in this field. The input may be one of the following: - the user-defined alpha currency code - the user-defined numeric currency code For multi-leg deals, the currency details are automatically brought forward from the previous leg. This field is mandatory and contains the currency code of the currency which is purchased. The code can be entered in one of two formats: 1) Alpha format - This code will then comprise three alpha characters as defined in the currency table. It is recommended to use the standard SWIFT currency code which is the internationally recognised convention for currency codes. The following are examples of ISO/SWIFT codes: - USD = US Dollars - GBP = Pounds Sterling - DEM = Deutsche Marks - FRF = French Francs 2) Numeric format - In most Treasury operations, certain currencies are traded more often that others. To continually enter a three alpha character code would be unnecessarily time consuming. Currencies may therefore be given a numeric ranking between 1 and 999 on the Currency table. If USD is the most frequently traded currency it should have a numeric code of 1. Entering 1 will then access the details of US dollars from the Currency table. After the initial leg of a Swap deal has been entered, all further legs default to the currencies involved. For example, if dollars are purchased against Deutche Marks in the first leg, the default currency bought in subsequent legs will be Marks and no access to the field will be allowed. Validation Rules: 3 characters (uppercase alpha) - type SSS or 1-3 numeric characters Currency Code (Mandatory input) The currency code entered must appear on the Currency table. Currency bought and Currency sold may not have the same country identification (2 first letters of currency code). Dealing between LU'X' and BE'X' currency codes is prohibited. Both currency bought and currency sold may not be precious metals.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCurrencyBought

        public void setCurrencyBought(TField value)
        Set the specified value for CurrencyBought
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Details of the currency purchased are entered in this field. The input may be one of the following: - the user-defined alpha currency code - the user-defined numeric currency code For multi-leg deals, the currency details are automatically brought forward from the previous leg. This field is mandatory and contains the currency code of the currency which is purchased. The code can be entered in one of two formats: 1) Alpha format - This code will then comprise three alpha characters as defined in the currency table. It is recommended to use the standard SWIFT currency code which is the internationally recognised convention for currency codes. The following are examples of ISO/SWIFT codes: - USD = US Dollars - GBP = Pounds Sterling - DEM = Deutsche Marks - FRF = French Francs 2) Numeric format - In most Treasury operations, certain currencies are traded more often that others. To continually enter a three alpha character code would be unnecessarily time consuming. Currencies may therefore be given a numeric ranking between 1 and 999 on the Currency table. If USD is the most frequently traded currency it should have a numeric code of 1. Entering 1 will then access the details of US dollars from the Currency table. After the initial leg of a Swap deal has been entered, all further legs default to the currencies involved. For example, if dollars are purchased against Deutche Marks in the first leg, the default currency bought in subsequent legs will be Marks and no access to the field will be allowed. Validation Rules: 3 characters (uppercase alpha) - type SSS or 1-3 numeric characters Currency Code (Mandatory input) The currency code entered must appear on the Currency table. Currency bought and Currency sold may not have the same country identification (2 first letters of currency code). Dealing between LU'X' and BE'X' currency codes is prohibited. Both currency bought and currency sold may not be precious metals.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCurrencyMarket

        public void setCurrencyMarket(TField value)
        Set the specified value for CurrencyMarket
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The system recognizes the need for a number of different markets within one currency. For this reason this field identifies which Exchange Rate Currency Market is accessed for this transaction. The system caters for the need to have more than one market within a given currency. The use of this field will only be applicable for those countries where the exchange market defines different rates for the same foreign Currency according to rules determined by the local authorities or local central bank. A typical example would be Belgium where foreign currencies are quoted on the Regular Market and also on the Free Market. Different sets of exchange rates will exist for these two markets. If the default FX movement on MU.TXN.GRP.CCY.MKT is specified as 'FX' this field will not allow input and the value 1 will be defaulted. If default movement is not specified as 'FX', then if DEAL movement type has been specified on MU.TXN.GRP.CCY.MKT the market specified will be defaulted ito this field and the field will be made no input. If neither 'FX' is set or DEAL movement is specified, then input is mandatory in this field and may not be changed after authorisation. It is possible to specify separate markets to be used for COMM.CHRG and BROKERAGE. Any commission or change entries generated will use the specified market for COMM.CHRG if set up and similary BROKERAGE entries will use the BROKERAGE market if set up. If not set up the DEFAULT MOVEMENT currency market will be taken. The system allows the user to view the Foreign Exchange position by currency market when more than one market is applicable. Validation Rules: 1 numeric The market entered must appear on the Currency Market table. This field cannot be changed after authorisation. The market must exist on the local CURRENCY record. The market must exist on the CURRENCY record for both BUY and SELLCCY.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCurrencyMarket

        public void setCurrencyMarket(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for CurrencyMarket
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The system recognizes the need for a number of different markets within one currency. For this reason this field identifies which Exchange Rate Currency Market is accessed for this transaction. The system caters for the need to have more than one market within a given currency. The use of this field will only be applicable for those countries where the exchange market defines different rates for the same foreign Currency according to rules determined by the local authorities or local central bank. A typical example would be Belgium where foreign currencies are quoted on the Regular Market and also on the Free Market. Different sets of exchange rates will exist for these two markets. If the default FX movement on MU.TXN.GRP.CCY.MKT is specified as 'FX' this field will not allow input and the value 1 will be defaulted. If default movement is not specified as 'FX', then if DEAL movement type has been specified on MU.TXN.GRP.CCY.MKT the market specified will be defaulted ito this field and the field will be made no input. If neither 'FX' is set or DEAL movement is specified, then input is mandatory in this field and may not be changed after authorisation. It is possible to specify separate markets to be used for COMM.CHRG and BROKERAGE. Any commission or change entries generated will use the specified market for COMM.CHRG if set up and similary BROKERAGE entries will use the BROKERAGE market if set up. If not set up the DEFAULT MOVEMENT currency market will be taken. The system allows the user to view the Foreign Exchange position by currency market when more than one market is applicable. Validation Rules: 1 numeric The market entered must appear on the Currency Market table. This field cannot be changed after authorisation. The market must exist on the local CURRENCY record. The market must exist on the CURRENCY record for both BUY and SELLCCY.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCurrencySold

        public void setCurrencySold(TField value)
        Set the specified value for CurrencySold
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Details of the currency sold will be entered in this field. The input may be one of the following: - the user-defined alpha currency code - the user-defined numeric currency code For multi-leg deals, the currency details are automatically brought forward from the previous leg. This field is mandatory and contains the currency code of the currency which is sold. The code can be entered in one of two formats: 1) Alpha format - This code will then comprise three alpha characters as defined in the currency table. It is recommended to use the standard SWIFT currency code. The following are examples of ISO/SWIFT codes: - USD = US Dollars - GBP = Pounds Sterling - DEM = Deutsche Marks - FRF = French Francs 2) Numeric format - In most Treasury operations, certain currencies are traded more often that others. To continually enter a three alpha character code would be unnecessarily time consuming. Currencies may therefore be given a numeric ranking between 1 and 999 on the Currency table. If USD is the most frequently traded currency it should have a numeric code of 1. Entering 1 will then access the details of US dollars from the Currency table. After the initial leg of a Swap deal has been entered, all further legs default to the currencies involved. For example, if dollars are purchased against Deutche Marks in the first leg, the default currency sold in subsequent legs will be dollars and no access to the field will be allowed. Validation Rules: 3 characters (uppercase alpha) - type SSS or 1-3 numeric characters Currency Code (Mandatory input) The currency code entered must appear on the Currency table. Currency bought and Currency sold may not have the same country identification (2 first letters of currency code). Dealing between LU'X' and BE'X' currency codes is prohibited. Both currency bought and currency sold may not be precious metals.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCurrencySold

        public void setCurrencySold(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for CurrencySold
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Details of the currency sold will be entered in this field. The input may be one of the following: - the user-defined alpha currency code - the user-defined numeric currency code For multi-leg deals, the currency details are automatically brought forward from the previous leg. This field is mandatory and contains the currency code of the currency which is sold. The code can be entered in one of two formats: 1) Alpha format - This code will then comprise three alpha characters as defined in the currency table. It is recommended to use the standard SWIFT currency code. The following are examples of ISO/SWIFT codes: - USD = US Dollars - GBP = Pounds Sterling - DEM = Deutsche Marks - FRF = French Francs 2) Numeric format - In most Treasury operations, certain currencies are traded more often that others. To continually enter a three alpha character code would be unnecessarily time consuming. Currencies may therefore be given a numeric ranking between 1 and 999 on the Currency table. If USD is the most frequently traded currency it should have a numeric code of 1. Entering 1 will then access the details of US dollars from the Currency table. After the initial leg of a Swap deal has been entered, all further legs default to the currencies involved. For example, if dollars are purchased against Deutche Marks in the first leg, the default currency sold in subsequent legs will be dollars and no access to the field will be allowed. Validation Rules: 3 characters (uppercase alpha) - type SSS or 1-3 numeric characters Currency Code (Mandatory input) The currency code entered must appear on the Currency table. Currency bought and Currency sold may not have the same country identification (2 first letters of currency code). Dealing between LU'X' and BE'X' currency codes is prohibited. Both currency bought and currency sold may not be precious metals.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDealDate

        public void setDealDate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for DealDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the date on which the deal was made. This field will contain the date on which the deal was made. As this will normally be the same as the system date, entering [new line] will automatically insert this date. The date entered may not be in the future but a date of one day back valued will be allowed. Any date greater than one day in the past will require an override. The system compares the date in this field against the value date fields or the option date (when input) to check if the deal is a spot or forward contract. The system holds the user defined spot and forward classification conditions on the FX.PARAMETERS table. The number of (working) days defined in the field 'SPOT.INTERNAL' on this table will decide the classification of the foreign exchange contract into Spot or Forward. Validation Rules: Any accepted T24 date format. (Optional input; Default = System date) The date must be in an acceptable format (see general rules). The deal date must not be later than the value date. The deal date must not be later than today's date. If the deal date is earlier than one day back-valued an override is required. For a spot deal, the days difference between the deal date and the value date (or option date when entered) must be within that specified on the FX.PARAMETERS table in the field SPOT.INTERNAL. For forward deals, the days difference between deal and value dates (or option date when entered) must be greater than that specified on the FX.PARAMETERS table in the field SPOT.INTERNAL. Once authorised, the deal date cannot be amended.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDealDate

        public void setDealDate(TField value)
        Set the specified value for DealDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the date on which the deal was made. This field will contain the date on which the deal was made. As this will normally be the same as the system date, entering [new line] will automatically insert this date. The date entered may not be in the future but a date of one day back valued will be allowed. Any date greater than one day in the past will require an override. The system compares the date in this field against the value date fields or the option date (when input) to check if the deal is a spot or forward contract. The system holds the user defined spot and forward classification conditions on the FX.PARAMETERS table. The number of (working) days defined in the field 'SPOT.INTERNAL' on this table will decide the classification of the foreign exchange contract into Spot or Forward. Validation Rules: Any accepted T24 date format. (Optional input; Default = System date) The date must be in an acceptable format (see general rules). The deal date must not be later than the value date. The deal date must not be later than today's date. If the deal date is earlier than one day back-valued an override is required. For a spot deal, the days difference between the deal date and the value date (or option date when entered) must be within that specified on the FX.PARAMETERS table in the field SPOT.INTERNAL. For forward deals, the days difference between deal and value dates (or option date when entered) must be greater than that specified on the FX.PARAMETERS table in the field SPOT.INTERNAL. Once authorised, the deal date cannot be amended.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDealMarket

        public void setDealMarket(TField value)
        Set the specified value for DealMarket
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Default deal market for deriving and checking the exchange rate. Validation Rules: 2 numeric. The market entered must appear on the Currency Market table. The market must exist on the CURRENCY record for both BUY and SELLCCY.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDealMarket

        public void setDealMarket(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for DealMarket
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Default deal market for deriving and checking the exchange rate. Validation Rules: 2 numeric. The market entered must appear on the Currency Market table. The market must exist on the CURRENCY record for both BUY and SELLCCY.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDealSubType

        public void setDealSubType(TField value)
        Set the specified value for DealSubType
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Defines if a deal is internal or non-standard within a specified DEAL.TYPE. The application handles the following deal sub-types: null = Normal IN or I = Internal deal BR or B = Broker deal (counterparty unknown) This field is used to define deals which are internal or non-standard as they affect future validation/processing. The system is capable of handling the following sub-types: null = Normal If nothing is entered in this field, it is assumed that the deal type specified in field 1 is standard. IN or I = Internal deal Internal deals are handled differently from standard deals due to the fact that their only purpose is to allow transfers between different positions or dealer desks. Obviously, there is no need for accounting entries, payments, advices etc. When an internal spot or forward deal is entered, the system will automatically update the positions of both dealer desks entered into the contract (COUNTERPARTY and DEALER.DESK). BR or B = Broker deal Where trading has been carried out through a broker and the counterparty is not known, 'BR' should be entered as the sub-type. The system will then expect broker and not counterparty details to be entered. To authorise the contract, however, the user will need to erase 'BR' from this field and enter the counterparty details. A special enquiry facility allows the user to search, by broker, those contracts where the counterparty is still missing. Validation Rules: 1 or 2 type AAA (alpha) characters deal sub-type (Optional input; default = Null). Input in this field (IN or BR ) is not allowed for contract type 'SW' (Swap contracts). BR deals cannot be authorised

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDealSubType

        public void setDealSubType(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for DealSubType
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Defines if a deal is internal or non-standard within a specified DEAL.TYPE. The application handles the following deal sub-types: null = Normal IN or I = Internal deal BR or B = Broker deal (counterparty unknown) This field is used to define deals which are internal or non-standard as they affect future validation/processing. The system is capable of handling the following sub-types: null = Normal If nothing is entered in this field, it is assumed that the deal type specified in field 1 is standard. IN or I = Internal deal Internal deals are handled differently from standard deals due to the fact that their only purpose is to allow transfers between different positions or dealer desks. Obviously, there is no need for accounting entries, payments, advices etc. When an internal spot or forward deal is entered, the system will automatically update the positions of both dealer desks entered into the contract (COUNTERPARTY and DEALER.DESK). BR or B = Broker deal Where trading has been carried out through a broker and the counterparty is not known, 'BR' should be entered as the sub-type. The system will then expect broker and not counterparty details to be entered. To authorise the contract, however, the user will need to erase 'BR' from this field and enter the counterparty details. A special enquiry facility allows the user to search, by broker, those contracts where the counterparty is still missing. Validation Rules: 1 or 2 type AAA (alpha) characters deal sub-type (Optional input; default = Null). Input in this field (IN or BR ) is not allowed for contract type 'SW' (Swap contracts). BR deals cannot be authorised

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDealType

        public void setDealType(TField value)
        Set the specified value for DealType
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the nature of the Foreign Exchange deal being processed. The application handles three different types: - SP or S = Spot - FW or F = Forward (Outright) - SW = Swap The following deal types are processed by the Foreign Exchange application: SP or S = Spot deals. Spot deals involve the immediate exchange of one currency for another and, because these are usually the most common in the market, this deal type has been selected as the system default. To allow sufficient time for the bank to check details and transfer funds, the accepted standard for spot deals is two business days following the date of the transaction. The system allows this, or any other market standard, to be defined on the FX.PARAMETERS table. The validation process will verify that the value date of the contract does not exceed the number of working days defined in the field SPOT.INTERNAL on the FX.PARAMETERS table. FW or F = Forward deals Forward contracts refer to the buying and selling of foreign currency at future exchange rates for delivery in the future, i.e. at a date greater than the locally defined spot date. The period varies but usually would be for one, two, three, six, and twelve months hence. When the value date of the contract exceeds the number of working days defined on the FX.PARAMETERS table in the field SPOT.INTERNAL, the contract will be considered as forward. SW = Swap deals. Swap deals involve the exchange of currencies at the spot rate with an agreement to reverse the transaction with an identical amount of currency at a later date at a specified rate. Contract types such as Overnight (ON), Tom-Next (TN) or Spot-Next (SN) are by-products of this deal type. To assist in entering the swap, details of the first leg - the spot leg - are carried forward to the subsequent -forward- leg. A contract cannot be established on a forward/forward basis. Validation Rules: 1 or 2 alpha characters deal type (Optional input; default = SP) Only the above mentioned deal types will be accepted. The field cannot be changed after authorisation of the contract.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDealType

        public void setDealType(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for DealType
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the nature of the Foreign Exchange deal being processed. The application handles three different types: - SP or S = Spot - FW or F = Forward (Outright) - SW = Swap The following deal types are processed by the Foreign Exchange application: SP or S = Spot deals. Spot deals involve the immediate exchange of one currency for another and, because these are usually the most common in the market, this deal type has been selected as the system default. To allow sufficient time for the bank to check details and transfer funds, the accepted standard for spot deals is two business days following the date of the transaction. The system allows this, or any other market standard, to be defined on the FX.PARAMETERS table. The validation process will verify that the value date of the contract does not exceed the number of working days defined in the field SPOT.INTERNAL on the FX.PARAMETERS table. FW or F = Forward deals Forward contracts refer to the buying and selling of foreign currency at future exchange rates for delivery in the future, i.e. at a date greater than the locally defined spot date. The period varies but usually would be for one, two, three, six, and twelve months hence. When the value date of the contract exceeds the number of working days defined on the FX.PARAMETERS table in the field SPOT.INTERNAL, the contract will be considered as forward. SW = Swap deals. Swap deals involve the exchange of currencies at the spot rate with an agreement to reverse the transaction with an identical amount of currency at a later date at a specified rate. Contract types such as Overnight (ON), Tom-Next (TN) or Spot-Next (SN) are by-products of this deal type. To assist in entering the swap, details of the first leg - the spot leg - are carried forward to the subsequent -forward- leg. A contract cannot be established on a forward/forward basis. Validation Rules: 1 or 2 alpha characters deal type (Optional input; default = SP) Only the above mentioned deal types will be accepted. The field cannot be changed after authorisation of the contract.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDealerDesk

        public void setDealerDesk(TField value)
        Set the specified value for DealerDesk
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the dealer desk position which needs to be updated by the deal being created. The dealer desk code is held on the position record so that the exchange position can be displayed at dealer desk level. Each deal on the system will be allocated a two-digit dealer desk code. This code will be used to maintain position at the dealer desk level. Validation Rules: 2 alphanumeric character dealer code in the range A-Z, a-z, plus 0-9. Optional input; Default = dealer desk defined on the user profile. The code entered must appear on the DEALER.DESK table. When entering an internal deal, the dealer must be different from the one entered in the counterparty field. The field cannot be changed once the deal has been authorised.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDealerDesk

        public void setDealerDesk(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for DealerDesk
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the dealer desk position which needs to be updated by the deal being created. The dealer desk code is held on the position record so that the exchange position can be displayed at dealer desk level. Each deal on the system will be allocated a two-digit dealer desk code. This code will be used to maintain position at the dealer desk level. Validation Rules: 2 alphanumeric character dealer code in the range A-Z, a-z, plus 0-9. Optional input; Default = dealer desk defined on the user profile. The code entered must appear on the DEALER.DESK table. When entering an internal deal, the dealer must be different from the one entered in the counterparty field. The field cannot be changed once the deal has been authorised.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDealerNotes

        public void setDealerNotes(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified DealerNotes to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This element allows the Dealer to record any special information or free form narrative on first level input which is referred to by the back office. These details are for the benefit of the back office user. Validation Rules: 1-6 lines with up to 35 characters in each line.

        Parameters:
        param - the DealerNotes to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDealerNotes

        Set the specified DealerNotes to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

      • setDeliveryDetails

        public void setDeliveryDetails(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for DeliveryDetails
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This is an optional field if one or more of the currencies is a user defined precious metal.Should contain one of the valuesprovided in the dropdown list.If OTHER is selected ,User will have to give additional information in the field 'Terms.And.Conds which will be captured in Tag 77D in MT600 Validation rules : Mandatory Field 3 characters (uppercase alpha)

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDeliveryDetails

        public void setDeliveryDetails(TField value)
        Set the specified value for DeliveryDetails
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This is an optional field if one or more of the currencies is a user defined precious metal.Should contain one of the valuesprovided in the dropdown list.If OTHER is selected ,User will have to give additional information in the field 'Terms.And.Conds which will be captured in Tag 77D in MT600 Validation rules : Mandatory Field 3 characters (uppercase alpha)

      • setEquivIntBought

        public void setEquivIntBought(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for EquivIntBought
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The local equivalent of the notional interest amount belonging to the contract amount bought. Revaluation methods 'IN' and 'IH' only. OR The amount of the apparant exchange profit generated by the premium/ discount on the currencies traded. Revaluation methods 'SL' and 'SF' only. This field is only used when the interest or interest/hedged revaluation method has been selected for a forward contract (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'IN' or 'IH') or when the currency bought is traded at a premium against the currency sold under straight-line or straight line funding method (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'SL' or 'SF'). It represents a discount under the 'SF' method if the amount is less than zero. The value which the system places in this field represents either the local equivalent of the interest element which will be accrued to profit & loss over the lifetime of the deal or the profit element which is to be amortised on a straight-line basis. In the case of interest method revaluation (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'IN'), this is the local currency equivalent of the amount which would be yielded by the contract amount (AMOUNT.BOUGHT), at the given interest rate (INT.RATE.BUY) over the lifetime of the deal. In the case of interest/hedged method revaluation (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'IH'), it is local currency equivalent of the amount which would be yielded by the notional principal amount (NOTIONAL.BUY.AMT), at the given interest rate (INT.RATE.BUY) over the lifetime of the deal. In the case of straight-line method revaluation (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'SL' or 'SF'), it is the local equivalent difference yielded by the difference between the SPOT.RATE and the exchange rate of the deal. In the case of interest and straight-line methods revaluation, the accruals which are represented by fields BUY.DAILY.ACC.L & BUY.ACC.TDATE.L will, when the deal reaches maturity, add up to the figure shown in this field. In the case of interest/hedged method revaluation, the interest accruals are accounted for in the currency of the deal (CURRENCY.BOUGHT) and booked across the exchange reserve account (interest received) at the prevailing spot rate of the day. The figure in this field is, however, used at maturity to balance the accrual amounts against the revaluation effect over the life of the contract. Validation Rules: Standard amount format. System generated field.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setEquivIntBought

        public void setEquivIntBought(TField value)
        Set the specified value for EquivIntBought
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The local equivalent of the notional interest amount belonging to the contract amount bought. Revaluation methods 'IN' and 'IH' only. OR The amount of the apparant exchange profit generated by the premium/ discount on the currencies traded. Revaluation methods 'SL' and 'SF' only. This field is only used when the interest or interest/hedged revaluation method has been selected for a forward contract (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'IN' or 'IH') or when the currency bought is traded at a premium against the currency sold under straight-line or straight line funding method (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'SL' or 'SF'). It represents a discount under the 'SF' method if the amount is less than zero. The value which the system places in this field represents either the local equivalent of the interest element which will be accrued to profit & loss over the lifetime of the deal or the profit element which is to be amortised on a straight-line basis. In the case of interest method revaluation (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'IN'), this is the local currency equivalent of the amount which would be yielded by the contract amount (AMOUNT.BOUGHT), at the given interest rate (INT.RATE.BUY) over the lifetime of the deal. In the case of interest/hedged method revaluation (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'IH'), it is local currency equivalent of the amount which would be yielded by the notional principal amount (NOTIONAL.BUY.AMT), at the given interest rate (INT.RATE.BUY) over the lifetime of the deal. In the case of straight-line method revaluation (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'SL' or 'SF'), it is the local equivalent difference yielded by the difference between the SPOT.RATE and the exchange rate of the deal. In the case of interest and straight-line methods revaluation, the accruals which are represented by fields BUY.DAILY.ACC.L & BUY.ACC.TDATE.L will, when the deal reaches maturity, add up to the figure shown in this field. In the case of interest/hedged method revaluation, the interest accruals are accounted for in the currency of the deal (CURRENCY.BOUGHT) and booked across the exchange reserve account (interest received) at the prevailing spot rate of the day. The figure in this field is, however, used at maturity to balance the accrual amounts against the revaluation effect over the life of the contract. Validation Rules: Standard amount format. System generated field.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setEquivIntSold

        public void setEquivIntSold(TField value)
        Set the specified value for EquivIntSold
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The local equivalent of the notional interest amount belonging to the contract amount sold. Revaluation methods 'IN' and 'IH' only. OR The amount of the apparant exchange loss generated by the premium/discount on the currencies traded. Revaluation methods 'SL' and 'SF' only. This field is only used when the interest or interest/hedged revaluation method has been selected for a forward contract (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'IN' or 'IH') or when the currency bought is traded at a discount against the currency sold under straight-line or straight line funding method (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'SL' or 'SF'). It represents a premium under the 'SF' method if the amount is less than zero. The value which the system places in this field represents either the local equivalent of the interest element which will be accrued to profit & loss over the lifetime of the deal or the element of loss which is to be amortised on a straight-line basis. In the case of interest method revaluation (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'IN'), this is the local currency equivalent of the amount which would be yielded by the contract amount (AMOUNT.SOLD), at the given interest rate (INT.RATE.SELL) over the lifetime of the deal. In the case of interest/hedged method revaluation (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'IH'), it is local currency equivalent of the amount which would be yielded by the notional principal amount (NOTIONAL.SELL.AMT), at the given interest rate (INT.RATE.SELL) over the lifetime of the deal. In the case of straight-line method revaluation (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'SL' or 'SF'), it is the local equivalent difference yielded by the difference between the SPOT.RATE and the exchange rate of the deal. In the case of interest and straight-line methods revaluation, the accruals which are represented by fields SEL.DAILY.ACC.L & SEL.ACC.TDATE.L will, when the deal reaches maturity, add up to the figure shown in this field. In the case of interest/hedged method revaluation, the interest accruals are accounted for in the currency of the deal (CURRENCY.SOLD) and booked across the exchange reserve account (interest paid) at the prevailing spot rate of the day. The figure in this field is, however, used at maturity to balance the accrual amounts against the revaluation effect over the life of the contract. Validation Rules: Standard amount format. System generated field.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setEquivIntSold

        public void setEquivIntSold(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for EquivIntSold
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The local equivalent of the notional interest amount belonging to the contract amount sold. Revaluation methods 'IN' and 'IH' only. OR The amount of the apparant exchange loss generated by the premium/discount on the currencies traded. Revaluation methods 'SL' and 'SF' only. This field is only used when the interest or interest/hedged revaluation method has been selected for a forward contract (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'IN' or 'IH') or when the currency bought is traded at a discount against the currency sold under straight-line or straight line funding method (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'SL' or 'SF'). It represents a premium under the 'SF' method if the amount is less than zero. The value which the system places in this field represents either the local equivalent of the interest element which will be accrued to profit & loss over the lifetime of the deal or the element of loss which is to be amortised on a straight-line basis. In the case of interest method revaluation (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'IN'), this is the local currency equivalent of the amount which would be yielded by the contract amount (AMOUNT.SOLD), at the given interest rate (INT.RATE.SELL) over the lifetime of the deal. In the case of interest/hedged method revaluation (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'IH'), it is local currency equivalent of the amount which would be yielded by the notional principal amount (NOTIONAL.SELL.AMT), at the given interest rate (INT.RATE.SELL) over the lifetime of the deal. In the case of straight-line method revaluation (REVALUATION.TYPE, is 'SL' or 'SF'), it is the local equivalent difference yielded by the difference between the SPOT.RATE and the exchange rate of the deal. In the case of interest and straight-line methods revaluation, the accruals which are represented by fields SEL.DAILY.ACC.L & SEL.ACC.TDATE.L will, when the deal reaches maturity, add up to the figure shown in this field. In the case of interest/hedged method revaluation, the interest accruals are accounted for in the currency of the deal (CURRENCY.SOLD) and booked across the exchange reserve account (interest paid) at the prevailing spot rate of the day. The figure in this field is, however, used at maturity to balance the accrual amounts against the revaluation effect over the life of the contract. Validation Rules: Standard amount format. System generated field.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setEqvCode

        public void setEqvCode(EqvCodeClass param, int idx)
        Set the specified EqvCode to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.
        Parameters:
        param - the EqvCode to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setExecTimeStamp

        public void setExecTimeStamp(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ExecTimeStamp
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Part of Regulatory Reporting information to a Trade Repository. Denotes the date and time of execution of the transaction and is User inputtable field. Input to this field is allowed only when OC module is installed and for FW or SW types FX contracts or when SUB.DEAL.TYPE is not 'IN' Validation Rules: This is an OPTIONAL field The format should be "YYYYMMDDTHH:MM:SS+/-(UTC.TIME.ZONE)" or "YYYYMMDDTHH:MM:SSZ" Example 20150101T10:10:10+05:30 Example 20150101T10:10:10-05:30 Example 20150101T10:10:10Z

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setExecTimeStamp

        public void setExecTimeStamp(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ExecTimeStamp
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Part of Regulatory Reporting information to a Trade Repository. Denotes the date and time of execution of the transaction and is User inputtable field.       • setFedFunds

        public void setFedFunds(TField value)
        Set the specified value for FedFunds
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The field identifies whether the amounts are Clearing House funds ('C') or Federal Reserve funds ('F'). This field is not used at present and input to it will not be allowed. After validation 'C' will be displayed in the field when the currency bought or sold involves USD. This field is not used at present. The interpretation of the values is: F U.S. Dollar payment is to be in "FED" i.e. Federal Funds. C U.S. Dollar payment is not to be in Federal Funds but in ordinary US clearing house funds. Notes: i) Details ('F') or ('C') will only be displayed if one of the currencies involved is USD. ii) Details can only be 'C' in the present condition. Validation Rules: 1 character i.e. 'F' or 'C'. System Generated.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

This field is not used at present. The interpretation of the values is: F U.S. Dollar payment is to be in "FED" i.e. Federal Funds. C U.S. Dollar payment is not to be in Federal Funds but in ordinary US clearing house funds. Notes: i) Details ('F') or ('C') will only be displayed if one of the currencies involved is USD. ii) Details can only be 'C' in the present condition. Validation Rules: 1 character i.e. 'F' or 'C'. The deal must be between 2 fixed currencies, the realistion date will generally be the night before the rates are fixed between the 2 currencies. Validation Rules: This is a NOINPUT, System Date field.

      • setForwardRate

        public void setForwardRate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ForwardRate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the exchange rate applicable to forward deals. The rate may be entered in full or as a 'premium-discount' over the spot rate. A '+' should be entered to signify a premium and a '-' for discount. The rate may also be derived using the FX margin functionality, where Treasury Rate and Margin Percentage are made available. Forward transactions are those with value dates further in the future than spot deals, usually for periods of one, two, three, six, and twelve months. These transactions involve an agreement to exchange currencies at an agreed rate on a specified future date. By entering into such a transaction, exchange risks can be avoided as the rate and settlement date remain the same regardless of what happens to the exchange rate. The actual forward rate, agreed at the time of the contract, is determined by the interest rates in the currencies concerned. For example, if dollar interest rates are 10% per annum and sterling 15%, it would be sensible to invest dollars in sterling and create a forward contract to re-purchase the dollars. However, the sterling forward exchange rate against dollar would be around 5% lower to reflect the interest rate difference between the two currencies. In the example, Sterling is worth less in the future in terms of dollars because it is the currency with the higher interest rate; sterling is said to be at a discount to dollars. As future dollars are worth more because of the interest rates differential, they are said to be at a premium in terms of sterling. The rate can be entered in this field as an actual forward exchange rate or as a premium/discount (identified with a preceeding + or -) which will then be added/subtracted to the spot rate defined in the previous field. If the spot rate is 2.00 and the forward rate 1.90, the forward rate can be entered as the 1.90 or as -.10 (i.e. a discount of .10 from the spot rate). Premium/discount is expressed as 'pips' which are defined on the Currency table for each currency. If, for example, +12 is entered as the premium on dollars and the Currency table shows a pip value of 4, the system will view this as a premium of 0.0012 to be added on the spot rate to derive the forward rate. Validation Rules: 1-12 type R (Standard Rate Format - up to 8 integer and 6 decimal) characters plus a decimal point or 1-15 type R (Up to 8 integer and 9 decimal) characters plus a decimal point when EXTENDED.PREC in SPF is set to Y. Or +/- NNNN where NNNN = Premium/Discount quoted in pips (see explanation in details). (Input is mandatory on forward deals or forward legs. Otherwise not allowed.) The rate must be in an acceptable format. The rate will be checked against the forward rate table and must be within the tolerance specified by the user on the currency table. If not, the operator will have to enter an override. The rate, amount bought, and amount sold must be complimentary.But, In case if the Treasury rate is entered with Margin Perc, only one amount is mandatory. When the Margin functionality isused to derive the contract rate, Forward rate is derived through the Treasury rate and Margin pips.Once the deal has been authorised, this field cannot be amended. When the Margin Percenatge exists in the contract, Forward rate is non-inputtable.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setForwardRate

        public void setForwardRate(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ForwardRate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the exchange rate applicable to forward deals. The rate may be entered in full or as a 'premium-discount' over the spot rate. A '+' should be entered to signify a premium and a '-' for discount. The rate may also be derived using the FX margin functionality, where Treasury Rate and Margin Percentage are made available. By entering into such a transaction, exchange risks can be avoided as the rate and settlement date remain the same regardless of what happens to the exchange rate. Premium/discount is expressed as 'pips' which are defined on the Currency table for each currency. If, for example, +12 is entered as the premium on dollars and the Currency table shows a pip value of 4, the system will view this as a premium of 0.0012 to be added on the spot rate to derive the forward rate. Validation Rules: 1-12 type R (Standard Rate Format - up to 8 integer and 6 decimal) characters plus a decimal point or 1-15 type R (Up to 8 integer and 9 decimal) characters plus a decimal point when EXTENDED.PREC in SPF is set to Y. Or +/- NNNN where NNNN = Premium/Discount quoted in pips (see explanation in details). (Input is mandatory on forward deals or forward legs. Otherwise not allowed.) The rate must be in an acceptable format. The rate will be checked against the forward rate table and must be within the tolerance specified by the user on the currency table. If not, the operator will have to enter an override. The rate, amount bought, and amount sold must be complimentary.But, In case if the Treasury rate is entered with Margin Perc, only one amount is mandatory. When the Margin functionality isused to derive the contract rate, Forward rate is derived through the Treasury rate and Margin pips.Once the deal has been authorised, this field cannot be amended. When the Margin Percenatge exists in the contract, Forward rate is non-inputtable.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFttCollCptyTax

        public void setFttCollCptyTax(TField value)
        Set the specified value for FttCollCptyTax
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Provides the option to T24 bank to collect the Financial Transaction Tax payable by the Counterparty also. If yes, accounting entries are raised to collect counterpartys tax wherein customer Account is debited and Tax suspense Account is credited. The values No or Null means T24 bank does not collect the FTT payable by the counterparty or in other words the counterparty himself remits the FTT. This option is provided on the premise that where the counterparty is a customer of the bank ( not an interbank counterparty) the T24 bank assumes responsibility to collect and pay the FTT payable by the customer Validation Rules: Values allowed are Yes, No or Null. Default value will be from FX.PARAMETERS but can be overridden by the User.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFttCollCptyTax

        public void setFttCollCptyTax(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for FttCollCptyTax
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Provides the option to T24 bank to collect the Financial Transaction Tax payable by the Counterparty also. If yes, accounting entries are raised to collect counterpartys tax wherein customer Account is debited and Tax suspense Account is credited. The values No or Null means T24 bank does not collect the FTT payable by the counterparty or in other words the counterparty himself remits the FTT. This option is provided on the premise that where the counterparty is a customer of the bank ( not an interbank counterparty) the T24 bank assumes responsibility to collect and pay the FTT payable by the customer Validation Rules: Values allowed are Yes, No or Null. Default value will be from FX.PARAMETERS but can be overridden by the User.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

        Field description: Identifies the Tax Amount calculated in EUR, which is the Tax payable currency under EUFTT. The notional conversion between the FTT.TAX.BASE.CCY and EUR is based on mid-reval rate in currency record. Value populated in FTT.TAX.AMT.BASE is converted to EUR. Validation Rules : No input field.

Where the Tax currency and PL currency are different, using Mid-reval rate from the tax currency record, the LCY equivalent is calculated and accounting entries are based on this value.       • setFttTaxBaseAmt

        public void setFttTaxBaseAmt(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for FttTaxBaseAmt
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the Tax Base Notional amount for Tax calculation. By default, it will be one of the contract notional amounts. The amount defaults corresponding to the currency present in the field FTT.TAX.BASE.CCY. In case, the Tax Base Notional amount requires any adjustment (for example tenor adjustment) to the contract notional, a customized routine can be attached to BASE.AMT.ROUTINE field of TAX application. Validation Rules : No input field. Associated with TAX.BASE.CCY

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFttTaxBaseCcy

        public void setFttTaxBaseCcy(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for FttTaxBaseCcy
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the Tax Base Currency in which Tax amount is calculated.The logic to default the value is- if EUR is one of the two currencies then EUR else the Non-base Currency. User can change the value defaulted during input stage or INAU stage. Any change will result in a change in TAX.BASE.AMT field too and the tax calculations done already. Validation Rules : Can be one of the currency pair in the transaction. No Change field after authorization. Associated with TAX.BASE.AMT

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFttTaxTypeKey

        public void setFttTaxTypeKey(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for FttTaxTypeKey
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Using this field together with the CONTRACT.GRP field it is possible to determine a particular tax code from conditions based on a. General tax type as defined in the TAX.TYPE.CONDITION application b. Type of customer as defined in the CUSTOMER.CHARGES application c. Type of contract as defined in the CONTRACT.GRP field. The value in this field must equate to a record in the TAX.TYPE.CONDITION application which contains tax codes related to customer tax group and contract group. Whenever tax is to be recalculated the correct tax code will be determined and the Tax related fields gets updated accordingly. Validation Rules : Optional input, must be present as a record on TAX.TYPE.CONDITION. The actual TAX.TYPE.CONDITION key value will be prefixed by the "*" character (asterisk).

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

The available options are : DELIVERY - Delivery TRANSFER Transfer Validation rules : Mandatory 8 characters (uppercase alpha)

      • setFwdFwdSwap

        public void setFwdFwdSwap(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for FwdFwdSwap
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Denotes whether the Swap contract is a Forward to Forward (both the legs having a value date greater than the spot date) or Spot to Forward (First leg having a value date lesser than or equal to spot and second leg having a value date greater than value date of leg1) Input to this field is allowed only when DEAL.TYPE is 'SW' Validation Rules: This is an OPTIONAL field and value is User inputted Allowed optional values are YES, NO or NULL YES denotes that the contract is forward to forward swap contract, i.e the value date of leg1 should be a forward date NO or NULL denotes that the contract is spot to forward contract, i.e the value date of leg1 will be one of Today, Tomorrow, Spot. This is a no change field

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFwdFwdSwap

        public void setFwdFwdSwap(TField value)
        Set the specified value for FwdFwdSwap
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Denotes whether the Swap contract is a Forward to Forward (both the legs having a value date greater than the spot date) or Spot to Forward (First leg having a value date lesser than or equal to spot and second leg having a value date greater than value date of leg1) Input to this field is allowed only when DEAL.TYPE is 'SW' Validation Rules: This is an OPTIONAL field and value is User inputted Allowed optional values are YES, NO or NULL YES denotes that the contract is forward to forward swap contract, i.e the value date of leg1 should be a forward date NO or NULL denotes that the contract is spot to forward contract, i.e the value date of leg1 will be one of Today, Tomorrow, Spot. This is a no change field

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFxGroupCondId

        public void setFxGroupCondId(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for FxGroupCondId
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The value is defaulted by system either from SEC.ACC.MASTER ( if there is one given on the FX deal) or else from the CUSTOMER.CHARGE table . This is the key to get the Margin Percentage that is applicable to the customer on the FX deal. Validation Rules: Noinput field.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFxGroupCondId

        public void setFxGroupCondId(TField value)
        Set the specified value for FxGroupCondId
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The value is defaulted by system either from SEC.ACC.MASTER ( if there is one given on the FX deal) or else from the CUSTOMER.CHARGE table . This is the key to get the Margin Percentage that is applicable to the customer on the FX deal. Validation Rules: Noinput field.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFxOrderId

        public void setFxOrderId(TField value)
        Set the specified value for FxOrderId
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: If this deal was created by an FX.BULK.ORDER , the ID of the FX.ORDER is shown here. Validation Rules: NOINPUT

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFxOrderId

        public void setFxOrderId(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for FxOrderId
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: If this deal was created by an FX.BULK.ORDER , the ID of the FX.ORDER is shown here. Validation Rules: NOINPUT

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIdentification

        public void setIdentification(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for Identification
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field contains details to be mandatorily displayed in the contract confirmation for bullion trades. This field will be a no input field and its value will be created by the concatenation of the next 4 fields viz. DELIVERY.DETAILS(Optional), AVAILABILITY, ALLOCATION and METAL.TYPE. These are user input fields and are mandatory if one or more of the currencies is a user defined precious metal. Validation rules : No input field

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIdentification

        public void setIdentification(TField value)
        Set the specified value for Identification
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field contains details to be mandatorily displayed in the contract confirmation for bullion trades. This field will be a no input field and its value will be created by the concatenation of the next 4 fields viz. DELIVERY.DETAILS(Optional), AVAILABILITY, ALLOCATION and METAL.TYPE. These are user input fields and are mandatory if one or more of the currencies is a user defined precious metal. Validation rules : No input field

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIntBasisBought

        public void setIntBasisBought(TField value)
        Set the specified value for IntBasisBought
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The interest day basis of the currency bought. Revaluation methods 'IN' and 'IH' only. This field is only used when the interest or interest/hedged revaluation method has been selected for a forward contract ( REVALUATION.TYPE , is 'IN' or 'IH'). The value is automatically taken from the currency record belonging to the CURRENCY.BOUGHT at the time the contract is entered. It is subsequently used by the system to perform daily accrual calculations. The possible values are as follows:

        ValueDays/Days in Year
        A 360/360
        B 366/360
        C 366/366
        D 360/366
        E 366/365
        F 360/365
        For illustrations of all supported INTEREST.BASIS types see: INTEREST.BASISValidation Rules: System generated field.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIntBasisBought

        public void setIntBasisBought(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for IntBasisBought
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The interest day basis of the currency bought. Revaluation methods 'IN' and 'IH' only. This field is only used when the interest or interest/hedged revaluation method has been selected for a forward contract ( REVALUATION.TYPE , is 'IN' or 'IH'). The value is automatically taken from the currency record belonging to the CURRENCY.BOUGHT at the time the contract is entered. It is subsequently used by the system to perform daily accrual calculations. The possible values are as follows:

        ValueDays/Days in Year
        A 360/360
        B 366/360
        C 366/366
        D 360/366
        E 366/365
        F 360/365
        For illustrations of all supported INTEREST.BASIS types see: INTEREST.BASISValidation Rules: System generated field.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIntBasisSold

        public void setIntBasisSold(TField value)
        Set the specified value for IntBasisSold
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The interest day basis of the currency sold. Revaluation methods 'IN' and 'IH' only. This field is only used when the interest or interest/hedged revaluation method has been selected for a forward contract ( REVALUATION.TYPE , is 'IN' or 'IH'). The value is automatically taken from the currency record belonging to the CURRENCY.SOLD at the time the contract is entered. It is subsequently used by the system to perform daily accrual calculations. The possible values are as follows:

        ValueDays/Days in Year
        A 360/360
        B 366/360
        C 366/366
        D 360/366
        E 366/365
        F 360/365
        For illustrations of all supported INTEREST.BASIS types see: INTEREST.BASISValidation Rules: System generated field.

        public void setIntBasisSold(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for IntBasisSold
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The interest day basis of the currency sold. Revaluation methods 'IN' and 'IH' only. This field is only used when the interest or interest/hedged revaluation method has been selected for a forward contract ( REVALUATION.TYPE , is 'IN' or 'IH'). The value is automatically taken from the currency record belonging to the CURRENCY.SOLD at the time the contract is entered.
