      • setReserved10

        public void setReserved10(TField value)
        Set the specified value for Reserved10
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Reserved for future use Validation Rules: No Input Allowed

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setRevaluationType

        public void setRevaluationType(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for RevaluationType
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the revaluation methodto be used on forward contracts. The system handles five types of Revaluation: 'RB' = Rebate method 'SL' = Straight line 'IN' = Interest method 'IH' = Interest/hedged 'SF' = Straight line funding As it is the case for the spot contracts all open forward Foreign Exchange contracts are revalued on an individual deal basis using the current market rates. The forward rates used for the rebate revaluation are obtained from the FORWARD.RATE Table and where a rate is not available for a particular value date it is calculated by interpoltation, or the exchange rate of the nearest date will be selected according to the value defined on the REVALUATION.PARAMETER table. For the revaluation applicable to unmatured forward contracts, T24, allows the user to choose, at deal level, between five different methods. Rebate Method This is the most straightforward method as it is based (like the spot revaluation) on the cost or profit attributable to closing the position, i.e. to enter into a deal at today's rates to exactly cover each deal at its maturity (buy back approach). In the case of forward deals, the rate varies not only because of change in the market (supply and demand factors) but also because rates vary with time. For any given forward deal, as it ages, the rate to cover it, converges with the spot rate as it gets closer to maturity, until it will, eventually be covered at spot rate. Given a set of forward rates (FORWARD.RATES tables), the user can still choose between 3 methods to find the forward rate applicable to each forward contract, i.e: - Interpolation - Next available rate - Closest rate His choice will be indicated on the REVALUATION.PARAMETER table. The following explains how the interpolation works within FOREX. It is the only method where a rate will be found for each day. Interpolation of forward Exchange Rates The rates on the forward exchange rate table (FORWARD.RATES) can be defined for any period required by the user, (e.g. 1 week, 2 weeks, 15 days, 1 month, 2 months, 3 months etc..). The actual value date that the forward rates apply to are calculated as the: Reporting date + 2 working days + number of months. If this date is not a working day, then the next working day is used. When a date is required for a value date that falls between the dates of two rates on the table, then it is interpolated as follows: a) Number of days bbetween the dates of the two rates: TOTALDAYS = Latest Rate Date - Earliest Rate Date b) Difference between rates: DIFFERENCE = Latest Rate - Earliest Rate c) Rate of change per day: RATE OF CHANGE = DIFFERENCE ---------- TOTALDAYS d) The number of days to the required value date from the earliest date is multiplied by the rate of change, then the result is added to the earliest rate: DAYS = Required Value Date - Earliest Rate Date REQUIRED RATE = Earliest Rate + DAYS * RATEOFCHANGE Straight Line Method As previously stated, there is generally a difference between spot and forward rates. Under the straight line distribution method, this difference, as an amount in local currency, is isolated as a profit or loss at the start of the contract and then simply amortised over the life of the deal as a daily accrual between the appropriate interest profit and loss category code (Interest Paid Exchange or Interest Received Exchange) and the exchange reserve adjustment account. (ACCOUNT.CLASS file = RESERVE). Effectively this deal is now being carried at spot rate (since the forward discount or premium is being accrued) and therefore, it is necessary to revalue it each day just as if it was a spot deal using the technique described in 'Spot Revaluation'. Interest Method The primary factor, influencing the change of forward rates with time, is the real difference in the interest yield of one currency compared with that of the currency for which it is planned to exchange. Example : Assume the yield on GBP is 12% and that on USD is 14% with a Spot rate of 1.25. Then, over 12 months GBP 1000 would yield GBP 120 interest. Likewise, if exchanged (@1.25) USD 1250 would yield USD 175 interest. Thus, in order not to sustain a loss, the 12 month Forward USD sell rate should be (USD 1425/GBP1120) or 1.2723. i.e. USD 1425 * 1.2723 = GBP 1120 In practice, one of the amounts on the Forward deal is held at the same value as for the Spot deal. So, in this example, if the forward deal is also for GBP 1000 the USD amount would be USD 1275 (i.e. USD 1250 plus 2% interest differential thereon of USD 25). Therefore, it is argued that the Discount on the forward USD 12 month rate is simply to offset the 2% USD interest premium prevailing at the time of the deal. This apparent exchange Profit or Loss, therefore, should be accrued over the life of the forward deal as in the manner of the straight line method except that Profit and Loss Interest entries will now be booked for both the currency bought (credit to Interest Received Exchange) and the currency sold (debit to Interest Paid Exchange). Using the same example: A loan of USD 1250 yields USD 175 over 12 months. Over the same time a debit (revaluation) accrual is made of USD 25 (i.e. USD 1250 * 2%). Thus the net result is interest received of USD 150. As proof that this is correct, GBP 1000 at 12% would have given rise to GBP 120 interest, which converted at spot of 1.25 is also USD 150. The effect of this accrual (to discount the forward premium or discount) is to value the position at spot rate so it is, therefore, necessary each day to perform spot revaluation. This method is obviously most appropriate to the transaction type 'Swap' where an actual loan and deposit could be booked with a spot and foward deal and the real interest rates can be used on the forward leg, so rendering the deal entirely neutral. That is, the difference between interest paid and received will be eliminated by the forward accrual and the spot deal will be cancelled, in its effect, by the spot revaluation of the forward leg. Interest/hedged Method Like the interest method, this revaluation type takes into account the difference in the interest yield of one currency compared with that of the currency for which it is exchanged. However, the interest/hedged method bases its interest calculations not on the actual amounts of the deal, but on a 'notional' principal amount on each side (buy & sell). The notional principal amount is that amount which, given the interest rates applicable to each currency of the contract, would yield the actual amounts of the deal over the contract term. In other words, the deal amounts are effectively split into a principal and interest element and it is this interest element which is accrued on each side of the deal over its life. The difference between the interest and interest/hedged methods can be illustrated by example. In all cases, the USD interest rate is 14% and the GBP interest rate is 12%. The spot rate of exchange between the two currencies is 1.25. The forward rates refer to a 12-month forward contract. Example 1 illustrates the figures which have been described under the interest method of revaluation. Example 2 shows a similar deal using the interest/hedged method. Finally, example 3 compares the results of trading a round GBP deal amount, method 'IH', against the original example, method 'IN'. REVALUATION TYPE: 1) IN 2) IH 3) IH USD 'principal': n/a 1,250 1,116 GBP 'principal': n/a 1,000 893 USD interest yield: 178.5 175 156 GBP interest yield: 120 120 107 USD deal amount: 1,275 1,425 1,272 GBP deal amount: 1,000 1,120 1,000 USD/GBP forward rate: 1.275 1.2723 1.2723 This method of calculating interest yields associated with a forward contract is appropriate to a hedging situation where a forward foreign exchange deal is made in cover of balance sheet items. Because the notional principal amounts correspond to an actual spot transaction and are not the same as the resultant forward contract amounts, this revaluation type is not available for use on swap contracts (DEAL TYPE 'SW'). Straight Line Funding Method This method is primarily for the Swap contract type and it is similar to the 'SL' method except that the premium/discount of a Swap is amortised over the life of the deal in the currency that it arises. PM.PARAMETER needs to be changed to include the new position class if the SF reval type is defined on the file FX.REVAL.TYPE. Validation Rules: 2 alpha characters. (Optional input; Default as defined on the FX Deal Type table) Input not allowed for spot deals. Input must relate to a valid method as specified on the FX Reval Type table. For Swap contract type, it works the following way. In a Spot to Forward swap, input is allowed on the forward leg. In a forward to forward swap, input is allowed only in first leg and the value is defaulted to the second leg by system. Validations are performed based on the value present in the field FWD.FWD.SWAP. For forward Internal deals only the revaluation type 'RB' is allowed. Once authorised, the revaluation method cannot be amended. cannot be amended.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setRevaluationType

        public void setRevaluationType(TField value)
        Set the specified value for RevaluationType
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the revaluation methodto be used on forward contracts. The system handles five types of Revaluation: 'RB' = Rebate method 'SL' = Straight line 'IN' = Interest method 'IH' = Interest/hedged 'SF' = Straight line funding As it is the case for the spot contracts all open forward Foreign Exchange contracts are revalued on an individual deal basis using the current market rates. The forward rates used for the rebate revaluation are obtained from the FORWARD.RATE Table and where a rate is not available for a particular value date it is calculated by interpoltation, or the exchange rate of the nearest date will be selected according to the value defined on the REVALUATION.PARAMETER table. For the revaluation applicable to unmatured forward contracts, T24, allows the user to choose, at deal level, between five different methods. Rebate Method This is the most straightforward method as it is based (like the spot revaluation) on the cost or profit attributable to closing the position, i.e. to enter into a deal at today's rates to exactly cover each deal at its maturity (buy back approach). In the case of forward deals, the rate varies not only because of change in the market (supply and demand factors) but also because rates vary with time. For any given forward deal, as it ages, the rate to cover it, converges with the spot rate as it gets closer to maturity, until it will, eventually be covered at spot rate. Given a set of forward rates (FORWARD.RATES tables), the user can still choose between 3 methods to find the forward rate applicable to each forward contract, i.e: - Interpolation - Next available rate - Closest rate His choice will be indicated on the REVALUATION.PARAMETER table. The following explains how the interpolation works within FOREX. It is the only method where a rate will be found for each day. Interpolation of forward Exchange Rates The rates on the forward exchange rate table (FORWARD.RATES) can be defined for any period required by the user, (e.g. 1 week, 2 weeks, 15 days, 1 month, 2 months, 3 months etc..). The actual value date that the forward rates apply to are calculated as the: Reporting date + 2 working days + number of months. If this date is not a working day, then the next working day is used. When a date is required for a value date that falls between the dates of two rates on the table, then it is interpolated as follows: a) Number of days bbetween the dates of the two rates: TOTALDAYS = Latest Rate Date - Earliest Rate Date b) Difference between rates: DIFFERENCE = Latest Rate - Earliest Rate c) Rate of change per day: RATE OF CHANGE = DIFFERENCE ---------- TOTALDAYS d) The number of days to the required value date from the earliest date is multiplied by the rate of change, then the result is added to the earliest rate: DAYS = Required Value Date - Earliest Rate Date REQUIRED RATE = Earliest Rate + DAYS * RATEOFCHANGE Straight Line Method As previously stated, there is generally a difference between spot and forward rates. (ACCOUNT.CLASS file = RESERVE). Effectively this deal is now being carried at spot rate (since the forward discount or premium is being accrued) and therefore, it is necessary to revalue it each day just as if it was a spot deal using the technique described in 'Spot Revaluation'. Example : Assume the yield on GBP is 12% and that on USD is 14% with a Spot rate of 1.25. Then, over 12 months GBP 1000 would yield GBP 120 interest. Likewise, if exchanged (@1.25) USD 1250 would yield USD 175 interest. Thus, in order not to sustain a loss, the 12 month Forward USD sell rate should be (USD 1425/GBP1120) or 1.2723. i.e. USD 1425 * 1.2723 = GBP 1120 In practice, one of the amounts on the Forward deal is held at the same value as for the Spot deal. So, in this example, if the forward deal is also for GBP 1000 the USD amount would be USD 1275 (i.e. USD 1250 plus 2% interest differential thereon of USD 25). Therefore, it is argued that the Discount on the forward USD 12 month rate is simply to offset the 2% USD interest premium prevailing at the time of the deal. This apparent exchange Profit or Loss, therefore, should be accrued over the life of the forward deal as in the manner of the straight line method except that Profit and Loss Interest entries will now be booked for both the currency bought (credit to Interest Received Exchange) and the currency sold (debit to Interest Paid Exchange). Using the same example: A loan of USD 1250 yields USD 175 over 12 months. Over the same time a debit (revaluation) accrual is made of USD 25 (i.e. USD 1250 * 2%). Thus the net result is interest received of USD 150. As proof that this is correct, GBP 1000 at 12% would have given rise to GBP 120 interest, which converted at spot of 1.25 is also USD 150. The effect of this accrual (to discount the forward premium or discount) is to value the position at spot rate so it is, therefore, necessary each day to perform spot revaluation. This method is obviously most appropriate to the transaction type 'Swap' where an actual loan and deposit could be booked with a spot and foward deal and the real interest rates can be used on the forward leg, so rendering the deal entirely neutral. That is, the difference between interest paid and received will be eliminated by the forward accrual and the spot deal will be cancelled, in its effect, by the spot revaluation of the forward leg. Interest/hedged Method Like the interest method, this revaluation type takes into account the difference in the interest yield of one currency compared with that of the currency for which it is exchanged. However, the interest/hedged method bases its interest calculations not on the actual amounts of the deal, but on a 'notional' principal amount on each side (buy & sell). The notional principal amount is that amount which, given the interest rates applicable to each currency of the contract, would yield the actual amounts of the deal over the contract term. In other words, the deal amounts are effectively split into a principal and interest element and it is this interest element which is accrued on each side of the deal over its life. The difference between the interest and interest/hedged methods can be illustrated by example. In all cases, the USD interest rate is 14% and the GBP interest rate is 12%. The spot rate of exchange between the two currencies is 1.25. The forward rates refer to a 12-month forward contract. Example 1 illustrates the figures which have been described under the interest method of revaluation. Example 2 shows a similar deal using the interest/hedged method. Finally, example 3 compares the results of trading a round GBP deal amount, method 'IH', against the original example, method 'IN'. REVALUATION TYPE: 1) IN 2) IH 3) IH USD 'principal': n/a 1,250 1,116 GBP 'principal': n/a 1,000 893 USD interest yield: 178.5 175 156 GBP interest yield: 120 120 107 USD deal amount: 1,275 1,425 1,272 GBP deal amount: 1,000 1,120 1,000 USD/GBP forward rate: 1.275 1.2723 1.2723 This method of calculating interest yields associated with a forward contract is appropriate to a hedging situation where a forward foreign exchange deal is made in cover of balance sheet items. Because the notional principal amounts correspond to an actual spot transaction and are not the same as the resultant forward contract amounts, this revaluation type is not available for use on swap contracts (DEAL TYPE 'SW'). Straight Line Funding Method This method is primarily for the Swap contract type and it is similar to the 'SL' method except that the premium/discount of a Swap is amortised over the life of the deal in the currency that it arises. PM.PARAMETER needs to be changed to include the new position class if the SF reval type is defined on the file FX.REVAL.TYPE. Validation Rules: 2 alpha characters. (Optional input; Default as defined on the FX Deal Type table) Input not allowed for spot deals. Input must relate to a valid method as specified on the FX Reval Type table. For Swap contract type, it works the following way. In a Spot to Forward swap, input is allowed on the forward leg. In a forward to forward swap, input is allowed only in first leg and the value is defaulted to the second leg by system. Validations are performed based on the value present in the field FWD.FWD.SWAP. For forward Internal deals only the revaluation type 'RB' is allowed. Once authorised, the revaluation method cannot be amended. cannot be amended.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setRoundingRule

        public void setRoundingRule(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for RoundingRule
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field will hold contract level rounding rule for calculating either amount bought or amount sold. For a given rate and a given amount in either AMOUNT.BOUGHT or AMOUNT.SOLD, the other amount viz. AMOUNT.SOLD or AMOUNT.BOUGHT will be rounded off based on the Rounding Rule. Validation Rules: Should be a valid EB.ROUNDING.RULE id. No change permitted after first authorization Default value is taken from the field ROUNDING.RULE in FX.PARAMETERS For detailed options on different rounding types help text on EB.ROUNDING.RULE file can be referred.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setRoundingRule

        public void setRoundingRule(TField value)
        Set the specified value for RoundingRule
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field will hold contract level rounding rule for calculating either amount bought or amount sold. For a given rate and a given amount in either AMOUNT.BOUGHT or AMOUNT.SOLD, the other amount viz. AMOUNT.SOLD or AMOUNT.BOUGHT will be rounded off based on the Rounding Rule. Validation Rules: Should be a valid EB.ROUNDING.RULE id. No change permitted after first authorization Default value is taken from the field ROUNDING.RULE in FX.PARAMETERS For detailed options on different rounding types help text on EB.ROUNDING.RULE file can be referred.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setSelAccTdateF

        public void setSelAccTdateF(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for SelAccTdateF
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the foreign currency amount of the profit or loss accrued to-date on the 'Swap' or 'Forward' contract where the revaluation type 'IN' or 'IH' has been specified. This field will be increased daily by the amount specified in the daily accrual foreign currency table. In the case of Forward or Swap contracts done under the Interest revaluation method, the amount, which will be generated automatically by the system in this field, will be calculated based on the INT.RATE.SELL, i.e. the daily interest amount (expressed in foreign currency) generated by the AMOUNT.SOLD at the INT.RATE.SELL. This field will then be incremented each day by the value of the daily (foreign currency) amount. In the case of Forward contracts done under the interest/hedged revaluation method, the amount, which will be generated automatically by the system in this field, will be calculated based on the INT.RATE.SELL, i.e. the daily interest amount (expressed in foreign currency) generated by the NOTIONAL.SELL.AMT at the INT.RATE.SELL. This field will then be incremented each day by the value of the daily (foreign currency) amount. Example: Let us suppose a Forward transaction whereby: 6MTH FWD we buy IM USD against 2,150,000 DEM. The spot rate is equal to 2.20 The INT.RATE.BUY is equal to 12% The INT.RATE.SELL is equal to 7,5773% The system will then calculate the daily interest amount on the amount sold, i.e. 2,150,000.00 x 75773 x 1 -------------------------- = DEM 452.54 36000 which, converted at the rate of 3.2250, produces a daily accrual in local currency of GBP (local currency) 140.32. Consequently the value of this field will be DEM 452.54 after the first day, then DEM 905.08 etc. to DEM 83,719.90 on the maturity date. Note: 1. Under the Straight Line revaluation Method, this field will not be activated. 2. More information on the Straight Line and Interest revaluation method can be found in the Help Text for REVALUATION.TYPE. 3. The following rules will be followed for the conversion of the foreign currency accrual amount to its local currency equivalent: - When the contract involves local currency, it will be converted at the contract FORWARD.RATE. - When the contract does not involve the local currency, the BASE currency accrual amount will be converted at the CURRENCY table middle rate and the non-base accrual amount at the contract FORWARD.RATE and the CURRENCY table middle rate of the BASE currency. Validation Rules: No input allowed. Standard amount format.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setSelAccTdateF

        public void setSelAccTdateF(TField value)
        Set the specified value for SelAccTdateF
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the foreign currency amount of the profit or loss accrued to-date on the 'Swap' or 'Forward' contract where the revaluation type 'IN' or 'IH' has been specified. This field will be increased daily by the amount specified in the daily accrual foreign currency table. In the case of Forward or Swap contracts done under the Interest revaluation method, the amount, which will be generated automatically by the system in this field, will be calculated based on the INT.RATE.SELL, i.e. the daily interest amount (expressed in foreign currency) generated by the AMOUNT.SOLD at the INT.RATE.SELL. This field will then be incremented each day by the value of the daily (foreign currency) amount. In the case of Forward contracts done under the interest/hedged revaluation method, the amount, which will be generated automatically by the system in this field, will be calculated based on the INT.RATE.SELL, i.e. the daily interest amount (expressed in foreign currency) generated by the NOTIONAL.SELL.AMT at the INT.RATE.SELL. This field will then be incremented each day by the value of the daily (foreign currency) amount. Example: Let us suppose a Forward transaction whereby: 6MTH FWD we buy IM USD against 2,150,000 DEM. The spot rate is equal to 2.20 The INT.RATE.BUY is equal to 12% The INT.RATE.SELL is equal to 7,5773% The system will then calculate the daily interest amount on the amount sold, i.e. 2,150,000.00 x 75773 x 1 -------------------------- = DEM 452.54 36000 which, converted at the rate of 3.2250, produces a daily accrual in local currency of GBP (local currency) 140.32. Consequently the value of this field will be DEM 452.54 after the first day, then DEM 905.08 etc. to DEM 83,719.90 on the maturity date. Note: 1. Under the Straight Line revaluation Method, this field will not be activated. 2. More information on the Straight Line and Interest revaluation method can be found in the Help Text for REVALUATION.TYPE. 3. The following rules will be followed for the conversion of the foreign currency accrual amount to its local currency equivalent: - When the contract involves local currency, it will be converted at the contract FORWARD.RATE. - When the contract does not involve the local currency, the BASE currency accrual amount will be converted at the CURRENCY table middle rate and the non-base accrual amount at the contract FORWARD.RATE and the CURRENCY table middle rate of the BASE currency. Validation Rules: No input allowed. Standard amount format.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setSelAccTdateL

        public void setSelAccTdateL(TField value)
        Set the specified value for SelAccTdateL
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the daily local currency amount of the profit or loss accrued to-date for the 'Swap' or 'Forward' contracts when the revaluation type 'SL', 'IN' and 'IH' has been specified. This field will be increased daily by the amount specified in the daily accrual local currency field. In the case of Forward or Swap contracts done under the Straight Line revaluation method, the amount, which will be generated automatically by the system in this field, will be calculated based on the apparent exchange LOSS generated by the forward nature of the transaction. This apparent exchange loss expressed in local currency (i.e. the difference between BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SEL.LCY.EQUIV) will be spread over the period of the contract to provide a per dium accrual amount in local currency. In the case of Forward or Swap contracts done under the Interest revaluation method, the amount, which will be generated automatically by the system in this field, will be calculated based on the INT.RATE.SELL, i.e. the daily interest amount (expressed in local currency) generated by the AMOUNT.SOLD at the INT.RATE.SELL.. In both cases, this field will be incremented each day by the value of the daily (local currency) amount. Examples: 1. Straight Line revaluation method Let us suppose a Forward transaction whereby: 6MTH FWD we buy IM USD against 2,250,000 DEM (the Spot rate being 2.20) The apparent loss, i.e. DEM 50,000.00 will be accrued daily during the 6 month period (185 days in our example) and will generate a daily accrual of DEM 50,000.00 : 185 = DEM 270.27 which, converted at the rate of 3.30, produces a daily accrual in local currency of GBP (local currency) 81.90 Consequently the value of this field will be GBP 81.90 after the first day, then GBP 163.80 etc. to GBP 15,151.51 (i.e. DEM 50,000.00) on the maturity date. 2. Interest revaluation method Let us suppose a Forward transaction whereby: 6MTH FWD we buy IM USD against 2,150,000 DEM. The spot rate is equal to 2.20 The INT.RATE.BUY is equal to 12% The INT.RATE.SELL is equal to 7,5773% The system will then calculate the daily interest amount on the amount sold, i.e. 2,150,000.00 x 7,5773 x 1 --------------------------- = DEM 452.54 36000 which, converted at the rate of 3.2250 produces a daily accrual in local currency of GBP (local currency) 140.32. Consequently the value of this field will be GBP 140.32 after the first day, then GBP 280.64 etc. to GBP 25,959.60 on the maturity date. Notes: 1. Under the Straight Line revaluation Method, this field will only be activated when the exchange contract has been done with a loss, i.e. the BUY.LCY.EQUIV is smaller (in absolute value) than the SEL.LCY.EQUIV. 2. Under the Interest revaluation method, the difference between the value generated in this field and the value generated in the field BUY.DAILY.ACC.L will correspond exactly to the daily accrual generated under the Straight Line revaluation method. Validation Rules: System generated. Standard amount format.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setSelAccTdateL

        public void setSelAccTdateL(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for SelAccTdateL
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the daily local currency amount of the profit or loss accrued to-date for the 'Swap' or 'Forward' contracts when the revaluation type 'SL', 'IN' and 'IH' has been specified. This field will be increased daily by the amount specified in the daily accrual local currency field. In the case of Forward or Swap contracts done under the Straight Line revaluation method, the amount, which will be generated automatically by the system in this field, will be calculated based on the apparent exchange LOSS generated by the forward nature of the transaction. This apparent exchange loss expressed in local currency (i.e. the difference between BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SEL.LCY.EQUIV) will be spread over the period of the contract to provide a per dium accrual amount in local currency. In the case of Forward or Swap contracts done under the Interest revaluation method, the amount, which will be generated automatically by the system in this field, will be calculated based on the INT.RATE.SELL, i.e. the daily interest amount (expressed in local currency) generated by the AMOUNT.SOLD at the INT.RATE.SELL.. In both cases, this field will be incremented each day by the value of the daily (local currency) amount. Examples: 1. Straight Line revaluation method Let us suppose a Forward transaction whereby: 6MTH FWD we buy IM USD against 2,250,000 DEM (the Spot rate being 2.20) The apparent loss, i.e. DEM 50,000.00 will be accrued daily during the 6 month period (185 days in our example) and will generate a daily accrual of DEM 50,000.00 : 185 = DEM 270.27 which, converted at the rate of 3.30, produces a daily accrual in local currency of GBP (local currency) 81.90 Consequently the value of this field will be GBP 81.90 after the first day, then GBP 163.80 etc. to GBP 15,151.51 (i.e. DEM 50,000.00) on the maturity date. 2. Interest revaluation method Let us suppose a Forward transaction whereby: 6MTH FWD we buy IM USD against 2,150,000 DEM. The spot rate is equal to 2.20 The INT.RATE.BUY is equal to 12% The INT.RATE.SELL is equal to 7,5773% The system will then calculate the daily interest amount on the amount sold, i.e. 2,150,000.00 x 7,5773 x 1 --------------------------- = DEM 452.54 36000 which, converted at the rate of 3.2250 produces a daily accrual in local currency of GBP (local currency) 140.32. Consequently the value of this field will be GBP 140.32 after the first day, then GBP 280.64 etc. to GBP 25,959.60 on the maturity date. Notes: 1. Under the Straight Line revaluation Method, this field will only be activated when the exchange contract has been done with a loss, i.e. the BUY.LCY.EQUIV is smaller (in absolute value) than the SEL.LCY.EQUIV. 2. Under the Interest revaluation method, the difference between the value generated in this field and the value generated in the field BUY.DAILY.ACC.L will correspond exactly to the daily accrual generated under the Straight Line revaluation method. Validation Rules: System generated. Standard amount format.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setSelDailyAccF

        public void setSelDailyAccF(TField value)
        Set the specified value for SelDailyAccF
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the daily foreign currency amount which is to be accrued on those 'Swap' or 'Forward' contracts where the revaluation type 'IN' or 'IH' has been specified. In the case of Forward or Swap contracts done under the Interest revaluation method, the amount, which will be generated automatically by the system in this field, will be calculated based on the INT.RATE.SELL, i.e. the daily interest amount (expressed in foreign currency) generated by the AMOUNT.SOLD at the INT.RATE.SELL. In the case of Forward contracts done under the interest/hedged revaluation method, the amount, which will be generated automatically by the system in this field, will be calculated based on the INT.RATE.SELL, i.e. the daily interest amount (expressed in foreign currency) generated by the NOTIONAL.SELL.AMT at the INT.RATE.SELL. Example: Let us suppose a Forward transaction whereby: 6MTH FWD we buy IM USD against 2,150,000 DEM. The spot rate is equal to 2.20 The INT.RATE.BUY is equal to 12% The INT.RATE.SELL is equal to 7,5773% The system will then calculate the daily interest amount on the amount sold, i.e. 2,150,000.00 x 7,5773 x 1 --------------------------- = DEM 452.54 36000 which, converted at the rate of 3.2250, produces a daily accrual in local currency of GBP (local currency) 140.32. The USD amount of 452.54 will then be recorded in this field. Note: 1. Under the Straight Line revaluation Method, this field will not be activated. 2. More information on the Straight Line and Interest revaluation method can be found in the Help Text for REVALUATION.TYPE. 3. The following rules will be followed for the conversion of the foreign currency accrual amount to its local currency equivalent: - When the contract involves local currency, it will be converted at the contract FORWARD.RATE. - When the contract does not involve the local currency, the BASE currency accrual amount will be converted at the CURRENCY table middle rate and the non-base accrual amount at the contract FORWARD.RATE and the CURRENCY table middle rate of the BASE currency. Validation Rules: System generated. Standard amount format.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setSelDailyAccF

        public void setSelDailyAccF(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for SelDailyAccF
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the daily foreign currency amount which is to be accrued on those 'Swap' or 'Forward' contracts where the revaluation type 'IN' or 'IH' has been specified. In the case of Forward or Swap contracts done under the Interest revaluation method, the amount, which will be generated automatically by the system in this field, will be calculated based on the INT.RATE.SELL, i.e. the daily interest amount (expressed in foreign currency) generated by the AMOUNT.SOLD at the INT.RATE.SELL. In the case of Forward contracts done under the interest/hedged revaluation method, the amount, which will be generated automatically by the system in this field, will be calculated based on the INT.RATE.SELL, i.e. the daily interest amount (expressed in foreign currency) generated by the NOTIONAL.SELL.AMT at the INT.RATE.SELL. Example: Let us suppose a Forward transaction whereby: 6MTH FWD we buy IM USD against 2,150,000 DEM. The spot rate is equal to 2.20 The INT.RATE.BUY is equal to 12% The INT.RATE.SELL is equal to 7,5773% The system will then calculate the daily interest amount on the amount sold, i.e. 2,150,000.00 x 7,5773 x 1 --------------------------- = DEM 452.54 36000 which, converted at the rate of 3.2250, produces a daily accrual in local currency of GBP (local currency) 140.32. The USD amount of 452.54 will then be recorded in this field. Note: 1. Under the Straight Line revaluation Method, this field will not be activated. 2. More information on the Straight Line and Interest revaluation method can be found in the Help Text for REVALUATION.TYPE. 3.       • setSelDailyAccL

        public void setSelDailyAccL(TField value)
        Set the specified value for SelDailyAccL
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the daily local currency amount which is to be accrued on those 'Swaps' or 'Forward' contracts where the revaluation type 'SL', 'IN' or 'IH' has been specified. In the case of Forward or Swap contracts done under the Straight Line revaluation method, the amount, which will be generated automatically by the system in this field, will be calculated based on the apparent exchange LOSS generated by the forward nature of the transaction. This apparent exchange loss expressed in local currency (i.e. the difference between BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SEL.LCY.EQUIV) will be spread over the period of the contract to provide a per dium accrual amount in local currency. In the case of Forward or Swap contracts done under the Interest revaluation method, the amount, which will be generated automatically by the system in this field, will be calculated based on the INT.RATE.SELL, i.e. the daily interest amount (expressed in local currency) generated by the AMOUNT.SOLD at the INT.RATE.SELL. In the case of Forward or Swap contracts done under the interest/hedged revaluation method, the amount, which will be generated automatically by the system in this field, will be calculated based on the INT.RATE.SELL, i.e. the daily interest amount (expressed in local currency) generated by the NOTIONAL.SELL.AMT at the INT.RATE.SELL. Examples: 1. Straight Line revaluation method Let us suppose a Forward transaction whereby: 6MTH FWD we buy IM USD against 2,250,000 DEM (the Spot rate being 2.20) The apparent loss, i.e. DEM 50,000.00 will be accrued daily during the 6 month period (185 days in our example) and will generate a daily accrual of DEM 50,000.00 : 185 = DEM 270.27 which, converted at the rate of 3.30, produces a daily accrual in local currency of GBP (local currency) 81.90. This amount will then be recorded in this field. 2. Interest revaluation method Let us suppose a Forward transaction whereby: 6MTH FWD we buy IM USD against 2,150,000 DEM. The spot rate is equal to 2.20 The INT.RATE.BUY is equal to 12% The INT.RATE.SELL is equal to 7,5773% The system will then calculate the daily interest amount on the amount sold, i.e. 2,150,000.00 x 7,5773 x 1 --------------------------- = DEM 452.54 36000 which, converted at the rate of 3.2250 produces a daily accrual in local currency of GBP (local currency) 140.32. This amount will then be recorded in this field. Notes: 1. Under the Straight Line revaluation Method, this field will only be activated when the exchange contract has been done with a loss, i.e. the BUY.LCY.EQUIV is smaller (in absolute value) than the SEL.LCY.EQUIV. 2. Under the Interest revaluation method, the difference between the value generated in this field and the value generated in the field BUY.DAILY.ACC.L will correspond exactly to the daily accrual generated under the Straight Line revaluation method. Validation Rules: System generated. Standard amount format.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setSelDailyAccL

        public void setSelDailyAccL(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for SelDailyAccL
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the daily local currency amount which is to be accrued on those 'Swaps' or 'Forward' contracts where the revaluation type 'SL', 'IN' or 'IH' has been specified. In the case of Forward or Swap contracts done under the Straight Line revaluation method, the amount, which will be generated automatically by the system in this field, will be calculated based on the apparent exchange LOSS generated by the forward nature of the transaction. This apparent exchange loss expressed in local currency (i.e. the difference between BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SEL.LCY.EQUIV) will be spread over the period of the contract to provide a per dium accrual amount in local currency. In the case of Forward or Swap contracts done under the Interest revaluation method, the amount, which will be generated automatically by the system in this field, will be calculated based on the INT.RATE.SELL, i.e. the daily interest amount (expressed in local currency) generated by the AMOUNT.SOLD at the INT.RATE.SELL. In the case of Forward or Swap contracts done under the interest/hedged revaluation method, the amount, which will be generated automatically by the system in this field, will be calculated based on the INT.RATE.SELL, i.e. the daily interest amount (expressed in local currency) generated by the NOTIONAL.SELL.AMT at the INT.RATE.SELL. Examples: 1. Straight Line revaluation method Let us suppose a Forward transaction whereby: 6MTH FWD we buy IM USD against 2,250,000 DEM (the Spot rate being 2.20) The apparent loss, i.e. DEM 50,000.00 will be accrued daily during the 6 month period (185 days in our example) and will generate a daily accrual of DEM 50,000.00 : 185 = DEM 270.27 which, converted at the rate of 3.30, produces a daily accrual in local currency of GBP (local currency) 81.90. This amount will then be recorded in this field. 2. Interest revaluation method Let us suppose a Forward transaction whereby: 6MTH FWD we buy IM USD against 2,150,000 DEM. The spot rate is equal to 2.20 The INT.RATE.BUY is equal to 12% The INT.RATE.SELL is equal to 7,5773% The system will then calculate the daily interest amount on the amount sold, i.e. 2,150,000.00 x 7,5773 x 1 --------------------------- = DEM 452.54 36000 which, converted at the rate of 3.2250 produces a daily accrual in local currency of GBP (local currency) 140.32. This amount will then be recorded in this field. Notes: 1. Under the Straight Line revaluation Method, this field will only be activated when the exchange contract has been done with a loss, i.e. the BUY.LCY.EQUIV is smaller (in absolute value) than the SEL.LCY.EQUIV. 2. Under the Interest revaluation method, the difference between the value generated in this field and the value generated in the field BUY.DAILY.ACC.L will correspond exactly to the daily accrual generated under the Straight Line revaluation method. Validation Rules: System generated. Standard amount format.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setSelLcyEquiv

        public void setSelLcyEquiv(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for SelLcyEquiv
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the local currency equivalent of the currency being sold. The field will be calculated by the system and no operator input will be allowed. This local currency equivalent will be used when updating the currency position after successful validation. When Foreign Exchange deals are first entered into the foreign currency position, the local currency equivalent for both the BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SEL.LCY.EQUIV depends on the revaluation method specified in the corresponding contract. The following rules will be adhered to for each one of the revaluation methods below. REBATE METHOD The following rules will be followed: a) When the contract involves local currency It is always the local currency amount [AMOUNT.BOUGHT or AMOUNT.SOLD] which will be used to generate the local currency value in BOTH fields BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SEL.LCY.EQUIV. b) When the contract does not involve local currency The BASE amount of the contract will be converted at contract FORWARD.RATE and the forward rate of the other currency (non base currency) to generate the local currency value in BOTH fields BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SEL.LCY.EQUIV. If for example: SPOT GBP/DEM = 3,30 SPOT GBP/USD = 1,50 FWD 3 MONTH GBP/USD = 1,48 FWD 3 MONTH GBP/DEM = 3,24 the following local currency equivalents will be calculated by the system for the next deals: Deal 1 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 1.48 (Spot Rate) :(1.50) Currency & Amount Sold : GBP 675,675.68 Value Date : 6 Months Dealer Desk : 01 Revaluation Type : RB SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-675,675.68 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 675,675.68 Deal 2 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 2.18 (Spot Rate) :(2.20) Currency & Amount Sold : DEM 2,180,000.00 Value Date : 6 Months Dealer Desk : 02 Revaluation Type : RB SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-672,839.51 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 672,839.51 STRAIGHT LINE METHOD The following rules will be followed: a) When the contract involves local currency - The local currency amount of the contract will be kept to generate the local currency value in its corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV, i.e: if AMOUNT.BOUGHT = Local currency, then AMOUNT.BOUGHT = BUY.LCY.EQUIV if AMOUNT.SOLD = Local currency, then AMOUNT.SOLD = SEL.LCY.EQUIV - The foreign currency amount of the contract will be converted at the contract SPOT.RATE to generate the local currency value in its corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV. b) When the contract does not involve local currency - The BASE amount of the contract will be converted at the CURRENCY table middle rate of the BASE currency to generate the local Y.EQUIV. - The other foreign currency amount of the contract will be converted at the contract SPOT.RATE and the CURRENCY table middle rate of the BASE currency to generate the local currency value in its corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV. If for example: SPOT GBP/DEM = 3,30 SPOT GBP/USD = 1,50 the following local currency equivalents will be calculated by the system for the next deals: Deal 1 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 1.48 (Spot Rate) :(1.50) Currency & Amount Sold : GBP 675,675.68 Value Date : 6 Months Dealer Desk : 01 Revaluation Type : SL SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-666,666.67 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 675,675.68 Deal 2 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 2.18 (Spot Rate) :(2.20) Currency & Amount Sold : DEM 2,180,000.00 Value Date : 6 Months Dealer Desk : 02 BASE Currency : USD Revaluation Type : SL SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-666,666.67 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 660,606.06 INTEREST & INTEREST/HEDGED METHODS The same rules as the ones defined for the Straight Line method will be followed, i.e: a) When the contract involves local currency - The local currency amount of the contract will be kept to generate the local currency value in the corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV, i.e: if AMOUNT.BOUGHT = Local currency, then AMOUNT.BOUGHT = BUY.LCY.EQUIV if AMOUNT.SOLD = Local currency, then AMOUNT.SOLD = SEL.LCY.EQUIV - The foreign currency amount of the contract will be converted at the contract SPOT.RATE to generate the local currency value in its corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV. b) When the contract does not involve local currency - The BASE amount of the contract will be converted at the CURRENCY table middle rate of the BASE currency to generate the local currency value in its corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV. - The other foreign currency amount of the contract will be converted at the contract SPOT.RATE and the CURRENCY table middle rate of the BASE currency to generate the local currency value in its corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV. If for example: SPOT GBP/DEM = 3,30 SPOT GBP/USD = 1,50 the following local currency equivalents will be calculated by the system for the next deals: Deal 1 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 1.48 (Spot Rate) :(1.50) Currency & Amount Sold : GBP 675,675.68 Value Date : 6 Months Dealer Desk : 01 Revaluation Type : IN INTEREST.RATE.BUY : 6.964504654 INTEREST.RATE.SELL : 9.75 SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-666,666.67 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 675,675.68 Deal 2 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 2.18 (Spot Rate) :(2.20) Currency & Amount Sold : DEM 2,180,000.00 Value Date : 6 Months Dealer Desk : 02 BASE Currency : USD Revaluation Type : IN INTEREST.RATE.BUY : 6.00 INTEREST.RATE.SELL : 4.191863385 SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-666,666.67 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 660,606.06 SPOT CONTRACTS The following rules will be followed: a) Where either the actual amount bought or amount sold happens to be in the local currency of the country (Deal 1), this amount will be adopted as the local currency equivalent for the other currency so that the fields BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SEL.LCY.EQUIV on the main Foreign Exchange contract will contain this same value. It is also this local currency value which will be used to update the Foreign Exchange position once the deal has been successfully validated. b) Where the local currency is neither the currency bought nor the currency sold (Deal 2), the system will calculate the local currency equivalent of the BASE currency/amount and apply it to both currencies of the contract so that BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SEL.LCY.EQUIV on the main Foreign Exchange contract will also contain the same value. To calculate this local currency equivalent of the BASE amount, the system will take the existing middle rate of the base currency as defined on the CURRENCY table. We have supposed here that on the CURRENCY table the middle rate GBP/USD is equal to 1,50. Like in the previous case it is also this local currency equivalent which will be used to update the Foreign Exchange position once the deal has been successfully validated. If for example: SPOT GBP/DEM = 3,30 SPOT GBP/USD = 1,50 the following local currency equivalents will be calculated by the system for the next deals: Deal 1 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 1.5000 Currency & Amount Sold : GBP 666,666.67 Value Date : SPOT Dealer Desk : 01 SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-666,666.67 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 666,666.67 Deal 2 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 2,2000 Currency & Amount Sold : DEM 2,200,000.00 Value Date : SPOT Dealer Desk : 02 BASE Currency : USD SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-666,666.67 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 666,666.67 Validation Rules: System Generated. Standard Amount Format.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setSelLcyEquiv

        public void setSelLcyEquiv(TField value)
        Set the specified value for SelLcyEquiv
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the local currency equivalent of the currency being sold. The field will be calculated by the system and no operator input will be allowed. This local currency equivalent will be used when updating the currency position after successful validation. When Foreign Exchange deals are first entered into the foreign currency position, the local currency equivalent for both the BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SEL.LCY.EQUIV depends on the revaluation method specified in the corresponding contract. The following rules will be adhered to for each one of the revaluation methods below. REBATE METHOD The following rules will be followed: a) When the contract involves local currency It is always the local currency amount [AMOUNT.BOUGHT or AMOUNT.SOLD] which will be used to generate the local currency value in BOTH fields BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SEL.LCY.EQUIV. b) When the contract does not involve local currency The BASE amount of the contract will be converted at contract FORWARD.RATE and the forward rate of the other currency (non base currency) to generate the local currency value in BOTH fields BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SEL.LCY.EQUIV. If for example: SPOT GBP/DEM = 3,30 SPOT GBP/USD = 1,50 FWD 3 MONTH GBP/USD = 1,48 FWD 3 MONTH GBP/DEM = 3,24 the following local currency equivalents will be calculated by the system for the next deals: Deal 1 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 1.48 (Spot Rate) :(1.50) Currency & Amount Sold : GBP 675,675.68 Value Date : 6 Months Dealer Desk : 01 Revaluation Type : RB SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-675,675.68 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 675,675.68 Deal 2 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 2.18 (Spot Rate) :(2.20) Currency & Amount Sold : DEM 2,180,000.00 Value Date : 6 Months Dealer Desk : 02 Revaluation Type : RB SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-672,839.51 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 672,839.51 STRAIGHT LINE METHOD The following rules will be followed: a) When the contract involves local currency - The local currency amount of the contract will be kept to generate the local currency value in its corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV, i.e: if AMOUNT.BOUGHT = Local currency, then AMOUNT.BOUGHT = BUY.LCY.EQUIV if AMOUNT.SOLD = Local currency, then AMOUNT.SOLD = SEL.LCY.EQUIV - The foreign currency amount of the contract will be converted at the contract SPOT.RATE to generate the local currency value in its corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV. b) When the contract does not involve local currency - The BASE amount of the contract will be converted at the CURRENCY table middle rate of the BASE currency to generate the local Y.EQUIV. - The other foreign currency amount of the contract will be converted at the contract SPOT.RATE and the CURRENCY table middle rate of the BASE currency to generate the local currency value in its corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV. If for example: SPOT GBP/DEM = 3,30 SPOT GBP/USD = 1,50 the following local currency equivalents will be calculated by the system for the next deals: Deal 1 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 1.48 (Spot Rate) :(1.50) Currency & Amount Sold : GBP 675,675.68 Value Date : 6 Months Dealer Desk : 01 Revaluation Type : SL SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-666,666.67 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 675,675.68 Deal 2 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 2.18 (Spot Rate) :(2.20) Currency & Amount Sold : DEM 2,180,000.00 Value Date : 6 Months Dealer Desk : 02 BASE Currency : USD Revaluation Type : SL SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-666,666.67 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 660,606.06 INTEREST & INTEREST/HEDGED METHODS The same rules as the ones defined for the Straight Line method will be followed, i.e: a) When the contract involves local currency - The local currency amount of the contract will be kept to generate the local currency value in the corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV, i.e: if AMOUNT.BOUGHT = Local currency, then AMOUNT.BOUGHT = BUY.LCY.EQUIV if AMOUNT.SOLD = Local currency, then AMOUNT.SOLD = SEL.LCY.EQUIV - The foreign currency amount of the contract will be converted at the contract SPOT.RATE to generate the local currency value in its corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV. b) When the contract does not involve local currency - The BASE amount of the contract will be converted at the CURRENCY table middle rate of the BASE currency to generate the local currency value in its corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV. - The other foreign currency amount of the contract will be converted at the contract SPOT.RATE and the CURRENCY table middle rate of the BASE currency to generate the local currency value in its corresponding BUY.LCY.EQUIV or SEL.LCY.EQUIV. If for example: SPOT GBP/DEM = 3,30 SPOT GBP/USD = 1,50 the following local currency equivalents will be calculated by the system for the next deals: Deal 1 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 1.48 (Spot Rate) :(1.50) Currency & Amount Sold : GBP 675,675.68 Value Date : 6 Months Dealer Desk : 01 Revaluation Type : IN INTEREST.RATE.BUY : 6.964504654 INTEREST.RATE.SELL : 9.75 SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-666,666.67 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 675,675.68 Deal 2 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 2.18 (Spot Rate) :(2.20) Currency & Amount Sold : DEM 2,180,000.00 Value Date : 6 Months Dealer Desk : 02 BASE Currency : USD Revaluation Type : IN INTEREST.RATE.BUY : 6.00 INTEREST.RATE.SELL : 4.191863385 SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-666,666.67 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 660,606.06 SPOT CONTRACTS The following rules will be followed: a) Where either the actual amount bought or amount sold happens to be in the local currency of the country (Deal 1), this amount will be adopted as the local currency equivalent for the other currency so that the fields BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SEL.LCY.EQUIV on the main Foreign Exchange contract will contain this same value. It is also this local currency value which will be used to update the Foreign Exchange position once the deal has been successfully validated. b) Where the local currency is neither the currency bought nor the currency sold (Deal 2), the system will calculate the local currency equivalent of the BASE currency/amount and apply it to both currencies of the contract so that BUY.LCY.EQUIV and SEL.LCY.EQUIV on the main Foreign Exchange contract will also contain the same value. To calculate this local currency equivalent of the BASE amount, the system will take the existing middle rate of the base currency as defined on the CURRENCY table. We have supposed here that on the CURRENCY table the middle rate GBP/USD is equal to 1,50. Like in the previous case it is also this local currency equivalent which will be used to update the Foreign Exchange position once the deal has been successfully validated. If for example: SPOT GBP/DEM = 3,30 SPOT GBP/USD = 1,50 the following local currency equivalents will be calculated by the system for the next deals: Deal 1 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 1.5000 Currency & Amount Sold : GBP 666,666.67 Value Date : SPOT Dealer Desk : 01 SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-666,666.67 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 666,666.67 Deal 2 ------ Currency & Amount Bought : USD 1,000,000.00 Rate of Exchange : 2,2000 Currency & Amount Sold : DEM 2,200,000.00 Value Date : SPOT Dealer Desk : 02 BASE Currency : USD SPOT.LCY.AMT : 666,666.67 BUY.LCY.EQUIV :-666,666.67 SEL.LCY.EQUIV : 666,666.67 Validation Rules: System Generated. Standard Amount Format.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setSendAdvice

        public void setSendAdvice(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for SendAdvice
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Enables the operator to exercise control on the transmission of advices relating to the Foreign Exchange transaction. There are four conditions: N = Normal Transmission H = Hold Transmission P = Send with Priority U = Send with Urgency Validation Rules: 1 character as defined here above. (Optional input; Default value = 'N'.) Input may be only one of the values specified above.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setSendAdvice

        public void setSendAdvice(TField value)
        Set the specified value for SendAdvice
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Enables the operator to exercise control on the transmission of advices relating to the Foreign Exchange transaction. There are four conditions: N = Normal Transmission H = Hold Transmission P = Send with Priority U = Send with Urgency Validation Rules: 1 character as defined here above. (Optional input; Default value = 'N'.) Input may be only one of the values specified above.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setSendConfirmation

        public void setSendConfirmation(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for SendConfirmation
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Enables the operator to exercise control on the transmission of the confirmation relating to the Foreign Exchange transaction. There are five conditions: N = Normal Transmission H = Hold Transaction P = Send with Priority U = Send with Urgency O = One-sided (do not send). Validation Rules: 1 character as defined here above. (Optional input; Default value = 'N') Input may be only one of the values specified above.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setSendConfirmation

        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

      • setSodMat

        public void setSodMat(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for SodMat
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Start of Day maturity Entry of "Y" in this field indicates that the maturity processing will take place during Start of Day. Leaving the field blank means that maturity processing will take place at End of Day. This does not affect the sending of maturity payment or advice messages. Validation Rules: Blank or "Y"

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setSodMat

        public void setSodMat(TField value)
        Set the specified value for SodMat
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Start of Day maturity Entry of "Y" in this field indicates that the maturity processing will take place during Start of Day. Leaving the field blank means that maturity processing will take place at End of Day. This does not affect the sending of maturity payment or advice messages. Validation Rules: Blank or "Y"

        Returns:
        nothing

      • setSpotDate

        public void setSpotDate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for SpotDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used by the revaluation process to ascertain the starting date to be used for calculating profit or loss on forward contracts using the straight line, interest or interest/hedged revaluation method. This field is used when revaluing forward contracts using the straight line, interest or interest/hedged revaluation method. It contains the start date to be used for the calculation of any profit or loss. The spot date will normally be the deal date plus the number of days required to settle. This is defined on the FX Parameters table in the field Spot Market and will normally be two business days. Validation Rules: Any accepted T24 date format. Input in this field is optional for forward date contracts and its default value will be the Spot market date as defined on FX.PARAMETERS table. The number of days between the deal date and the spot date cannot be greater than the number of days defined in the field SPOT.INTERNAL on the FX.PARAMETERS table. The calculation of default spot date is also controlled by the FX.PARAMETERS fields FX.LCL.REGION and SPOT.BASE.CCY which allow the use of alternative or additional holiday tables. Must be greater than or equal to the deal date.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setSpotDate

        public void setSpotDate(TField value)
        Set the specified value for SpotDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used by the revaluation process to ascertain the starting date to be used for calculating profit or loss on forward contracts using the straight line, interest or interest/hedged revaluation method. This field is used when revaluing forward contracts using the straight line, interest or interest/hedged revaluation method. It contains the start date to be used for the calculation of any profit or loss. The spot date will normally be the deal date plus the number of days required to settle. This is defined on the FX Parameters table in the field Spot Market and will normally be two business days. Validation Rules: Any accepted T24 date format. Input in this field is optional for forward date contracts and its default value will be the Spot market date as defined on FX.PARAMETERS table. The number of days between the deal date and the spot date cannot be greater than the number of days defined in the field SPOT.INTERNAL on the FX.PARAMETERS table. The calculation of default spot date is also controlled by the FX.PARAMETERS fields FX.LCL.REGION and SPOT.BASE.CCY which allow the use of alternative or additional holiday tables. Must be greater than or equal to the deal date.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setSpotLcyAmount

        public void setSpotLcyAmount(TField value)
        Set the specified value for SpotLcyAmount
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is generated automatically by the system and will indicate the spot local currency amount. The system will select the base currency and amount and convert it at the CURRENCY table middle rate to provide the spot local currency amount. Validation Rules: Standard amount format. System generated.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setSpotLcyAmount

        public void setSpotLcyAmount(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for SpotLcyAmount
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is generated automatically by the system and will indicate the spot local currency amount.
